[[Your]0-i sister]426-your sister is [an amiable creature]734-an amiable creature ; but [yours]0-i is the character of decision and firmness , [I]0-i see . If [you]0-i value [her]729-her conduct or happiness , infuse as much of [your]0-i own spirit into [her]729-her as [you]0-i can . But this , no doubt , [you]0-i have been always doing . It is the worst evil of too yielding and indecisive a character , that no influence over it can be depended on . [You]0-i are never sure of a good impression being durable ; [everybody]2119-everybody may sway it . Let [those who would be happy]736-those who would be happy be firm . Here is a nut , ” said [he]0-i , catching one down from an upper bough , “[0-i] to exemplify : a beautiful glossy nut , which , blessed with original strength , has outlived all the storms of autumn . Not a puncture , not a weak spot anywhere . This nut , ” [he]0-i continued , with playful solemnity , “[729-her] while so many of [[his]729-her brethren]737-his brethren have fallen and been trodden under foot , is still in possession of all the happiness that a hazel nut can be supposed capable of . ” Then returning to [his]0-i former earnest tone—“My[738-they] first wish for all whom [I]0-i am interested in , is that [they]738-they should be firm . If [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa would be beautiful and happy in [her]118-louisa November of life , [she]118-louisa will cherish all [her]118-louisa present powers of mind . ” [He]0-i had done , and was unanswered . It would have surprised [Anne]89-anne if [Louisa]118-louisa could have readily answered such a speech : words of such interest , spoken with such serious warmth ! [She]89-anne could imagine what [Louisa]118-louisa was feeling . For [herself]118-louisa , [she]118-louisa feared to move , lest [she]118-louisa should be seen . While [she]118-louisa remained , a bush of low rambling holly protected [her]118-louisa , and [they]739-they were moving on . Before [they]739-they were beyond [her]118-louisa hearing , however , [Louisa]118-louisa spoke again . “[118-louisa] [Mary]90-mary is good - natured enough in many respects , ” said [she]118-louisa ; “[90-mary] but [she]90-mary does sometimes provoke [me]0-i excessively , by [her]90-mary nonsense and pride — the Elliot pride . [She]90-mary has a great deal too much of the Elliot pride . [We]739-they do so wish that [Charles]91-charles had married [Anne]89-anne instead . [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i know [he]91-charles wanted to marry [Anne]89-anne ? ” After a moment ’s pause , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth said — “[91-charles] Do [you]0-i mean that [she]90-mary refused [him]91-charles ? ” “[90-mary] Oh ! yes ; certainly . ” “[90-mary] When did that happen ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not exactly know , for [Henrietta]117-henrietta and [I]0-i were at [school]1848-school at the time ; but [I]0-i believe about a year before [he]91-charles married [Mary]90-mary . [I]0-i wish [she]90-mary had accepted [him]91-charles . [We]741-we should all have liked [her]90-mary a great deal better ; and [papa]430-papa and [mamma]463-mamma always think it was [[her]90-mary great friend]744-her great friend [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s doing , that [she]90-mary did not . [They]745-they think [Charles]91-charles might not be learned and bookish enough to please [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , and that therefore , [she]90-mary persuaded [Anne]89-anne to refuse [him]91-charles . ” The sounds were retreating , and [Anne]89-anne distinguished no more . [Her]89-anne own emotions still kept [her]89-anne fixed . [She]89-anne had much to recover from , before [she]89-anne could move . [The listener]2470-the listener ’s proverbial fate was not absolutely [hers]89-anne ; [she]89-anne had heard no evil of [herself]89-anne , but [she]89-anne had heard a great deal of very painful import . [She]89-anne saw how [her]89-anne own character was considered by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , and there had been just that degree of feeling and curiosity about [her]89-anne in [his]112-captain wentworth manner which must give [her]89-anne extreme agitation . As soon as [she]89-anne could , [she]89-anne went after [Mary]90-mary , and having found , and walked back with [her]90-mary to [[their]2471-they former station]2472-their former station , by the stile , felt some comfort in [[their]2471-they whole party]2473-their whole party being immediately afterwards collected , and once more in motion together . [Her]89-anne spirits wanted the solitude and silence which only numbers could give . [Charles]91-charles and [Henrietta]117-henrietta returned , bringing , as may be conjectured , [Charles Hayter]91-charles with [them]2471-they . The minutiae of the business [Anne]89-anne could not attempt to understand ; even [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth did not seem admitted to perfect confidence here ; but that there had been a withdrawing on [the gentleman]247-the gentleman ’s side , and a relenting on [the lady]2454-the lady ’s , and that [they]2471-they were now very glad to be together again , did not admit a doubt . [Henrietta]117-henrietta looked a little ashamed , but very well pleased;—Charles [Hayter]91-charles exceedingly happy : and [they]2471-they were devoted to [each other]1959-each other almost from the first instant of [their]2471-they all setting forward for [Uppercross]3-uppercross . Everything now marked out [Louisa]118-louisa for [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ; nothing could be plainer ; and where many divisions were necessary , or even where [they]2471-they were not , [they]2471-they walked side by side nearly as much as [the other two]2477-the other two . In [a long strip of meadow land]2478-a long strip of meadow land , where there was ample space for all , [they]2471-they were thus divided , forming [three distinct parties]2479-three distinct parties ; and to [that party of the three which boasted least animation , and least complaisance , [Anne]89-anne necessarily belonged]2480-that party of the three which boasted least animation , and least complaisance , anne necessarily belonged . [She]89-anne joined [Charles]91-charles and [Mary]90-mary , and was tired enough to be very glad of [Charles]91-charles ’s other arm ; but [Charles]91-charles , though in very good humour with [her]89-anne , was out of temper with [[his]91-charles wife]1699-his wife . [Mary]90-mary had shewn [herself]90-mary disobliging to [him]91-charles , and was now to reap the consequence , which consequence was [his]91-charles dropping [her]90-mary arm almost every moment to cut off the heads of some nettles in the hedge with [his]91-charles switch ; and when [Mary]90-mary began to complain of it , and lament [her]90-mary being ill - used , according to custom , in being on the hedge side , while [Anne]89-anne was never incommoded on the other , [he]91-charles dropped the arms of both to hunt after a weasel which [he]91-charles had a momentary glance of , and [they]2482-they could hardly get [him]91-charles along at all . [This long meadow]2483-this long meadow bordered a lane , which [[their]2482-they footpath]2484-their footpath , at the end of [it]2483-this long meadow was to cross , and when [the party]2010-the party had all reached the gate of exit , [the carriage]2151-the carriage advancing in the same direction , which had been some time heard , was just coming up , and proved to be [[Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft ’s gig]2487-admiral croft ’s gig . [He]106-admiral croft and [[his]106-admiral croft wife]1699-his wife had taken [their]2482-they intended drive , and were returning [home]1756-home . Upon hearing how long a walk [the young people]2052-the young people had engaged in , [they]2482-they kindly offered a seat to [any lady who might be particularly tired]2491-any lady who might be particularly tired ; it would save [her]2491-any lady who might be particularly tired a full mile , and [they]2482-they were going through [Uppercross]3-uppercross . The invitation was general , and generally declined . [The Miss Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves were not at all tired , and [Mary]90-mary was either offended , by not being asked before any of [the others]1828-the others , or what [Louisa]118-louisa called [the Elliot]89-anne pride could not endure to make a third in a one horse chaise . [The walking party]2493-the walking party had crossed [the lane]2494-the lane , and were surmounting an opposite stile , and [the Admiral]1880-the admiral was putting [his]1880-the admiral horse in motion again , when [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth cleared the hedge in a moment to say something to [[his]112-captain wentworth sister]2264-his sister . The something might be guessed by its effects . “[90-mary] [Miss Elliot]89-anne , [I]0-i am sure [you]89-anne are tired , ” cried [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft . “[89-anne] Do let [us]746-we have the pleasure of taking [you]89-anne [home]1756-home . [Here]376-here is excellent room for three , [I]0-i assure [you]89-anne . If [we]746-we were all like [you]89-anne , [I]0-i believe [we]746-we might sit four . [You]89-anne must , indeed , [you]89-anne must . ” [Anne]89-anne was still in [the lane]2494-the lane ; and though instinctively beginning to decline , [she]89-anne was not allowed to proceed . [The Admiral]1880-the admiral ’s kind urgency came in support of [[his]1880-the admiral wife]1699-his wife ’s ; [they]746-we would not be refused ; [they]746-we compressed [themselves]746-we into the smallest possible space to leave [her]89-anne a corner , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , without saying a word , turned to [her]89-anne , and quietly obliged [her]89-anne to be assisted into [the carriage]2151-the carriage . Yes ; [he]112-captain wentworth had done it . [She]89-anne was in [the carriage]2151-the carriage , and felt that [he]112-captain wentworth had placed [her]89-anne there , that [his]112-captain wentworth will and [his]112-captain wentworth hands had done it , that [she]89-anne owed it to [his]112-captain wentworth perception of [her]89-anne fatigue , and [his]112-captain wentworth resolution to give [her]89-anne rest . [She]89-anne was very much affected by the view of [his]112-captain wentworth disposition towards [her]89-anne , which all these things made apparent . This little circumstance seemed the completion of all that had gone before . [She]89-anne understood [him]112-captain wentworth . [He]112-captain wentworth could not forgive [her]89-anne , but [he]112-captain wentworth could not be unfeeling . Though condemning [her]89-anne for the past , and considering it with high and unjust resentment , though perfectly careless of [her]89-anne , and though becoming attached to another , still [he]112-captain wentworth could not see [her]89-anne suffer , without the desire of giving [her]89-anne relief . It was a remainder of former sentiment ; it was an impulse of pure , though unacknowledged friendship ; it was a proof of [his]112-captain wentworth own warm and amiable heart , which [she]89-anne could not contemplate without emotions so compounded of pleasure and pain , that [she]89-anne knew not which prevailed . [Her]89-anne answers to the kindness and the remarks of [[her]89-anne companions]2502-her companions were at first unconsciously given . [They]750-those two girls had travelled half [their]750-those two girls way along [the rough lane]2503-the rough lane , before [she]89-anne was quite awake to what [they]750-those two girls said . [She]89-anne then found [them]750-those two girls talking of “[112-captain wentworth] [Frederick]112-captain wentworth . ” “[112-captain wentworth] [He]112-captain wentworth certainly means to have [one or other of [those two girls]750-those two girls]749-one or other of those two girls , [Sophy]129-sophy , ” said [the Admiral]1880-the admiral ; “[129-sophy] but there is no saying which . [He]112-captain wentworth has been running after [them]750-those two girls , too , long enough , [one]1726-one would think , to make up [his]112-captain wentworth mind . Ay , this comes of the peace . If it were war now , [he]112-captain wentworth would have settled it long ago . [[We]752-we sailors]753-we sailors , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , can not afford to make long courtships in time of war . How many days was it , [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear , between the first time of [my]0-i seeing [you]351-my dear and [our]752-we sitting down together in [[our]752-we lodgings at [North Yarmouth]42-north yarmouth]755-our lodgings at north yarmouth ? ” “[752-we] [We]752-we had better not talk about it , [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear , ” replied [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , pleasantly ; “[752-we] for if [Miss Elliot]89-anne were to hear how soon [we]752-we came to an understanding , [she]89-anne would never be persuaded that [we]752-we could be happy together . [I]0-i had known [you]351-my dear by character , however , long before . ” “[0-i] Well , and [I]0-i had heard of [you]351-my dear as [a very pretty girl]1744-a very pretty girl , and what were [we]752-we to wait for besides ? [I]0-i do not like having such things so long in hand . [I]0-i wish [Frederick]112-captain wentworth would spread a little more canvass , and bring [us]752-we home one of [these young ladies]758-these young ladies to [Kellynch]5-kellynch . Then there would always be company for [them]758-these young ladies . And [very nice young ladies]759-very nice young ladies [they]758-these young ladies both are ; [I]0-i hardly know one from the other . ” “[760-unaffected girls] Very good humoured , [unaffected girls]760-unaffected girls , indeed , ” said [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , in a tone of calmer praise , such as made [Anne]89-anne suspect that [her]89-anne keener powers might not consider either of [them]758-these young ladies as quite worthy of [[her]89-anne brother]481-her brother ; “[760-unaffected girls] and [a very respectable family]761-a very respectable family . [One]1726-one could not be connected with [better people]763-better people . [[My]0-i dear]351-my dear [Admiral]106-admiral croft , that post ! [we]752-we shall certainly take that post . ” But by coolly giving the reins a better direction [herself]89-anne [they]752-we happily passed the danger ; and by once afterwards judiciously putting out [her]89-anne hand [they]752-we neither fell into a rut , nor ran foul of a dung - cart ; and [Anne]89-anne , with some amusement at [their]752-we style of driving , which [she]89-anne imagined no bad representation of the general guidance of [their]752-we affairs , found [herself]89-anne safely deposited by [them]752-we at [the Cottage]2078-the cottage . [CHAPTER XI]150-chapter xi . The time now approached for [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s return : the day was even fixed ; and [Anne]89-anne , being engaged to join [her]97-lady russell as soon as [she]89-anne was resettled , was looking forward to an early removal to [Kellynch]5-kellynch , and beginning to think how [her]89-anne own comfort was likely to be affected by it . It would place [her]89-anne in [the same village]2507-the same village with [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , within half a mile of [him]112-captain wentworth ; [they]752-we would have to frequent [the same church]2508-the same church , and there must be intercourse between [the two families]2033-the two families . This was against [her]89-anne ; but on the other hand , [he]112-captain wentworth spent so much of [his]112-captain wentworth time at [Uppercross]3-uppercross , that in removing thence [she]89-anne might be considered rather as leaving [him]112-captain wentworth behind , than as going towards [him]112-captain wentworth ; and , upon the whole , [she]89-anne believed [she]89-anne must , on this interesting question , be [the gainer]2510-the gainer , almost as certainly as in [her]89-anne change of domestic society , in leaving poor [Mary]90-mary for [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . [She]89-anne wished it might be possible for [her]89-anne to avoid ever seeing [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth at [the Hall]2511-the hall : [those rooms]2512-those rooms had witnessed former meetings which would be brought too painfully before [her]89-anne ; but [she]89-anne was yet more anxious for the possibility of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth never meeting anywhere . [They]2513-them did not like [each other]1959-each other , and no renewal of acquaintance now could do any good ; and were [Lady Russell]97-lady russell to see [them]2513-them together , [she]89-anne might think that [he]112-captain wentworth had too much self - possession , and [she]89-anne too little . These points formed [her]89-anne chief solicitude in anticipating [her]89-anne removal from [Uppercross]3-uppercross , where [she]89-anne felt [she]89-anne had been stationed quite long enough . [Her]89-anne usefulness to [little Charles]91-charles would always give some sweetness to the memory of [her]89-anne two months ’ visit [there]1845-there , but [he]112-captain wentworth was gaining strength apace , and [she]89-anne had nothing else to stay for . The conclusion of [her]89-anne visit , however , was diversified in a way which [she]89-anne had not at all imagined . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , after being unseen and unheard of at [Uppercross]3-uppercross for two whole days , appeared again among [them]2513-them to justify [himself]112-captain wentworth by a relation of what had kept [him]112-captain wentworth away . A letter from [[his]112-captain wentworth friend]2516-his friend , [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , having found [him]112-captain wentworth out at last , had brought intelligence of [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ’s being settled with [[his]151-captain harville family]1698-his family at [Lyme]43-lyme for the winter ; of [their]2513-them being therefore , quite unknowingly , within twenty miles of [each other]1959-each other . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville had never been in good health since a severe wound which [he]151-captain harville received two years before , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s anxiety to see [him]151-captain harville had determined [him]112-captain wentworth to go immediately to [Lyme]43-lyme . [He]112-captain wentworth had been [there]1845-there for four - and - twenty hours . [His]112-captain wentworth acquittal was complete , [his]112-captain wentworth friendship warmly honoured , a lively interest excited for [[his]112-captain wentworth friend]2516-his friend , and [his]112-captain wentworth description of [the fine country about [Lyme]43-lyme]2521-the fine country about lyme so feelingly attended to by [the party]2010-the party , that an earnest desire to see [Lyme]43-lyme [themselves]2513-them , and a project for going thither was the consequence . [The young people]2052-the young people were all wild to see [Lyme]43-lyme . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth talked of going [there]1845-there again [himself]112-captain wentworth , it was only seventeen miles from [Uppercross]3-uppercross ; though November , the weather was by no means bad ; and , in short , [Louisa]118-louisa , who was the most eager of [the eager , having formed the resolution to go]2525-the eager , having formed the resolution to go , and besides the pleasure of doing as [she]118-louisa liked , being now armed with the idea of merit in maintaining [her]118-louisa own way , bore down all the wishes of [[her]118-louisa father]1745-her father and [mother]1943-mother for putting it off till summer ; and to [Lyme]43-lyme [they]2052-the young people were to go — [Charles]91-charles , [Mary]90-mary , [Anne]89-anne , [Henrietta]117-henrietta , [Louisa]118-louisa , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . The first heedless scheme had been to go in the morning and return at night ; but to this [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , for the sake of [his]114-mrs musgrove horses , would not consent ; and when it came to be rationally considered , a day in the middle of November would not leave much time for seeing [a new place]2528-a new place , after deducting seven hours , as the nature of [the country]1758-the country required , for going and returning . [They]2052-the young people were , consequently , to stay the night there , and not to be expected back till the next day ’s dinner . This was felt to be a considerable amendment ; and though [they]2052-the young people all met at [the Great House]2032-the great house at rather an early breakfast hour , and set off very punctually , it was so much past noon before [the two carriages]2531-the two carriages , [[Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove ’s coach]2532-mr musgrove ’s coach containing [the four ladies]2533-the four ladies , and [Charles]91-charles ’s curricle , in which [he]114-mrs musgrove drove [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , were descending [the long hill]2534-the long hill into [Lyme]43-lyme , and entering upon [the still steeper street of [the town]2536-the town itself]2535-the still steeper street of the town itself , that it was very evident [they]2052-the young people would not have more than time for looking about [them]2052-the young people , before the light and warmth of the day were gone . After securing accommodations , and ordering a dinner at [one of [the inns]2538-the inns]2537-one of the inns , the next thing to be done was unquestionably to walk directly down to [the sea]327-the sea . [They]2052-the young people were come too late in the year for any amusement or variety which [Lyme]43-lyme , as [a public place]2540-a public place , might offer . [The rooms]2541-the rooms were shut up , [the lodgers]2542-the lodgers almost all gone , [scarcely any family]2543-scarcely any family but of [the residents]2544-the residents left ; and , as there is nothing to admire in [the buildings themselves]2545-the buildings themselves , the remarkable situation of [the town]2536-the town , [the principal street]2547-the principal street almost hurrying into [the water]2548-the water , the walk to [the Cobb]44-the cobb , skirting round [the pleasant little bay]2549-the pleasant little bay , which , in the season , is animated with bathing machines and company ; [the Cobb itself]2550-the cobb itself , [its]2550-the cobb itself old wonders and new improvements , with the very beautiful line of cliffs stretching out to [the east of [the town]2536-the town]2551-the east of the town , are what [the stranger]2553-the stranger ’s eye will seek ; and [a very strange stranger]2554-a very strange stranger it must be , who does not see charms in [the immediate environs of [Lyme]43-lyme]2555-the immediate environs of lyme , to make [him]2554-a very strange stranger wish to know it better . The scenes in [[its]43-lyme neighbourhood]2556-its neighbourhood , [Charmouth]45-charmouth , with [[its]43-lyme high grounds and [extensive sweeps of country]2558-extensive sweeps of country]2557-its high grounds and extensive sweeps of country , and still more , [[its]43-lyme sweet , retired bay]2559-its sweet , retired bay , backed by [dark cliffs , where fragments of low rock among the sands]2560-dark cliffs , where fragments of low rock among the sands , make [it]2559-its sweet , retired bay [the happiest spot]2561-the happiest spot for watching the flow of the tide , for sitting in unwearied contemplation ; [the woody varieties of [the cheerful village of Up Lyme]2563-the cheerful village of up lyme]2562-the woody varieties of the cheerful village of up lyme ; and , above all , [Pinny]46-pinny , with [its]46-pinny green chasms between romantic rocks , where the scattered forest trees and orchards of luxuriant growth , declare that [many a generation]2564-many a generation must have passed away since the first partial falling of the cliff prepared the ground for such a state , where a scene so wonderful and so lovely is exhibited , as may more than equal any of the resembling scenes of [the far - famed Isle of Wight]2565-the far - famed isle of wight : [these places]2566-these places must be visited , and visited again , to make the worth of [Lyme]43-lyme understood . [The party from [Uppercross]3-uppercross]2567-the party from uppercross passing down by [the now deserted and melancholy looking rooms]2568-the now deserted and melancholy looking rooms , and still descending , soon found [themselves]2567-the party from uppercross on [the sea - shore]2569-the sea - shore ; and lingering only , as [all]2570-all must linger and gaze on a first return to [the sea]327-the sea , who ever deserved to look on it at all , proceeded towards [the Cobb]44-the cobb , equally [their]2567-the party from uppercross object in itself and on [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s account : for in [a small house , near the foot of [an old pier of unknown date]2573-an old pier of unknown date]2572-a small house , near the foot of an old pier of unknown date , were [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles settled . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth turned in to call on [[his]112-captain wentworth friend]2516-his friend ; [the others]1828-the others walked on , and [he]112-captain wentworth was to join [them]1828-the others on [the Cobb]44-the cobb . [They]1828-the others were by no means tired of wondering and admiring ; and not even [Louisa]118-louisa seemed to feel that [they]1828-the others had parted with [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth long , when [they]1828-the others saw [him]112-captain wentworth coming after [them]1828-the others , with [three companions]2576-three companions , all well known already , by description , to be [Captain]594-captain and [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville , and [a Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , who was staying with [them]1828-the others . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick had some time ago been [first lieutenant of [the Laconia]22-the laconia]2578-first lieutenant of the laconia ; and the account which [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth had given of [him]153-captain benwick , on [his]153-captain benwick return from [Lyme]43-lyme before , [his]153-captain benwick warm praise of [him]153-captain benwick as [an excellent young man]2579-an excellent young man and an officer , whom [he]153-captain benwick had always valued highly , which must have stamped [him]153-captain benwick well in the esteem of [every listener]2580-every listener , had been followed by a little history of [his]153-captain benwick private life , which rendered [him]153-captain benwick perfectly interesting in the eyes of [all the ladies]2581-all the ladies . [He]153-captain benwick had been engaged to [[Captain Harville]151-captain harville ’s sister]2582-captain harville ’s sister , and was now mourning [her]2582-captain harville ’s sister loss . [They]2583-they had been a year or two waiting for fortune and promotion . [Fortune]154-fortune came , [his]153-captain benwick prize - money as [lieutenant]2584-lieutenant being great ; promotion , too , came at last ; but [Fanny Harville]155-fanny harville did not live to know it . [She]155-fanny harville had died the preceding summer while [he]153-captain benwick was at [sea]2137-sea . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth believed it impossible for [man]2586-man to be more attached to [woman]2587-woman than [poor Benwick]153-captain benwick had been to [Fanny Harville]155-fanny harville , or to be more deeply afflicted under the dreadful change . [He]112-captain wentworth considered [his]153-captain benwick disposition as of the sort which must suffer heavily , uniting very strong feelings with quiet , serious , and retiring manners , and a decided taste for reading , and sedentary pursuits . To finish the interest of the story , the friendship between [him]153-captain benwick and [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles seemed , if possible , augmented by the event which closed all [their]2583-they views of alliance , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick was now living with [them]2583-they entirely . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville had taken [[his]151-captain harville present house]2588-his present house for half a year ; [his]151-captain harville taste , and [his]151-captain harville health , and [his]151-captain harville fortune , all directing [him]151-captain harville to [a residence inexpensive]2589-a residence inexpensive , and by [the sea]327-the sea ; and the grandeur of [the country]1758-the country , and the retirement of [Lyme]43-lyme in the winter , appeared exactly adapted to [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ’s state of mind . The sympathy and good - will excited towards [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick was very great . “[106-admiral croft] And yet , ” said [Anne]89-anne to [herself]89-anne , as [they]2592-they now moved forward to meet the party , “[765-he] [he]765-he has not , perhaps , a more sorrowing heart than [I]0-i have . [I]0-i can not believe [his]765-he prospects so blighted for ever . [He]765-he is younger than [I]0-i am ; younger in feeling , if not in fact ; younger as [a man]307-a man . [He]765-he will rally again , and be happy with another . ” [They]2592-they all met , and were introduced . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville was [a tall , dark man , with a sensible , benevolent countenance]2593-a tall , dark man , with a sensible , benevolent countenance ; [a little lame ; and from strong features and want of health]2594-a little lame ; and from strong features and want of health , looking much older than [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick looked , and was , the youngest of the three , and , compared with either of [them]2592-they , [a little man]2595-a little man . [He]153-captain benwick had a pleasing face and a melancholy air , just as [he]153-captain benwick ought to have , and drew back from conversation . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , though not equalling [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth in manners , was [a perfect gentleman]2596-a perfect gentleman , unaffected , warm , and obliging . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville , a degree less polished than [[her]134-mrs harville husband]347-her husband , seemed , however , to have the same good feelings ; and nothing could be more pleasant than [their]2592-they desire of considering the whole party as [friends]2598-friends of [their]2592-they own , because [the friends of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth]2599-the friends of captain wentworth , or more kindly hospitable than [their]2592-they entreaties for [their]2592-they all promising to dine with [them]2592-they . The dinner , already ordered at [the inn]2600-the inn , was at last , though unwillingly , accepted as a excuse ; but [they]2592-they seemed almost hurt that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth should have brought [any such party]2601-any such party to [Lyme]43-lyme , without considering it as a thing of course that [they]2592-they should dine with [them]2592-they . There was so much attachment to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth in all this , and such a bewitching charm in a degree of hospitality so uncommon , so unlike the usual style of give - and - take invitations , and dinners of formality and display , that [Anne]89-anne felt [her]89-anne spirits not likely to be benefited by an increasing acquaintance among [[his]112-captain wentworth brother - officers]2602-his brother - officers . “[765-he] These would have been all [[my]0-i friends]767-my friends , ” was [her]89-anne thought ; and [she]89-anne had to struggle against a great tendency to lowness . On quitting [the Cobb]2603-the cobb , [they]2592-they all went in - doors with [[their]2592-they new friends]2604-their new friends , and found [rooms]2605-rooms so small as none but [those who invite from the heart]2606-those who invite from the heart could think capable of accommodating so many . [Anne]89-anne had a moment ’s astonishment on the subject [herself]89-anne ; but it was soon lost in the pleasanter feelings which sprang from the sight of all the ingenious contrivances and nice arrangements of [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , to turn the actual space to the best account , to supply the deficiencies of [lodging - house]2607-lodging - house furniture , and defend the windows and doors against the winter storms to be expected . The varieties in the fitting - up of [the rooms]2541-the rooms , where the common necessaries provided by [the owner]1886-the owner , in the common indifferent plight , were contrasted with some few articles of a rare species of wood , excellently worked up , and with something curious and valuable from [all the distant countries [Captain Harville]151-captain harville had visited]2610-all the distant countries captain harville had visited , were more than amusing to [Anne]89-anne ; connected as it all was with [his]151-captain harville profession , the fruit of [its]151-captain harville labours , the effect of its influence on [his]151-captain harville habits , the picture of repose and domestic happiness it presented , made it to [her]89-anne a something more , or less , than gratification . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville was [no reader]2611-no reader ; but [he]151-captain harville had contrived excellent accommodations , and fashioned very pretty shelves , for a tolerable collection of well - bound volumes , the property of [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . [His]151-captain harville lameness prevented [him]151-captain harville from taking much exercise ; but a mind of usefulness and ingenuity seemed to furnish [him]151-captain harville with constant employment within . [He]151-captain harville drew , [he]151-captain harville varnished , [he]151-captain harville carpentered , [he]151-captain harville glued ; [he]151-captain harville made toys for [the children]2080-the children ; [he]151-captain harville fashioned new netting - needles and pins with improvements ; and if everything else was done , sat down to [his]151-captain harville large fishing - net at one corner of [the room]1874-the room . [Anne]89-anne thought [she]89-anne left great happiness behind [her]89-anne when [they]2614-they quitted [the house]1780-the house ; and [Louisa]118-louisa , by whom [she]89-anne found [herself]89-anne walking , burst forth into raptures of admiration and delight on the character of [the navy]297-the navy ; [their]2614-they friendliness , [their]2614-they brotherliness , [their]2614-they openness , [their]2614-they uprightness ; protesting that [she]89-anne was convinced of [sailors]301-sailors having more worth and warmth than [any other set of men in [England]16-england]2618-any other set of men in england ; that [they]2614-they only knew how to live , and [they]2614-they only deserved to be respected and loved . [They]2614-they went back to dress and dine ; and so well had the scheme answered already , that nothing was found amiss ; though its being “[765-he] so entirely out of season , ” and the “[765-he] no thoroughfare of [Lyme]43-lyme , ” and the “[765-he] no expectation of company , ” had brought many apologies from [the heads of [the inn]2600-the inn]2619-the heads of the inn . [Anne]89-anne found [herself]89-anne by this time growing so much more hardened to being in [[Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s company]2621-captain wentworth ’s company than [she]89-anne had at first imagined could ever be , that the sitting down to the same table with [him]112-captain wentworth now , and the interchange of [the common civilities attending on it]2622-the common civilities attending on it ( [they]2614-they never got beyond ) , was become a mere nothing . The nights were too dark for [the ladies]2623-the ladies to meet again till the morrow , but [Captain Harville]151-captain harville had promised [them]2623-the ladies a visit in the evening ; and [he]151-captain harville came , bringing [[his]151-captain harville friend]2516-his friend also , which was more than had been expected , it having been agreed that [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick had all the appearance of being oppressed by the presence of so many [strangers]2276-strangers . [He]153-captain benwick ventured among [them]2623-the ladies again , however , though [his]153-captain benwick spirits certainly did not seem fit for the mirth of [the party]2010-the party in general . While [Captains Wentworth]156-captains wentworth and [Harville]151-captain harville led the talk on one side of [the room]1874-the room , and by recurring to former days , supplied anecdotes in abundance to occupy and entertain [the others]1828-the others , it fell to [Anne]89-anne ’s lot to be placed rather apart with [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ; and a very good impulse of [her]89-anne nature obliged [her]89-anne to begin an acquaintance with [him]153-captain benwick . [He]153-captain benwick was shy , and disposed to abstraction ; but the engaging mildness of [her]89-anne countenance , and gentleness of [her]89-anne manners , soon had their effect ; and [Anne]89-anne was well repaid the first trouble of exertion . [He]153-captain benwick was evidently [a young man of considerable taste in reading , though principally in poetry]2629-a young man of considerable taste in reading , though principally in poetry ; and besides the persuasion of having given [him]153-captain benwick at least an evening ’s indulgence in the discussion of subjects , which [[his]153-captain benwick usual companions]2630-his usual companions had probably no concern in , [she]89-anne had the hope of being of real use to [him]153-captain benwick in some suggestions as to the duty and benefit of struggling against affliction , which had naturally grown out of [their]2631-their conversation . For , though shy , [he]153-captain benwick did not seem reserved ; it had rather the appearance of feelings glad to burst their usual restraints ; and having talked of poetry , the richness of the present age , and gone through a brief comparison of opinion as to [the first - rate poets]2632-the first - rate poets , trying to ascertain whether [Marmion]157-marmion or [The Lady of the Lake]2633-the lady of the lake were to be preferred , and how ranked [the Giaour]158-the giaour and [The Bride of [Abydos]48-abydos]2634-the bride of abydos ; and moreover , how [the Giaour]158-the giaour was to be pronounced , [he]153-captain benwick showed [himself]153-captain benwick so intimately acquainted with all the tenderest songs of [the one poet]2635-the one poet , and all the impassioned descriptions of hopeless agony of the other ; [he]153-captain benwick repeated , with such tremulous feeling , the various lines which imaged a broken heart , or a mind destroyed by wretchedness , and looked so entirely as if [he]153-captain benwick meant to be understood , that [she]89-anne ventured to hope [he]153-captain benwick did not always read only poetry , and to say , that [she]89-anne thought it was the misfortune of poetry to be seldom safely enjoyed by [those who enjoyed it completely]2636-those who enjoyed it completely ; and that the strong feelings which alone could estimate it truly were the very feelings which ought to taste it but sparingly . [His]153-captain benwick looks shewing [him]153-captain benwick not pained , but pleased with this allusion to [his]153-captain benwick situation , [she]89-anne was emboldened to go on ; and feeling in [herself]89-anne the right of seniority of mind , [she]89-anne ventured to recommend a larger allowance of prose in [his]153-captain benwick daily study ; and on being requested to particularize , mentioned such works of [[our]2637-our best moralists]2638-our best moralists , such collections of the finest letters , such memoirs of characters of worth and suffering , as occurred to [her]89-anne at the moment as calculated to rouse and fortify the mind by the highest precepts , and the strongest examples of moral and religious endurances . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick listened attentively , and seemed grateful for the interest implied ; and though with a shake of the head , and sighs which declared [his]153-captain benwick little faith in the efficacy of any books on grief like [his]153-captain benwick , noted down the names of those [she]89-anne recommended , and promised to procure and read them . When the evening was over , [Anne]89-anne could not but be amused at the idea of [her]89-anne coming to [Lyme]43-lyme to preach patience and resignation to [a young man whom [she]89-anne had never seen before]2639-a young man whom she had never seen before ; nor could [she]89-anne help fearing , on more serious reflection , that , like [many other great moralists and preachers]2640-many other great moralists and preachers , [she]89-anne had been eloquent on a point in which [her]89-anne own conduct would ill bear examination . CHAPTER XII . [Anne]89-anne and [Henrietta]117-henrietta , finding [themselves]2641-they [the earliest of the party the next morning]2642-the earliest of the party the next morning , agreed to stroll down to [the sea]327-the sea before breakfast . [They]2641-they went to [the sands]2644-the sands , to watch the flowing of the tide , which a fine south - easterly breeze was bringing in with all the grandeur which so flat [a shore]2645-a shore admitted . [They]2641-they praised the morning ; gloried in [the sea]327-the sea ; sympathized in the delight of the fresh - feeling breeze — and were silent ; till [Henrietta]117-henrietta suddenly began again with — “[765-he] Oh ! yes,—I am quite convinced that , with very few exceptions , [the sea]327-the sea - air always does good . There can be no doubt of its having been of the greatest service to [Dr Shirley]148-dr shirley , after [his]148-dr shirley illness , last spring twelvemonth . [He]148-dr shirley declares [himself]148-dr shirley , that coming to [Lyme]43-lyme for a month , did [him]148-dr shirley more good than all the medicine [he]148-dr shirley took ; and that being by [the sea]327-the sea always makes [him]148-dr shirley feel young again . Now , [I]0-i can not help thinking it a pity that [he]148-dr shirley does not live entirely by [the sea]327-the sea . [I]0-i do think [he]148-dr shirley had better leave [Uppercross]3-uppercross entirely , and fix at [Lyme]43-lyme . Do not [you]771-you , [Anne]89-anne ? Do not [you]771-you agree with [me]0-i , that it is the best thing [he]148-dr shirley could do , both for [himself]148-dr shirley and [Mrs Shirley]159-mrs shirley ? [She]159-mrs shirley has [cousins]2125-cousins [here]376-here , [you]771-you know , and many acquaintance , which would make it cheerful for [her]159-mrs shirley , and [I]0-i am sure [she]159-mrs shirley would be glad to get to a place where [she]159-mrs shirley could have medical attendance at hand , in case of [his]148-dr shirley having another seizure . Indeed [I]0-i think it quite melancholy to have such excellent people as [Dr]148-dr shirley and [Mrs Shirley]159-mrs shirley , who have been doing good all [their]774-their lives , wearing out [their]774-their last days in [a place like [Uppercross]3-uppercross , where , excepting [[our]776-our family]777-our family , [they]774-their seem shut out from all [the world]1711-the world]775-a place like uppercross , where , excepting our family , they seem shut out from all the world . [I]0-i wish [[his]148-dr shirley friends]1830-his friends would propose it to [him]148-dr shirley . [I]0-i really think [they]1830-his friends ought . And , as to procuring a dispensation , there could be no difficulty at [his]148-dr shirley time of life , and with [his]148-dr shirley character . [My]0-i only doubt is , whether anything could persuade [him]148-dr shirley to leave [[his]148-dr shirley parish]780-his parish . [He]148-dr shirley is so very strict and scrupulous in [his]148-dr shirley notions ; over - scrupulous [I]0-i must say . Do not [you]781-you think , [Anne]89-anne , it is being over - scrupulous ? Do not [you]781-you think it is quite a mistaken point of conscience , when [a clergyman]782-a clergyman sacrifices [his]782-a clergyman health for the sake of duties , which may be just as well performed by [another person]783-another person ? And at [Lyme]43-lyme too , only seventeen miles off , [he]148-dr shirley would be near enough to hear , if [people]422-people thought there was anything to complain of . ” [Anne]89-anne smiled more than once to [herself]89-anne during this speech , and entered into the subject , as ready to do good by entering into the feelings of [a young lady]2647-a young lady as of [a young man]1938-a young man , though here it was good of a lower standard , for what could be offered but general acquiescence ? [She]89-anne said all that was reasonable and proper on the business ; felt the claims of [Dr Shirley]148-dr shirley to repose as [she]89-anne ought ; saw how very desirable it was that [he]148-dr shirley should have [some active , respectable young man]2649-some active , respectable young man as [a resident curate]2650-a resident curate , and was even courteous enough to hint at the advantage of [such resident curate]2651-such resident curate ’s being married . “[0-i] [I]0-i wish , ” said [Henrietta]117-henrietta , very well pleased with [[her]117-henrietta companion]2652-her companion , “[0-i] [I]0-i wish [Lady Russell]97-lady russell lived at [Uppercross]3-uppercross , and were intimate with [Dr Shirley]148-dr shirley . [I]0-i have always heard of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell as [a woman of the greatest influence with everybody]785-a woman of the greatest influence with everybody ! [I]0-i always look upon [her]97-lady russell as able to persuade [a person]786-a person to anything ! [I]0-i am afraid of [her]97-lady russell , as [I]0-i have told [you]787-you before , quite afraid of [her]97-lady russell , because [she]97-lady russell is so very clever ; but [I]0-i respect [her]97-lady russell amazingly , and wish [we]788-they had such [a neighbour at [Uppercross]3-uppercross]789-a neighbour at uppercross . ” [Anne]89-anne was amused by [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s manner of being grateful , and amused also that the course of events and the new interests of [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s views should have placed [[her]117-henrietta friend]2014-her friend at all in favour with [any of [the Musgrove family]2655-the musgrove family]2654-any of the musgrove family ; [she]89-anne had only time , however , for a general answer , and a wish that [such another woman]2656-such another woman were at [Uppercross]3-uppercross , before [all subjects]2657-all subjects suddenly ceased , on seeing [Louisa]118-louisa and [Captain]153-captain benwick [Wentworth]156-captains wentworth coming towards [them]788-they . [They]788-they came also for a stroll till breakfast was likely to be ready ; but [Louisa]118-louisa recollecting immediately afterwards that [she]118-louisa had something to procure at [a shop]2658-a shop , invited [them]788-they all to go back with [her]118-louisa into [the town]2536-the town . [They]788-they were all at [her]118-louisa disposal . When [they]788-they came to the steps , leading upwards from [the beach]2660-the beach , [a gentleman , at the same moment preparing to come down]2661-a gentleman , at the same moment preparing to come down , politely drew back , and stopped to give [them]788-they way . [They]788-they ascended and passed [him]2661-a gentleman , at the same moment preparing to come down ; and as [they]788-they passed , [Anne]89-anne ’s face caught [his]2661-a gentleman , at the same moment preparing to come down eye , and [he]2661-a gentleman , at the same moment preparing to come down looked at [her]89-anne with a degree of earnest admiration , which [she]89-anne could not be insensible of . [She]89-anne was looking remarkably well ; [her]89-anne very regular , very pretty features , having the bloom and freshness of youth restored by the fine wind which had been blowing on [her]89-anne complexion , and by the animation of eye which it had also produced . It was evident that [the gentleman]247-the gentleman , ( completely [a gentleman in manner]2663-a gentleman in manner ) admired [her]89-anne exceedingly . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth looked round at [her]89-anne instantly in a way which [shewed]112-captain wentworth [his]112-captain wentworth noticing of it . [He]112-captain wentworth gave [her]89-anne a momentary glance , a glance of brightness , which seemed to say , “[790-that man] [That man]790-that man is struck with [you]791-you , and even [I]0-i , at this moment , see something like [Anne Elliot]89-anne again . ” After attending [Louisa]118-louisa through [her]118-louisa business , and loitering about a little longer , [they]2664-they returned to [the inn]2600-the inn ; and [Anne]89-anne , in passing afterwards quickly from [[her]89-anne own chamber]2666-her own chamber to [[their]2664-they dining - room]2667-their dining - room , had nearly run against [the very same gentleman]2668-the very same gentleman , as [he]2668-the very same gentleman came out of [an adjoining apartment]2669-an adjoining apartment . [She]89-anne had before conjectured [him]2668-the very same gentleman to be [a stranger like [themselves]2664-they]2670-a stranger like themselves , and determined that [a well - looking groom]2671-a well - looking groom , who was strolling about near [the two inns]2672-the two inns as [they]2664-they came back , should be [[his]2668-the very same gentleman servant]2673-his servant . [Both master]2674-both master and [man]2586-man being in mourning assisted the idea . It was now proved that [he]2668-the very same gentleman belonged to [the same inn]2676-the same inn as [themselves]2664-they ; and this second meeting , short as it was , also proved again by [the gentleman]247-the gentleman ’s looks , that [he]2668-the very same gentleman thought [hers]89-anne very lovely , and by the readiness and propriety of [his]2668-the very same gentleman apologies , that [he]2668-the very same gentleman was [a man of exceedingly good manners]2678-a man of exceedingly good manners . [He]2668-the very same gentleman seemed about thirty , and though not handsome , had [an agreeable person]2679-an agreeable person . [Anne]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne should like to know who [he]2668-the very same gentleman was . [They]2664-they had nearly done breakfast , when the sound of [a carriage]414-a carriage , ( almost the first [they]2664-they had heard since entering [Lyme]43-lyme ) drew [half the party]2681-half the party to the window . It was [[a gentleman]1842-a gentleman ’s carriage]2683-a gentleman ’s carriage , a curricle , but only coming round from [the stable - yard]2684-the stable - yard to the front door ; [somebody]2685-somebody must be going away . It was driven by [a servant in mourning]2686-a servant in mourning . The word curricle made [Charles Musgrove]92-charles jump up that [he]2668-the very same gentleman might compare it with [his]2668-the very same gentleman own ; [the servant in mourning]2687-the servant in mourning roused [Anne]89-anne ’s curiosity , and [the whole six]2428-the whole six were collected to look , by the time [the owner of the curricle]2689-the owner of the curricle was to be seen issuing from the door amidst the bows and civilities of [the household]2690-the household , and taking [his]2689-the owner of the curricle seat , to drive off . “[89-anne] Ah ! ” cried [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , instantly , and with half a glance at [Anne]89-anne , “[89-anne] it is [the very man [we]793-they passed]792-the very man we passed . ” [The Miss Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves agreed to it ; and having all kindly watched [him]2689-the owner of the curricle as far up [the hill]2460-the hill as [they]793-they could , [they]793-they returned to the breakfast table . [The waiter]2692-the waiter came into [the room]1874-the room soon afterwards . “[792-the very man we passed] Pray , ” said [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , immediately , “[792-the very man we passed] can [you]794-you tell [us]793-they the name of [the gentleman who is just gone away]795-the gentleman who is just gone away ? ” “[794-you] Yes , [Sir]592-sir , [a Mr Elliot]797-a mr elliot , [a gentleman of large fortune]798-a gentleman of large fortune , came in last night from [Sidmouth]49-sidmouth . Dare say [you]592-sir heard [the carriage]2151-the carriage , [sir]592-sir , while [you]592-sir were at dinner ; and going on now for [Crewkherne]160-crewkherne , in [his]797-a mr elliot way to [Bath]9-bath and [London]6-london . ” “[89-anne] [Elliot]89-anne ! ” [Many]2694-many had looked on [each other]1959-each other , and [many]2694-many had repeated the name , before all this had been got through , even by the smart rapidity of [a waiter]2697-a waiter . “[89-anne] Bless [me]0-i ! ” cried [Mary]90-mary ; “[89-anne] it must be [[our]801-our cousin]802-our cousin ; it must be [[our]801-our [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot]803-our mr elliot , it must , indeed ! [Charles]92-charles , [Anne]89-anne , must not it ? In mourning , [you]592-sir see , just as [our]801-our Mr [Elliot]98-mr elliot must be . How very extraordinary ! In [the very same inn]804-the very same inn with [us]801-our ! [Anne]89-anne , must not it be [[our]801-our [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot]803-our mr elliot ? [[my]0-i father ’s next heir]806-my father ’s next heir ? Pray [sir]592-sir , ” turning to [the waiter]2692-the waiter , “[592-sir] did not [you]592-sir hear , did not [[his]98-mr elliot servant]2673-his servant say whether [he]98-mr elliot belonged to [the Kellynch family]809-the kellynch family ? ” “[98-mr elliot] No , [ma’am]648-ma’am , [he]98-mr elliot did not mention [no particular family]811-no particular family ; but [he]98-mr elliot said [[his]98-mr elliot master]812-his master was [a very rich gentleman]813-a very rich gentleman , and would be [a baronight some day]814-a baronight some day . ” “[98-mr elliot] There ! [you]592-sir see ! ” cried [Mary]90-mary in an ecstasy , “[98-mr elliot] just as [I]0-i said ! Heir to [Sir Walter Elliot]86-sir walter ! [I]0-i was sure that would come out , if it was so . Depend upon it , that is a circumstance which [[his]98-mr elliot servants]815-his servants take care to publish , wherever [he]98-mr elliot goes . But , [Anne]89-anne , only conceive how extraordinary ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had looked at [him]98-mr elliot more . [I]0-i wish [we]816-we had been aware in time , who it was , that [he]98-mr elliot might have been introduced to [us]816-we . What a pity that [we]816-we should not have been introduced to [each other]1959-each other ! Do [you]592-sir think [he]98-mr elliot had the [Elliot]98-mr elliot countenance ? [I]0-i hardly looked at [him]98-mr elliot , [I]0-i was looking at the horses ; but [I]0-i think [he]98-mr elliot had something of the Elliot countenance , [I]0-i wonder the arms did not strike [me]0-i ! Oh ! the great - coat was hanging over the panel , and hid the arms , so it did ; otherwise , [I]0-i am sure , [I]0-i should have observed them , and the livery too ; if [the servant]818-the servant had not been in mourning , [one]1726-one should have known [him]98-mr elliot by the livery . ” “[1726-one] Putting all these very extraordinary circumstances together , ” said [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , “[1726-one] [we]816-we must consider it to be the arrangement of [Providence]113-providence , that [you]592-sir should not be introduced to [[your]592-sir cousin]820-your cousin . ” When [she]592-sir could command [Mary]90-mary ’s attention , [Anne]89-anne quietly tried to convince [her]90-mary that [[their]816-we father]2200-their father and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had not , for many years , been on such terms as to make the power of attempting an introduction at all desirable . At the same time , however , it was a secret gratification to [herself]592-sir to have seen [[her]592-sir cousin]620-her cousin , and to know that [the future owner of [Kellynch]5-kellynch]2701-the future owner of kellynch was undoubtedly [a gentleman]1842-a gentleman , and had an air of good sense . [She]592-sir would not , upon any account , mention [her]592-sir having met with [him]98-mr elliot the second time ; luckily [Mary]90-mary did not much attend to [their]816-we having passed close by [him]98-mr elliot in [their]816-we earlier walk , but [she]90-mary would have felt quite ill - used by [Anne]89-anne ’s having actually run against [him]98-mr elliot in [the passage]2703-the passage , and received [his]98-mr elliot very polite excuses , while [she]592-sir had never been near [him]98-mr elliot at all ; no , that cousinly little interview must remain a perfect secret . “[113-providence] Of course , ” said [Mary]90-mary , “[821-you] [you]821-you will mention [our]822-our seeing [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , the next time [you]821-you write to [Bath]9-bath . [I]0-i think [[my]0-i father]275-my father certainly ought to hear of it ; do mention all about [him]98-mr elliot . ” [Anne]89-anne avoided a direct reply , but it was just the circumstance which [she]89-anne considered as not merely unnecessary to be communicated , but as what ought to be suppressed . The offence which had been given [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father , many years back , [she]89-anne knew ; [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ’s particular share in it [she]89-anne suspected ; and that [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s idea always produced irritation in both was beyond a doubt . [Mary]90-mary never wrote to [Bath]1840-bath [herself]90-mary ; all the toil of keeping up a slow and unsatisfactory correspondence with [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth fell on [Anne]89-anne . Breakfast had not been long over , when [they]2706-they were joined by [Captain]594-captain and [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ; with whom [they]2706-they had appointed to take [their]2706-they last walk about [Lyme]43-lyme . [They]2706-they ought to be setting off for [Uppercross]3-uppercross by one , and in the meanwhile were to be all together , and out of doors as long as [they]2706-they could . [Anne]89-anne found [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick getting near [her]89-anne , as soon as [they]2706-they were all fairly in [the street]2708-the street . [Their]2706-they conversation the preceding evening did not disincline [him]153-captain benwick to seek [her]89-anne again ; and [they]2706-they walked together some time , talking as before of [Mr Scott]162-mr scott and [Lord Byron]163-lord byron , and still as unable as before , and as unable as [any other two readers]2709-any other two readers , to think exactly alike of the merits of either , till something occasioned an almost general change amongst [[their]2706-they party]2710-their party , and instead of [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , [she]89-anne had [Captain Harville]151-captain harville by [her]89-anne side . “[0-i] [Miss Elliot]89-anne , ” said [he]0-i , speaking rather low , “[0-i] [you]89-anne have done a good deed in making [that poor fellow]824-that poor fellow talk so much . [I]0-i wish [he]824-that poor fellow could have such company oftener . It is bad for [him]824-that poor fellow , [I]0-i know , to be shut up as [he]824-that poor fellow is ; but what can [we]825-we do ? [We]825-we can not part . ” “[825-we] No , ” said [Anne]89-anne , “[825-we] that [I]0-i can easily believe to be impossible ; but in time , perhaps — [we]825-we know what time does in every case of affliction , and [you]0-i must remember , [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , that [[your]0-i friend]826-your friend may yet be called [a young mourner]827-a young mourner — only last summer , [I]0-i understand . ” “[0-i] Ay , true enough , ” ( with a deep sigh ) “[0-i] only [June]164-june . ” “[0-i] And not known to [him]824-that poor fellow , perhaps , so soon . ” “[0-i] Not till the first week of August , when [he]824-that poor fellow came [home]1756-home from [the Cape]50-the cape , just made into [the Grappler]165-the grappler . [I]0-i was at [Plymouth]27-plymouth dreading to hear of [him]824-that poor fellow ; [he]824-that poor fellow sent in letters , but [the Grappler]829-the grappler was under orders for [Portsmouth]32-portsmouth . There the news must follow [him]824-that poor fellow , but who was to tell it ? not I. [I]0-i would as soon have been run up to [the yard - arm]830-the yard - arm . [Nobody]271-nobody could do it , but [that good fellow]832-that good fellow ” ( pointing to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ) . “[832-that good fellow] [The Laconia]22-the laconia had come into [Plymouth]27-plymouth the week before ; no danger of [her]833-her being sent to [sea]2137-sea again . [He]824-that poor fellow stood [his]824-that poor fellow chance for the rest ; wrote up for leave of absence , but without waiting the return , travelled night and day till [he]824-that poor fellow got to [Portsmouth]32-portsmouth , rowed off to [the Grappler]165-the grappler that instant , and never left [the poor fellow]835-the poor fellow for a week . That ’s what [he]824-that poor fellow did , and [nobody else]1827-nobody else could have saved [poor James]88-james stevenson . [You]837-you may think , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , whether [he]824-that poor fellow is dear to [us]838-us ! ” [Anne]89-anne did think on the question with perfect decision , and said as much in reply as [her]89-anne own feeling could accomplish , or as [his]824-that poor fellow seemed able to bear , for [he]824-that poor fellow was too much affected to renew the subject , and when [he]824-that poor fellow spoke again , it was of something totally different . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s giving it as [her]134-mrs harville opinion that [[her]134-mrs harville husband]347-her husband would have quite walking enough by the time [he]824-that poor fellow reached [home]1756-home , determined the direction of [all the party]2713-all the party in what was to be [their]2713-all the party last walk ; [they]2713-all the party would accompany [them]2713-all the party to [their]2713-all the party door , and then return and set off [themselves]2713-all the party . By all [their]2713-all the party calculations there was just time for this ; but as [they]2713-all the party drew near [the Cobb]44-the cobb , there was such a general wish to walk along [it]44-the cobb once more , [all]2570-all were so inclined , and [Louisa]118-louisa soon grew so determined , that the difference of a quarter of an hour , it was found , would be no difference at all ; so with all the kind leave - taking , and all the kind interchange of invitations and promises which may be imagined , [they]2713-all the party parted from [Captain]594-captain and [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville at [their]2713-all the party own door , and still accompanied by [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , who seemed to cling to [them]2713-all the party to the last , proceeded to make the proper adieus to [the Cobb]44-the cobb . [Anne]89-anne found [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick again drawing near [her]89-anne . [Lord Byron]163-lord byron ’s “[89-anne] dark blue seas ” could not fail of being brought forward by [their]2713-all the party present view , and [she]89-anne gladly gave [him]153-captain benwick all [her]89-anne attention as long as attention was possible . It was soon drawn , perforce another way . There was too much wind to make the high part of [the new Cobb]2716-the new cobb pleasant for [the ladies]2623-the ladies , and [they]2713-all the party agreed to get down the steps to the lower , and [all]2570-all were contented to pass quietly and carefully down the steep flight , excepting [Louisa]118-louisa ; [she]118-louisa must be jumped down [them]2719-them by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . In all [their]2713-all the party walks , [he]112-captain wentworth had had to jump [her]118-louisa from the stiles ; the sensation was delightful to [her]118-louisa . The hardness of the pavement for [her]118-louisa feet , made [him]112-captain wentworth less willing upon the present occasion ; [he]112-captain wentworth did it , however . [She]118-louisa was safely down , and instantly , to show [her]118-louisa enjoyment , ran up the steps to be jumped down again . [He]112-captain wentworth advised [her]118-louisa against it , thought the jar too great ; but no , [he]112-captain wentworth reasoned and talked in vain , [she]118-louisa smiled and said , “[0-i] [I]0-i am determined [I]0-i will : ” [he]112-captain wentworth put out [his]112-captain wentworth hands ; [she]118-louisa was too precipitate by half a second , [she]118-louisa fell on the pavement on [the Lower Cobb]51-the lower cobb , and was taken up lifeless ! There was no wound , no blood , no visible bruise ; but [her]118-louisa eyes were closed , [she]118-louisa breathed not , [her]118-louisa face was like death . The horror of the moment to [all who stood around]2720-all who stood around ! [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , who had caught [her]118-louisa up , knelt with [her]118-louisa in [his]112-captain wentworth arms , looking on [her]118-louisa with a face as pallid as [her]118-louisa own , in an agony of silence . “[0-i] [She]839-she is dead ! [she]839-she is dead ! ” screamed [Mary]90-mary , catching hold of [[her]90-mary husband]347-her husband , and contributing with [his]347-her husband own horror to make [him]347-her husband immoveable ; and in another moment , [Henrietta]117-henrietta , sinking under the conviction , lost [her]117-henrietta senses too , and would have fallen on the steps , but for [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick and [Anne]89-anne , who caught and supported [her]117-henrietta between [them]2722-them . “[839-she] Is there [no one]1949-no one to help [me]0-i ? ” were the first words which burst from [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , in a tone of despair , and as if all [his]112-captain wentworth own strength were gone . “[839-she] Go to [him]841-him , go to [him]841-him , ” cried [Anne]89-anne , “[839-she] for heaven ’s sake go to [him]841-him . [I]0-i can support [her]841-him [myself]0-i . Leave [me]0-i , and go to [him]841-him . Rub [her]841-him hands , rub [her]841-him temples ; here are salts ; take them , take them . ” [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick obeyed , and [Charles]92-charles at the same moment , disengaging [himself]92-charles from [[his]153-captain benwick wife]1699-his wife , [they]2724-they were both with [him]153-captain benwick ; and [Louisa]118-louisa was raised up and supported more firmly between [them]2724-they , and everything was done that [Anne]89-anne had prompted , but in vain ; while [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , staggering against the wall for [his]112-captain wentworth support , exclaimed in the bitterest agony — “[1745-her father] Oh [God]135-god ! [[her]841-him father]1745-her father and [mother]1943-mother ! ” “[844-a surgeon] [A surgeon]844-a surgeon ! ” said [Anne]89-anne . [He]153-captain benwick caught the word ; it seemed to rouse [him]153-captain benwick at once , and saying only—“True[844-a surgeon] , true , [a surgeon]844-a surgeon this instant , ” was darting away , when [Anne]89-anne eagerly suggested — “[844-a surgeon] [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , would not it be better for [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ? [He]153-captain benwick knows where [a surgeon]844-a surgeon is to be found . ” [Every one capable of thinking]2725-every one capable of thinking felt the advantage of the idea , and in a moment ( it was all done in rapid moments ) [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick had resigned the poor corpse - like figure entirely to [the brother]2324-the brother ’s care , and was off for [the town]2536-the town with the utmost rapidity . As to [the wretched party left behind]2728-the wretched party left behind , it could scarcely be said which of [the three , who were completely rational]2729-the three , who were completely rational , was suffering most : [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , [Anne]89-anne , or [Charles]92-charles , who , really [a very affectionate brother]2730-a very affectionate brother , hung over [Louisa]118-louisa with sobs of grief , and could only turn [his]153-captain benwick eyes from [one sister]2731-one sister , to see the other in a state as insensible , or to witness the hysterical agitations of [[his]153-captain benwick wife]1699-his wife , calling on [him]153-captain benwick for help which [he]153-captain benwick could not give . [Anne]89-anne , attending with all the strength and zeal , and thought , which instinct supplied , to [Henrietta]117-henrietta , still tried , at intervals , to suggest comfort to [the others]1828-the others , tried to quiet [Mary]90-mary , to animate [Charles]92-charles , to assuage the feelings of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . [Both]2734-both seemed to look to [her]89-anne for directions . “[153-captain benwick] [Anne]89-anne , [Anne]89-anne , ” cried [Charles]92-charles , “[89-anne] What is to be done next ? What , in heaven ’s name , is to be done next ? ” [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s eyes were also turned towards [her]89-anne . “[89-anne] Had not [she]847-her better be carried to [the inn]2600-the inn ? Yes , [I]0-i am sure : carry [her]847-her gently to [the inn]2600-the inn . ” “[0-i] Yes , yes , to [the inn]2600-the inn , ” repeated [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , comparatively collected , and eager to be doing something . “[0-i] [I]0-i will carry [her]847-her [myself]0-i . [Musgrove]92-charles , take care of [the others]1828-the others . ” By this time the report of the accident had spread among [the workmen]2735-the workmen and [boatmen]2736-boatmen about [the Cobb]44-the cobb , and [many]2694-many were collected near [them]44-the cobb , to be useful if wanted , at any rate , to enjoy the sight of [a dead young lady]2738-a dead young lady , nay , [two dead young ladies]2739-two dead young ladies , for it proved twice as fine as the first report . To [some of the best - looking of [these good people]2741-these good people]2740-some of the best - looking of these good people [Henrietta]117-henrietta was consigned , for , though partially revived , [she]117-henrietta was quite helpless ; and in this manner , [Anne]89-anne walking by [her]117-henrietta side , and [Charles]92-charles attending to [[his]0-i wife]1699-his wife , [they]2741-these good people set forward , treading back with feelings unutterable , the ground , which so lately , so very lately , and so light of heart , [they]2741-these good people had passed along . [They]2741-these good people were not off [the Cobb]44-the cobb , before [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles met [them]2741-these good people . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick had been seen flying by [[their]2741-these good people house]2743-their house , with a countenance which showed something to be wrong ; and [they]2741-these good people had set off immediately , informed and directed as [they]2741-these good people passed , towards the spot . Shocked as [Captain Harville]151-captain harville was , [he]151-captain harville brought senses and nerves that could be instantly useful ; and a look between [him]151-captain harville and [[his]151-captain harville wife]1699-his wife decided what was to be done . [She]1699-his wife must be taken to [[their]2741-these good people house]2743-their house ; [all]2570-all must go to [[their]2741-these good people house]2743-their house ; and await [the surgeon]2748-the surgeon ’s arrival there . [They]2741-these good people would not listen to scruples : [he]151-captain harville was obeyed ; [they]2741-these good people were all beneath [his]151-captain harville roof ; and while [Louisa]118-louisa , under [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s direction , was conveyed up [stairs]2225-stairs , and given possession of [her]118-louisa own bed , assistance , cordials , restoratives were supplied by [[her]118-louisa husband]347-her husband to all who needed [them]2741-these good people . [Louisa]118-louisa had once opened [her]118-louisa eyes , but soon closed them again , without apparent consciousness . This had been a proof of life , however , of service to [[her]118-louisa sister]1946-her sister ; and [Henrietta]117-henrietta , though perfectly incapable of being in [the same room]2256-the same room with [Louisa]118-louisa , was kept , by the agitation of hope and fear , from a return of [her]117-henrietta own insensibility . [Mary]90-mary , too , was growing calmer . [The surgeon]2748-the surgeon was with [them]2741-these good people almost before it had seemed possible . [They]2741-these good people were sick with horror , while [he]2748-the surgeon examined ; but [he]2748-the surgeon was not hopeless . The head had received a severe contusion , but [he]2748-the surgeon had seen greater injuries recovered from : [he]2748-the surgeon was by no means hopeless ; [he]2748-the surgeon spoke cheerfully . That [he]2748-the surgeon did not regard it as a desperate case , that [he]2748-the surgeon did not say a few hours must end it , was at first felt , beyond the hope of most ; and the ecstasy of such a reprieve , the rejoicing , deep and silent , after a few fervent ejaculations of gratitude to Heaven had been offered , may be conceived . The tone , the look , with which “[92-charles] Thank [God]135-god ! ” was uttered by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , [Anne]89-anne was sure could never be forgotten by [her]89-anne ; nor the sight of [him]112-captain wentworth afterwards , as [he]112-captain wentworth sat near a table , leaning over it with folded arms and face concealed , as if overpowered by the various feelings of [his]112-captain wentworth soul , and trying by prayer and reflection to calm [them]2741-these good people . [Louisa]118-louisa ’s limbs had escaped . There was no injury but to the head . It now became necessary for [the party]2010-the party to consider what was best to be done , as to [their]2741-these good people general situation . [They]2741-these good people were now able to speak to [each other]1959-each other and consult . That [Louisa]118-louisa must remain where [she]118-louisa was , however distressing to [[her]118-louisa friends]1712-her friends to be involving [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles in such trouble , did not admit a doubt . [Her]118-louisa removal was impossible . [The Harvilles]152-the harvilles silenced all scruples ; and , as much as [they]2741-these good people could , all gratitude . [They]2741-these good people had looked forward and arranged everything before [the others]1828-the others began to reflect . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick must give up [[his]153-captain benwick room]2758-his room to [them]2741-these good people , and get another bed elsewhere ; and the whole was settled . [They]2741-these good people were only concerned that [the house]1780-the house could accommodate no more ; and yet perhaps , by “[92-charles] putting [the children]2080-the children away in [[the maid]853-the maid ’s room]854-the maid ’s room , or swinging a cot somewhere , ” [they]2741-these good people could hardly bear to think of not finding room for [two or three besides]2760-two or three besides , supposing [they]2741-these good people might wish to stay ; though , with regard to any attendance on [Miss Musgrove]118-louisa , there need not be the least uneasiness in leaving [her]118-louisa to [[Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s care]2761-mrs harville ’s care entirely . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville was [a very experienced nurse]2762-a very experienced nurse , and [[her]134-mrs harville nursery - maid , who had lived with [her]134-mrs harville long , and gone about with [her]134-mrs harville everywhere]2763-her nursery - maid , who had lived with her long , and gone about with her everywhere , was just such another . Between these two , [she]134-mrs harville could want no possible attendance by day or night . And all this was said with a truth and sincerity of feeling irresistible . [Charles]92-charles , [Henrietta]117-henrietta , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth were [the three]2764-the three in consultation , and for a little while it was only an interchange of perplexity and terror . “[92-charles] [Uppercross]3-uppercross , the necessity of [some one]2402-some one ’s going to [Uppercross]3-uppercross ; the news to be conveyed ; how it could be broken to [Mr and Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove ; the lateness of the morning ; an hour already gone since [they]856-they ought to have been off ; the impossibility of being in tolerable time . ” At first , [they]856-they were capable of nothing more to the purpose than such exclamations ; but , after a while , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , exerting [himself]112-captain wentworth , said — “[857-we] [We]857-we must be decided , and without the loss of another minute . Every minute is valuable . [Some one]2402-some one must resolve on being off for [Uppercross]3-uppercross instantly . [Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , either [you]114-mrs musgrove or [I]0-i must go . ” [Charles]92-charles agreed , but declared [his]112-captain wentworth resolution of not going away . [He]112-captain wentworth would be as little incumbrance as possible to [Captain]594-captain and [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ; but as to leaving [[his]112-captain wentworth sister]2264-his sister in such a state , [he]112-captain wentworth neither ought , nor would . So far it was decided ; and [Henrietta]117-henrietta at first declared the same . [She]117-henrietta , however , was soon persuaded to think differently . The usefulness of [her]117-henrietta staying ! [She]117-henrietta who had not been able to remain in [[Louisa]118-louisa ’s room]2767-louisa ’s room , or to look at [her]118-louisa , without sufferings which made [her]117-henrietta worse than helpless ! [She]117-henrietta was forced to acknowledge that [she]117-henrietta could do no good , yet was still unwilling to be away , till , touched by the thought of [[her]117-henrietta father]1745-her father and [mother]1943-mother , [she]117-henrietta gave it up ; [she]117-henrietta consented , [she]117-henrietta was anxious to be at [home]1756-home . The plan had reached this point , when [Anne]89-anne , coming quietly down from [[Louisa]118-louisa ’s room]2767-louisa ’s room , could not but hear what followed , for the parlour door was open . “[114-mrs musgrove] Then it is settled , [Musgrove]118-louisa , ” cried [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , “[118-louisa] that [you]118-louisa stay , and that [I]0-i take care of [[your]118-louisa sister]426-your sister [home]1756-home . But as to the rest , as to the others , if [one]1726-one stays to assist [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville , [I]0-i think it need be [only one]862-only one . [Mrs Charles Musgrove]92-charles will , of course , wish to get back to [[her]134-mrs harville children]1713-her children ; but if [Anne]89-anne will stay , [no one]1949-no one so proper , so capable as [Anne]89-anne . ” [She]118-louisa paused a moment to recover from the emotion of hearing [herself]118-louisa so spoken of . [The other two]2477-the other two warmly agreed with what [he]0-i said , and [she]118-louisa then appeared . “[1949-no one] [You]118-louisa will stay , [I]0-i am sure ; [you]118-louisa will stay and nurse [her]426-your sister ; ” cried [he]0-i , turning to [her]118-louisa and speaking with a glow , and yet a gentleness , which seemed almost restoring the past . [She]118-louisa coloured deeply , and [he]0-i recollected [himself]0-i and moved away . [She]118-louisa expressed [herself]118-louisa most willing , ready , happy to remain . “[118-louisa] It was what [she]426-your sister had been thinking of , and wishing to be allowed to do .
