[A bed on the floor in [[Louisa]118-louisa ’s room]2767-louisa ’s room]865-a bed on the floor in louisa ’s room would be sufficient for [her]426-your sister , if [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville would but think so . ” One thing more , and all seemed arranged . Though it was rather desirable that [Mr]2773-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles should be previously alarmed by some share of delay ; yet the time required by the Uppercross horses to take [them]2767-louisa ’s room back , would be a dreadful extension of suspense ; and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth proposed , and [Charles Musgrove]92-charles agreed , that it would be much better for [him]0-i to take a chaise from [the inn]2600-the inn , and leave [[Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove ’s carriage]2775-mr musgrove ’s carriage and horses to be sent [home]1756-home the next morning early , when there would be the farther advantage of sending an account of [Louisa]118-louisa ’s night . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth now hurried off to get everything ready on [his]112-captain wentworth part , and to be soon followed by [the two ladies]2777-the two ladies . When the plan was made known to [Mary]90-mary , however , there was an end of all peace in it . [She]90-mary was so wretched and so vehement , complained so much of injustice in being expected to go away instead of [Anne]89-anne ; [Anne]89-anne , who was nothing to [Louisa]118-louisa , while [she]89-anne was [[her]89-anne sister]1946-her sister , and had the best right to stay in [[Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s stead]2779-henrietta ’s stead ! Why was not [she]90-mary to be as useful as [Anne]89-anne ? And to go [home]1756-home without [Charles]92-charles , too , without [[her]90-mary husband]347-her husband ! No , it was too unkind . And in short , [she]90-mary said more than [[her]90-mary husband]347-her husband could long withstand , and as [none of [the others]1828-the others]2783-none of the others could oppose when [he]347-her husband gave way , there was no help for it ; the change of [Mary]90-mary for [Anne]89-anne was inevitable . [Anne]89-anne had never submitted more reluctantly to the jealous and ill - judging claims of [Mary]90-mary ; but so it must be , and [they]2785-they set off for [the town]2536-the town , [Charles]92-charles taking care of [[his]347-her husband sister]2264-his sister , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick attending to [her]89-anne . [She]90-mary gave a moment ’s recollection , as [they]2785-they hurried along , to the little circumstances which [the same spots]2788-the same spots had witnessed earlier in the morning . There [she]90-mary had listened to [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s schemes for [Dr Shirley]148-dr shirley ’s leaving [Uppercross]3-uppercross ; farther on , [she]90-mary had first seen [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; a moment seemed all that could now be given to [any one]2789-any one but [Louisa]118-louisa , or [those who were wrapped up in [her]118-louisa welfare]2790-those who were wrapped up in her welfare . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick was most considerately attentive to [her]90-mary ; and , united as [they]2785-they all seemed by the distress of the day , [she]90-mary felt an increasing degree of good - will towards [him]153-captain benwick , and a pleasure even in thinking that it might , perhaps , be the occasion of continuing [their]2785-they acquaintance . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was on the watch for [them]2785-they , and a chaise and four in waiting , stationed for [their]2785-they convenience in [the lowest part of [the street]2708-the street]2791-the lowest part of the street ; but [his]153-captain benwick evident surprise and vexation at the substitution of [one sister]2731-one sister for [the other]2101-the other , the change in [his]153-captain benwick countenance , the astonishment , the expressions begun and suppressed , with which [Charles]92-charles was listened to , made but a mortifying reception of [Anne]89-anne ; or must at least convince [her]90-mary that [she]90-mary was valued only as [she]90-mary could be useful to [Louisa]118-louisa . [She]90-mary endeavoured to be composed , and to be just . Without emulating the feelings of [an Emma]2795-an emma towards [[her]90-mary Henry]2796-her henry , [she]90-mary would have attended on [Louisa]118-louisa with a zeal above the common claims of regard , for [his]153-captain benwick sake ; and [she]90-mary hoped [he]153-captain benwick would not long be so unjust as to suppose [she]90-mary would shrink unnecessarily from the office of [a friend]2797-a friend . In the meanwhile [she]90-mary was in [the carriage]2151-the carriage . [He]153-captain benwick had handed [them]2799-them both in , and placed [himself]153-captain benwick between [them]2799-them ; and in this manner , under these circumstances , full of astonishment and emotion to [Anne]89-anne , [she]90-mary quitted [Lyme]43-lyme . How the long stage would pass ; how it was to affect [their]2799-them manners ; what was to be [their]2799-them sort of intercourse , [she]90-mary could not foresee . It was all quite natural , however . [He]153-captain benwick was devoted to [Henrietta]117-henrietta ; always turning towards [her]117-henrietta ; and when [he]153-captain benwick spoke at all , always with the view of supporting [her]117-henrietta hopes and raising [her]117-henrietta spirits . In general , [his]153-captain benwick voice and manner were studiously calm . To spare [Henrietta]117-henrietta from agitation seemed the governing principle . Once only , when [she]117-henrietta had been grieving over the last ill - judged , ill - fated walk to [the Cobb]44-the cobb , bitterly lamenting that it ever had been thought of , [he]153-captain benwick burst forth , as if wholly overcome — “[134-mrs harville] Do n’t talk of it , do n’t talk of it , ” [he]153-captain benwick cried . “[135-god] [Oh God]135-god ! that [I]0-i had not given way to [her]867-her at the fatal moment ! Had [I]0-i done as [I]0-i ought ! But so eager and so resolute ! Dear , [sweet Louisa]118-louisa ! ” [Anne]89-anne wondered whether it ever occurred to [him]153-captain benwick now , to question the justness of [his]153-captain benwick own previous opinion as to the universal felicity and advantage of firmness of character ; and whether it might not strike [him]153-captain benwick that , like all other qualities of the mind , it should have its proportions and limits . [She]89-anne thought it could scarcely escape [him]153-captain benwick to feel that a persuadable temper might sometimes be as much in favour of happiness as a very resolute character . [They]2800-they got on fast . [Anne]89-anne was astonished to recognise [the same hills]2801-the same hills and the same objects so soon . [Their]2800-they actual speed , heightened by some dread of the conclusion , made [the road]2802-the road appear but half as long as on the day before . It was growing quite dusk , however , before [they]2800-they were in [the neighbourhood of Uppercross]2803-the neighbourhood of uppercross , and there had been total silence among [them]2800-they for some time , [Henrietta]117-henrietta leaning back in the corner , with a shawl over [her]117-henrietta face , giving the hope of [her]117-henrietta having cried [herself]117-henrietta to sleep ; when , as [they]2800-they were going up [[their]2800-they last hill]2804-their last hill , [Anne]89-anne found [herself]89-anne all at once addressed by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . In a low , cautious voice , [he]0-i said : — “[118-louisa] [I]0-i have been considering what [we]868-we had best do . [She]869-she must not appear at first . [She]869-she could not stand it . [I]0-i have been thinking whether [you]870-you had not better remain in [the carriage]2151-the carriage with [her]869-she , while [I]0-i go in and break it to [Mr and Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove . Do [you]870-you think this is a good plan ? ” [She]89-anne did : [he]0-i was satisfied , and said no more . But the remembrance of the appeal remained a pleasure to [her]89-anne , as a proof of friendship , and of deference for [her]89-anne judgement , a great pleasure ; and when it became a sort of parting proof , its value did not lessen . When the distressing communication at [Uppercross]3-uppercross was over , and [he]0-i had seen [the father]2050-the father and [mother]1943-mother quite as composed as could be hoped , and [the daughter]2807-the daughter all the better for being with [them]868-we , [he]0-i announced [his]0-i intention of returning in [the same carriage]2808-the same carriage to [Lyme]43-lyme ; and when the horses were baited , [he]0-i was off . ( End of volume one . ) CHAPTER XIII . The remainder of [Anne]89-anne ’s time at [Uppercross]3-uppercross , comprehending only two days , was spent entirely at [the Mansion House]2809-the mansion house ; and [she]89-anne had the satisfaction of knowing [herself]89-anne extremely useful [there]1845-there , both as [an immediate companion]2811-an immediate companion , and as assisting in all those arrangements for the future , which , in [Mr]2812-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove ’s distressed state of spirits , would have been difficulties . [They]868-we had an early account from [Lyme]43-lyme the next morning . [Louisa]118-louisa was much the same . No symptoms worse than before had appeared . [Charles]92-charles came a few hours afterwards , to bring a later and more particular account . [He]0-i was tolerably cheerful . A speedy cure must not be hoped , but everything was going on as well as the nature of the case admitted . In speaking of [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles , [he]0-i seemed unable to satisfy [his]0-i own sense of [their]152-the harvilles kindness , especially of [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s exertions as [a nurse]2813-a nurse . “[872-she] [She]872-she really left nothing for [Mary]90-mary to do . [He]873-he and [Mary]90-mary had been persuaded to go early to [[their]874-their inn]875-their inn last night . [Mary]90-mary had been hysterical again this morning . When [he]873-he came away , [she]872-she was going to walk out with [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , which , [he]873-he hoped , would do [her]872-she good . [He]873-he almost wished [she]872-she had been prevailed on to come [home]1756-home the day before ; but the truth was , that [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville left nothing for [anybody]462-anybody to do . ” [Charles]92-charles was to return to [Lyme]43-lyme the same afternoon , and [[his]873-he father]312-his father had at first half a mind to go with [him]873-he , but [the ladies]2623-the ladies could not consent . It would be going only to multiply trouble to [the others]1828-the others , and increase [his]873-he own distress ; and a much better scheme followed and was acted upon . A chaise was sent for from [Crewkherne]160-crewkherne , and [Charles]92-charles conveyed back [a far more useful person in [the old nursery - maid of [the family]1782-the family]2818-the old nursery - maid of the family , one who having brought up [all the children]2820-all the children , and seen the very last , the lingering and long - petted [Master Harry]167-master harry , sent to [school]1848-school after [[his]167-master harry brothers]2822-his brothers]2817-a far more useful person in the old nursery - maid of the family , one who having brought up all the children , and seen the very last , the lingering and long - petted master harry , sent to school after his brothers , was now living in [[her]134-mrs harville deserted nursery]2823-her deserted nursery to mend stockings and dress all the blains and bruises [she]134-mrs harville could get near [her]134-mrs harville , and who , consequently , was only too happy in being allowed to go and help nurse dear [Miss Louisa]118-louisa . Vague wishes of getting [Sarah thither]168-sarah thither , had occurred before to [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles and [Henrietta]117-henrietta ; but without [Anne]89-anne , it would hardly have been resolved on , and found practicable so soon . [They]1782-the family were indebted , the next day , to [Charles Hayter]91-charles , for all the minute knowledge of [Louisa]118-louisa , which it was so essential to obtain every twenty - four hours . [He]91-charles made it [his]91-charles business to go to [Lyme]43-lyme , and [his]91-charles account was still encouraging . The intervals of sense and consciousness were believed to be stronger . Every report agreed in [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s appearing fixed in [Lyme]43-lyme . [Anne]89-anne was to leave [them]1782-the family on the morrow , an event which [they]1782-the family all dreaded . “[134-mrs harville] What should [they]878-they do without [her]879-her ? [They]878-they were wretched comforters for [one another]2273-one another . ” And so much was said in this way , that [Anne]89-anne thought [she]89-anne could not do better than impart among [them]1782-the family the general inclination to which [she]89-anne was privy , and persuaded [them]1782-the family all to go to [Lyme]43-lyme at once . [She]89-anne had little difficulty ; it was soon determined that [they]1782-the family would go ; go to - morrow , fix [themselves]1782-the family at [the inn]2600-the inn , or get into [lodgings]2825-lodgings , as it suited , and there remain till [dear Louisa]118-louisa could be moved . [They]1782-the family must be taking off some trouble from [the good people [she]89-anne was with]2826-the good people she was with ; [they]1782-the family might at least relieve [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville from the care of [[her]134-mrs harville own children]2827-her own children ; and in short , [they]1782-the family were so happy in the decision , that [Anne]89-anne was delighted with what [she]89-anne had done , and felt that [she]89-anne could not spend [her]89-anne last morning at [Uppercross]3-uppercross better than in assisting [their]1782-the family preparations , and sending [them]1782-the family off at an early hour , though [her]89-anne being left to [the solitary range of [the house]1780-the house]2828-the solitary range of the house was the consequence . [She]89-anne was the last , excepting [the little boys at [the cottage]2078-the cottage]2830-the little boys at the cottage , [she]89-anne was the very last , the only remaining one of all that had filled and animated [both houses]2071-both houses , of all that had given [Uppercross]139-uppercross its cheerful character . A few days had made a change indeed ! If [Louisa]118-louisa recovered , it would all be well again . More than former happiness would be restored . There could not be a doubt , to [her]89-anne mind there was none , of what would follow [her]89-anne recovery . A few months hence , and [the room now so deserted]2833-the room now so deserted , occupied but by [her]89-anne silent , pensive self , might be filled again with all that was happy and gay , all that was glowing and bright in prosperous love , all that was most unlike [Anne Elliot]89-anne ! An hour ’s complete leisure for such reflections as these , on a dark November day , a small thick rain almost blotting out the very few objects ever to be discerned from the windows , was enough to make the sound of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s carriage exceedingly welcome ; and yet , though desirous to be gone , [she]89-anne could not quit [the Mansion House]2809-the mansion house , or look an adieu to [the Cottage]2078-the cottage , with [its]2078-the cottage black , dripping and comfortless veranda , or even notice through the misty glasses [the last humble tenements of [the village]451-the village]2836-the last humble tenements of the village , without a saddened heart . [Scenes]169-scenes had passed in [Uppercross]3-uppercross which made it precious . [It]3-uppercross stood the record of many sensations of pain , once severe , but now softened ; and of some instances of relenting feeling , some breathings of friendship and reconciliation , which could never be looked for again , and which could never cease to be dear . [She]89-anne left it all behind [her]89-anne , all but the recollection that such things had been . [Anne]89-anne had never entered [Kellynch]5-kellynch since [her]89-anne quitting [[Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s house]2838-lady russell ’s house in September . It had not been necessary , and the few occasions of its being possible for [her]89-anne to go to [the Hall [she]89-anne had contrived to evade and escape from]2839-the hall she had contrived to evade and escape from . [Her]89-anne first return was to resume [her]89-anne place in [the modern and elegant apartments of [the Lodge]2013-the lodge]2840-the modern and elegant apartments of the lodge , and to gladden the eyes of [its mistress]2842-its mistress . There was some anxiety mixed with [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s joy in meeting [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne knew who had been frequenting [Uppercross]3-uppercross . But happily , either [Anne]89-anne was improved in plumpness and looks , or [Lady Russell]97-lady russell fancied [her]89-anne so ; and [Anne]89-anne , in receiving [her]89-anne compliments on the occasion , had the amusement of connecting [them]2843-them with the silent admiration of [[her]89-anne cousin]620-her cousin , and of hoping that [she]89-anne was to be blessed with a second spring of youth and beauty . When [they]2843-them came to converse , [she]89-anne was soon sensible of some mental change . The subjects of which [her]89-anne heart had been full on leaving [Kellynch]5-kellynch , and which [she]89-anne had felt slighted , and been compelled to smother among [the Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves , were now become but of secondary interest . [She]89-anne had lately lost sight even of [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister and [Bath]9-bath . [Their]2843-them concerns had been sunk under those of [Uppercross]139-uppercross ; and when [Lady Russell]97-lady russell reverted to [their]2843-them former hopes and fears , and spoke [her]97-lady russell satisfaction in [the house in [Camden Place]53-camden place]2847-the house in camden place , which had been taken , and [her]97-lady russell regret that [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay should still be with [them]2843-them , [Anne]89-anne would have been ashamed to have it known how much more [she]89-anne was thinking of [Lyme]43-lyme and [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa , and all [her]89-anne acquaintance [there]1845-there ; how much more interesting to [her]89-anne was [the home and the friendship of [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick]2849-the home and the friendship of the harvilles and captain benwick , than [[[her]89-anne own father]2850-her own father ’s house in [Camden Place]53-camden place]2851-her own father ’s house in camden place , or [[her]89-anne own sister]1978-her own sister ’s intimacy with [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . [She]89-anne was actually forced to exert [herself]89-anne to meet [Lady Russell]97-lady russell with anything like the appearance of equal solicitude , on topics which had by nature the first claim on [her]89-anne . There was a little awkwardness at first in [their]2853-their discourse on another subject . [They]2853-their must speak of the accident at [Lyme]43-lyme . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had not been arrived five minutes the day before , when a full account of the whole had burst on [her]97-lady russell ; but still it must be talked of , [she]97-lady russell must make enquiries , [she]97-lady russell must regret the imprudence , lament the result , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s name must be mentioned by both . [Anne]89-anne was conscious of not doing it so well as [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . [She]89-anne could not speak the name , and look straight forward to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s eye , till [she]89-anne had adopted the expedient of telling [her]89-anne briefly what [she]89-anne thought of the attachment between [him]112-captain wentworth and [Louisa]118-louisa . When this was told , [his]112-captain wentworth name distressed [her]89-anne no longer . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had only to listen composedly , and wish [them]2853-their happy , but internally [her]89-anne heart revelled in angry pleasure , in pleased contempt , that [the man who at twenty - three]2854-the man who at twenty - three had seemed to understand somewhat of the value of an [Anne Elliot]89-anne , should , eight years afterwards , be charmed by [a Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa . The first three or four days passed most quietly , with no circumstance to mark [them]2853-their excepting the receipt of a note or two from [Lyme]43-lyme , which found [their]2853-their way to [Anne]89-anne , [she]89-anne could not tell how , and brought a rather improving account of [Louisa]118-louisa . At the end of that period , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s politeness could repose no longer , and the fainter self - threatenings of the past became in a decided tone , “[0-i] [I]0-i must call on [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft ; [I]0-i really must call upon [her]107-mrs croft soon . [Anne]89-anne , have [you]89-anne courage to go with [me]0-i , and pay a visit in [that house]1913-that house ? It will be some trial to [us]882-us both . ” [Anne]89-anne did not shrink from it ; on the contrary , [she]89-anne truly felt as [she]89-anne said , in observing — “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]89-anne are very likely to suffer the most of the two ; [your]89-anne feelings are less reconciled to the change than [mine]0-i . By remaining in [the neighbourhood]1752-the neighbourhood , [I]0-i am become inured to it . ” [She]89-anne could have said more on the subject ; for [she]89-anne had in fact so high an opinion of [the Crofts]111-the crofts , and considered [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father so very fortunate in [[his]1745-her father tenants]2856-his tenants , felt [the parish]409-the parish to be so sure of a good example , and [the poor of the best attention and relief]2858-the poor of the best attention and relief , that however sorry and ashamed for the necessity of the removal , [she]89-anne could not but in conscience feel that [they]111-the crofts were gone who deserved not to stay , and that [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall had passed into better hands than [its owners]2859-its owners ’ . These convictions must unquestionably have [their]884-these rooms own pain , and severe was its kind ; but [they]884-these rooms precluded that pain which [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would suffer in entering [the house]1780-the house again , and returning through [the well - known apartments]2861-the well - known apartments . In such moments [Anne]89-anne had no power of saying to [herself]89-anne , “[0-i] [These rooms]884-these rooms ought to belong only to [us]885-us . Oh , how fallen in [their]884-these rooms destination ! How unworthily occupied ! [An ancient family]886-an ancient family to be so driven away ! [Strangers]2276-strangers filling [[their]884-these rooms place]888-their place ! ” No , except when [she]89-anne thought of [[her]89-anne mother]1735-her mother , and remembered where [she]89-anne had been used to sit and preside , [she]89-anne had no sigh of that description to heave . [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft always met [her]89-anne with a kindness which gave [her]89-anne the pleasure of fancying [herself]89-anne a favourite , and on the present occasion , receiving [her]89-anne in [that house]1913-that house , there was particular attention . The sad accident at [Lyme]43-lyme was soon the prevailing topic , and on comparing [their]885-us latest accounts of [the invalid]2864-the invalid , it appeared that [each lady]1984-each lady dated [her]1984-each lady intelligence from the same hour of yestermorn ; that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth had been in [Kellynch]5-kellynch yesterday ( the first time since the accident ) , had brought [Anne]89-anne the last note , which [she]89-anne had not been able to trace the exact steps of ; had staid a few hours and then returned again to [Lyme]43-lyme , and without any present intention of quitting it any more . [He]112-captain wentworth had enquired after [her]89-anne , [she]89-anne found , particularly ; had expressed [his]112-captain wentworth hope of [Miss Elliot]89-anne ’s not being the worse for [her]89-anne exertions , and had spoken of those exertions as great . This was handsome , and gave [her]89-anne more pleasure than almost anything else could have done . As to the sad catastrophe itself , it could be canvassed only in one style by [a couple of steady , sensible women , whose judgements had to work on ascertained events]2866-a couple of steady , sensible women , whose judgements had to work on ascertained events ; and it was perfectly decided that it had been the consequence of much thoughtlessness and much imprudence ; that its effects were most alarming , and that it was frightful to think , how long [Miss Musgrove]118-louisa ’s recovery might yet be doubtful , and how liable [she]89-anne would still remain to suffer from the concussion hereafter ! [The Admiral]1880-the admiral wound it up summarily by exclaiming — “[2276-strangers] Ay , a very bad business indeed . A new sort of way this , for [a young fellow]889-a young fellow to be making love , by breaking [[his]889-a young fellow mistress]890-his mistress ’s head , is not it , [Miss Elliot]89-anne ? This is breaking a head and giving a plaster , truly ! ” [Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft ’s manners were not quite of the tone to suit [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , but they delighted [Anne]89-anne . [His]106-admiral croft goodness of heart and simplicity of character were irresistible . “[89-anne] Now , this must be very bad for [you]89-anne , ” said [he]106-admiral croft , suddenly rousing from a little reverie , “[89-anne] to be coming and finding [us]891-we here . [I]0-i had not recollected it before , [I]0-i declare , but it must be very bad . But now , do not stand upon ceremony . Get up and go over [all the rooms in [the house]1780-the house]892-all the rooms in the house if [you]89-anne like it . ” “[592-sir] Another time , [Sir]592-sir , [I]0-i thank [you]592-sir , not now . ” “[0-i] Well , whenever it suits [you]89-anne . [You]89-anne can slip in from the shrubbery at any time ; and there [you]89-anne will find [we]891-we keep [our]891-we umbrellas hanging up by that door . A good place is not it ? But , ” ( checking [himself]0-i ) , “[89-anne] [you]89-anne will not think it a good place , for [yours]89-anne were always kept in [[the butler]895-the butler ’s room]896-the butler ’s room . Ay , so it always is , [I]0-i believe . [One man]897-one man ’s ways may be as good as another ’s , but [we]891-we all like [our]891-we own best . And so [you]89-anne must judge for [yourself]89-anne , whether it would be better for [you]89-anne to go about [the house]1780-the house or not . ” [Anne]89-anne , finding [she]89-anne might decline it , did so , very gratefully . “[89-anne] [We]891-we have made very few changes either , ” continued [the Admiral]1880-the admiral , after thinking a moment . “[891-we] Very few . [We]891-we told [you]89-anne about the laundry - door , at [Uppercross]3-uppercross . That has been a very great improvement . The wonder was , how [any family upon earth]899-any family upon earth could bear with the inconvenience of [its]899-any family upon earth opening as it did , so long ! [You]89-anne will tell [Sir Walter]86-sir walter what [we]891-we have done , and that [Mr Shepherd]99-mr shepherd thinks it the greatest improvement [the house]1780-the house ever had . Indeed , [I]0-i must do [ourselves]891-we the justice to say , that the few alterations [we]891-we have made have been all very much for the better . [[My]0-i wife]901-my wife should have the credit of them , however . [I]0-i have done very little besides sending away some of the large looking - glasses from [[my]0-i dressing - room]902-my dressing - room , which was [[your]89-anne father]240-your father ’s . [A very good man]904-a very good man , and very much [the gentleman]247-the gentleman [I]0-i am sure : but [I]0-i should think , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , ” ( looking with serious reflection ) , “[0-i] [I]0-i should think [he]904-a very good man must be rather [a dressy man]906-a dressy man for [his]904-a very good man time of life . Such a number of looking - glasses ! oh Lord ! there was no getting away from [one]1726-one ’s self . So [I]0-i got [Sophy]129-sophy to lend [me]0-i a hand , and [we]908-we soon shifted [[their]909-their quarters]910-their quarters ; and now [I]0-i am quite snug , with [my]0-i little shaving glass in one corner , and another great thing that [I]0-i never go near . ” [Anne]89-anne , amused in spite of [herself]89-anne , was rather distressed for an answer , and [the Admiral]1880-the admiral , fearing [he]1880-the admiral might not have been civil enough , took up the subject again , to say — “[107-mrs croft] The next time [you]89-anne write to [[your]89-anne good father]911-your good father , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , pray give [him]911-your good father [my]0-i compliments and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft ’s , and say that [we]908-we are settled [here]376-here quite to [our]908-we liking , and have no fault at all to find with [the place]913-the place . [The breakfast - room chimney]914-the breakfast - room chimney smokes a little , [I]0-i grant [you]89-anne , but it is only when the wind is due north and blows hard , which may not happen three times a winter . And take it altogether , now that [we]908-we have been into most of [the houses]915-the houses hereabouts and can judge , there is not one that [we]908-we like better than this . Pray say so , with [my]0-i compliments . [He]911-your good father will be glad to hear it . ” [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft were very well pleased with [each other]1959-each other : but the acquaintance which this visit began was fated not to proceed far at present ; for when it was returned , [the Crofts]111-the crofts announced [themselves]111-the crofts to be going away for a few weeks , to visit [their]111-the crofts connexions in [the north of [the county]2872-the county]2871-the north of the county , and probably might not be at [home]1756-home again before [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would be removing to [Bath]9-bath . So ended all danger to [Anne]89-anne of meeting [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth at [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall , or of seeing [him]112-captain wentworth in company with [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend . Everything was safe enough , and [she]89-anne smiled over the many anxious feelings [she]89-anne had wasted on the subject . CHAPTER XIV . Though [Charles]91-charles and [Mary]90-mary had remained at [Lyme]43-lyme much longer after [Mr]2875-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles ’s going than [Anne]89-anne conceived [they]111-the crofts could have been at all wanted , [they]111-the crofts were yet [the first of [the family]1782-the family]2876-the first of the family to be at [home]1756-home again ; and as soon as possible after [their]111-the crofts return to [Uppercross]3-uppercross [they]111-the crofts drove over to [the Lodge]54-the lodge . [They]111-the crofts had left [Louisa]118-louisa beginning to sit up ; but [her]118-louisa head , though clear , was exceedingly weak , and [her]118-louisa nerves susceptible to the highest extreme of tenderness ; and though [she]118-louisa might be pronounced to be altogether doing very well , it was still impossible to say when [she]118-louisa might be able to bear the removal [home]1756-home ; and [[her]118-louisa father]1745-her father and [mother]1943-mother , who must return in time to receive [[their]111-the crofts younger children]2882-their younger children for the Christmas holidays , had hardly a hope of being allowed to bring [her]118-louisa with [them]111-the crofts . [They]111-the crofts had been all in [lodgings]2825-lodgings together . [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles had got [[Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s children]2884-mrs harville ’s children away as much as [she]92-charles could , every possible supply from [Uppercross]3-uppercross had been furnished , to lighten the inconvenience to [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles , while [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles had been wanting [them]2884-mrs harville ’s children to come to dinner every day ; and in short , it seemed to have been only a struggle on each side as to which should be most disinterested and hospitable . [Mary]90-mary had had [her]90-mary evils ; but upon the whole , as was evident by [her]90-mary staying so long , [she]90-mary had found more to enjoy than to suffer . [Charles Hayter]91-charles had been at [Lyme]43-lyme oftener than suited [her]118-louisa ; and when [they]111-the crofts dined with [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles there had been only [a maid - servant]2885-a maid - servant to wait , and at first [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville had always given [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles precedence ; but then , [she]134-mrs harville had received so very handsome an apology from [her]92-charles on finding out whose daughter [she]134-mrs harville was , and there had been so much going on every day , there had been so many walks between [[their]111-the crofts lodgings]2886-their lodgings and [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles , and [she]134-mrs harville had got books from [the library]2887-the library , and changed them so often , that the balance had certainly been much in favour of [Lyme]43-lyme . [She]134-mrs harville had been taken to [Charmouth]45-charmouth too , and [she]134-mrs harville had bathed , and [she]134-mrs harville had gone to [church]2888-church , and there were [a great many more people]2889-a great many more people to look at in [the church at [Lyme]43-lyme]2890-the church at lyme than at [Uppercross]3-uppercross ; and all this , joined to the sense of being so very useful , had made really an agreeable fortnight . [Anne]89-anne enquired after [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . [Mary]90-mary ’s face was clouded directly . [Charles]91-charles laughed . “[911-your good father] Oh ! [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick is very well , [I]0-i believe , but [he]153-captain benwick is [a very odd young man]916-a very odd young man . [I]0-i do not know what [he]153-captain benwick would be at . [We]917-we asked [him]153-captain benwick to come [home]1756-home with [us]917-we for a day or two : [Charles]91-charles undertook to give [him]153-captain benwick some shooting , and [he]153-captain benwick seemed quite delighted , and , for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i thought it was all settled ; when behold ! on Tuesday night , [he]153-captain benwick made a very awkward sort of excuse ; ‘ [he]153-captain benwick never shot ’ and [he]153-captain benwick had ‘ been quite misunderstood , ’ and [he]153-captain benwick had promised this and [he]153-captain benwick had promised that , and the end of it was , [I]0-i found , that [he]153-captain benwick did not mean to come . [I]0-i suppose [he]153-captain benwick was afraid of finding it dull ; but upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i should have thought [we]917-we were lively enough at [the Cottage]2078-the cottage for such [a heart - broken man]920-a heart - broken man as [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . ” [Charles]91-charles laughed again and said , “[153-captain benwick] Now [Mary]90-mary , [you]90-mary know very well how it really was . It was all [your]90-mary doing , ” ( turning to [Anne]89-anne ) . “[90-mary] [He]153-captain benwick fancied that if [he]153-captain benwick went with [us]917-we , [he]153-captain benwick should find [you]90-mary close by : [he]153-captain benwick fancied [everybody]2119-everybody to be living in [Uppercross]3-uppercross ; and when [he]153-captain benwick discovered that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell lived three miles off , [his]153-captain benwick heart failed [him]153-captain benwick , and [he]153-captain benwick had not courage to come . That is the fact , upon [my]0-i honour . [Mary]90-mary knows it is . ” But [Mary]90-mary did not give into it very graciously , whether from not considering [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick entitled by birth and situation to be in love with [an Elliot]2891-an elliot , or from not wanting to believe [Anne]89-anne a greater attraction to [Uppercross]3-uppercross than [herself]89-anne , must be left to be guessed . [Anne]89-anne ’s good - will , however , was not to be lessened by what [she]89-anne heard . [She]89-anne boldly acknowledged [herself]89-anne flattered , and continued [her]89-anne enquiries . “[153-captain benwick] Oh ! [he]153-captain benwick talks of [you]90-mary , ” cried [Charles]91-charles , “[153-captain benwick] in such terms — ” [Mary]90-mary interrupted [him]91-charles . “[0-i] [I]0-i declare , [Charles]91-charles , [I]0-i never heard [him]153-captain benwick mention [Anne]89-anne twice all the time [I]0-i was there . [I]0-i declare , [Anne]89-anne , [he]153-captain benwick never talks of [you]90-mary at all . ” “[153-captain benwick] No , ” admitted [Charles]91-charles , “[153-captain benwick] [I]0-i do not know that [he]153-captain benwick ever does , in a general way ; but however , it is a very clear thing that [he]153-captain benwick admires [you]90-mary exceedingly . [His]153-captain benwick head is full of some books that [he]153-captain benwick is reading upon [your]90-mary recommendation , and [he]153-captain benwick wants to talk to [you]90-mary about them ; [he]153-captain benwick has found out something or other in one of them which [he]153-captain benwick thinks — oh ! [I]0-i can not pretend to remember it , but it was something very fine — [I]0-i overheard [him]153-captain benwick telling [Henrietta]117-henrietta all about it ; and then ‘ [Miss Elliot]89-anne ’ was spoken of in the highest terms ! Now [Mary]90-mary , [I]0-i declare it was so , [I]0-i heard it [myself]0-i , and [you]90-mary were in [the other room]922-the other room . ‘ Elegance , sweetness , beauty . ’ Oh ! there was no end of [Miss Elliot]89-anne ’s charms . ” “[89-anne] And [I]0-i am sure , ” cried [Mary]90-mary , warmly , “[153-captain benwick] it was a very little to [his]153-captain benwick credit , if [he]153-captain benwick did . [Miss Harville]170-miss harville only died last [June]164-june . Such a heart is very little worth having ; is it , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ? [I]0-i am sure [you]90-mary will agree with [me]0-i . ” “[90-mary] [I]0-i must see [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick before [I]0-i decide , ” said [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , smiling . “[0-i] And that [you]90-mary are very likely to do very soon , [I]0-i can tell [you]90-mary , [ma’am]648-ma’am , ” said [Charles]91-charles . “[0-i] Though [he]153-captain benwick had not nerves for coming away with [us]924-us , and setting off again afterwards to pay a formal visit here , [he]153-captain benwick will make [his]153-captain benwick way over to [Kellynch]5-kellynch one day by [himself]153-captain benwick , [you]90-mary may depend on it . [I]0-i told [him]153-captain benwick the distance and [the road]2802-the road , and [I]0-i told [him]153-captain benwick of [the church]926-the church ’s being so very well worth seeing ; for as [he]153-captain benwick has a taste for those sort of things , [I]0-i thought that would be a good excuse , and [he]153-captain benwick listened with all [his]153-captain benwick understanding and soul ; and [I]0-i am sure from [his]153-captain benwick manner that [you]90-mary will have [him]153-captain benwick calling [here]376-here soon . So , [I]0-i give [you]90-mary notice , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . ” “[97-lady russell] [Any acquaintance of [Anne]89-anne ’s]928-any acquaintance of anne ’s will always be welcome to [me]0-i , ” was [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s kind answer . “[97-lady russell] Oh ! as to being [Anne]89-anne ’s acquaintance , ” said [Mary]90-mary , “[153-captain benwick] [I]0-i think [he]153-captain benwick is rather [my]0-i acquaintance , for [I]0-i have been seeing [him]153-captain benwick every day this last fortnight . ” “[153-captain benwick] Well , as [your]90-mary joint acquaintance , then , [I]0-i shall be very happy to see [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . ” “[153-captain benwick] [You]90-mary will not find anything very agreeable in [him]153-captain benwick , [I]0-i assure [you]90-mary , [ma’am]648-ma’am . [He]153-captain benwick is just [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s sort . Do [you]936-you think [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would like that ? ” [Lady Russell]97-lady russell could not help laughing . “[97-lady russell] Upon [my]0-i word , ” said [she]97-lady russell , “[97-lady russell] [I]0-i should not have supposed that [my]0-i opinion of [any one]2789-any one could have admitted of such difference of conjecture , steady and matter of fact as [I]0-i may call [myself]0-i . And when [he]153-captain benwick does , [Mary]90-mary , [you]90-mary may depend upon hearing [my]0-i opinion ; but [I]0-i am determined not to judge [him]153-captain benwick beforehand . ” “[0-i] [You]90-mary will not like [him]153-captain benwick , [I]0-i will answer for it . ” [Lady Russell]97-lady russell began talking of something else . [Mary]90-mary spoke with animation of [their]2892-their meeting with , or rather missing , [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot so extraordinarily . “[0-i] [He]153-captain benwick is [a man]307-a man , ” said [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , “[307-a man] whom [I]0-i have no wish to see . [His]153-captain benwick declining to be on cordial terms with [the head of [[his]153-captain benwick family]1698-his family]940-the head of his family , has left a very strong impression in [his]153-captain benwick disfavour with [me]0-i . ” This decision checked [Mary]90-mary ’s eagerness , and stopped [her]90-mary short in the midst of the Elliot countenance . With regard to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , though [Anne]89-anne hazarded no enquiries , there was voluntary communication sufficient . [His]153-captain benwick spirits had been greatly recovering lately as might be expected . As [Louisa]118-louisa improved , [he]153-captain benwick had improved , and [he]153-captain benwick was now quite a different creature from what [he]153-captain benwick had been the first week . [He]153-captain benwick had not seen [Louisa]118-louisa ; and was so extremely fearful of any ill consequence to [her]118-louisa from an interview , that [he]153-captain benwick did not press for it at all ; and , on the contrary , seemed to have a plan of going away for a week or ten days , till [her]118-louisa head was stronger . [He]153-captain benwick had talked of going down to [Plymouth]27-plymouth for a week , and wanted to persuade [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick to go with [him]153-captain benwick ; but , as [Charles]91-charles maintained to the last , [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick seemed much more disposed to ride over to [Kellynch]5-kellynch . There can be no doubt that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Anne]89-anne were both occasionally thinking of [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , from this time . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell could not hear the door - bell without feeling that it might be [[his]153-captain benwick herald]2893-his herald ; nor could [Anne]89-anne return from any stroll of solitary indulgence in [[[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s grounds]2895-her father ’s grounds , or any visit of charity in [the village]451-the village , without wondering whether [she]89-anne might see [him]153-captain benwick or hear of [him]153-captain benwick . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick came not , however . [He]153-captain benwick was either less disposed for it than [Charles]91-charles had imagined , or [he]153-captain benwick was too shy ; and after giving [him]153-captain benwick a week ’s indulgence , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell determined [him]153-captain benwick to be unworthy of the interest which [he]153-captain benwick had been beginning to excite . [The Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves came back to receive [[their]115-the miss musgroves happy boys]2897-their happy boys and [girls]2898-girls from [school]1848-school , bringing with [them]115-the miss musgroves [[Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville ’s little children]2900-mrs harville ’s little children , to improve the noise of [Uppercross]3-uppercross , and lessen that of [Lyme]43-lyme . [Henrietta]117-henrietta remained with [Louisa]118-louisa ; but [all the rest of [the family]1782-the family]2901-all the rest of the family were again in [[their]2901-all the rest of the family usual quarters]2903-their usual quarters . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Anne]89-anne paid [their]115-the miss musgroves compliments to [them]115-the miss musgroves once , when [Anne]89-anne could not but feel that [Uppercross]3-uppercross was already quite alive again . Though neither [Henrietta]117-henrietta , nor [Louisa]118-louisa , nor [Charles Hayter]91-charles , nor [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth were [there]1845-there , [the room]1874-the room presented as strong a contrast as could be wished to [the last state [she]89-anne had seen [it]1874-the room in]2906-the last state she had seen it in . Immediately surrounding [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles were [the little Harvilles , whom [she]92-charles was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of [the two children from [the Cottage]2078-the cottage]2908-the two children from the cottage]2907-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage , expressly arrived to amuse [them]2907-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage . On one side was a table occupied by [some chattering girls , cutting up silk and gold paper]2910-some chattering girls , cutting up silk and gold paper ; and on the other were tressels and trays , bending under the weight of brawn and cold pies , where [riotous boys]2911-riotous boys were holding high revel ; the whole completed by a roaring Christmas fire , which seemed determined to be heard , in spite of all the noise of [the others]1828-the others . [Charles]91-charles and [Mary]90-mary also came in , of course , during [their]2907-the little harvilles , whom she was sedulously guarding from the tyranny of the two children from the cottage visit , and [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove made a point of paying [his]114-mrs musgrove respects to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , and sat down close to [her]97-lady russell for ten minutes , talking with a very raised voice , but from the clamour of [the children]2080-the children on [his]114-mrs musgrove knees , generally in vain . It was a fine family - piece . [Anne]89-anne , judging from [her]89-anne own temperament , would have deemed such a domestic hurricane a bad restorative of the nerves , which [Louisa]118-louisa ’s illness must have so greatly shaken . But [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , who got [Anne]89-anne near [her]89-anne on purpose to thank [her]89-anne most cordially , again and again , for all [her]89-anne attentions to [them]2080-the children , concluded a short recapitulation of what [she]89-anne had suffered [herself]89-anne by observing , with a happy glance round [the room]1874-the room , that after all [she]89-anne had gone through , nothing was so likely to do [her]89-anne good as a little quiet cheerfulness at [home]1756-home . [Louisa]118-louisa was now recovering apace . [[Her]118-louisa mother]1735-her mother could even think of [her]118-louisa being able to join [their]2080-the children party at [home]1756-home , before [[her]118-louisa brothers]2918-her brothers and [sisters]2343-sisters went to [school]1848-school again . [The Harvilles]152-the harvilles had promised to come with [her]118-louisa and stay at [Uppercross]3-uppercross , whenever [she]118-louisa returned . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was gone , for the present , to see [[his]112-captain wentworth brother]2921-his brother in [Shropshire]39-shropshire . “[0-i] [I]0-i hope [I]0-i shall remember , in future , ” said [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , as soon as [they]2080-the children were reseated in [the carriage]2151-the carriage , “[0-i] not to call at [Uppercross]3-uppercross in the Christmas holidays . ” [Everybody]2119-everybody has [their]2119-everybody taste in noises as well as in other matters ; and sounds are quite innoxious , or most distressing , by [their]2119-everybody sort rather than [their]2119-everybody quantity . When [Lady Russell]97-lady russell not long afterwards , was entering [Bath]9-bath on a wet afternoon , and driving through the long course of [streets]2924-streets from [the Old Bridge]2925-the old bridge to [Camden Place]53-camden place , amidst the dash of [other carriages]2926-other carriages , the heavy rumble of carts and drays , the bawling of [newspapermen]2927-newspapermen , [muffin - men]2928-muffin - men and [milkmen]2929-milkmen , and the ceaseless clink of pattens , [she]97-lady russell made no complaint . No , these were noises which belonged to the winter pleasures ; [her]97-lady russell spirits rose under [their]2119-everybody influence ; and like [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , [she]97-lady russell was feeling , though not saying , that after being long in [the country]1758-the country , nothing could be so good for [her]97-lady russell as a little quiet cheerfulness . [Anne]89-anne did not share these feelings . [She]89-anne persisted in a very determined , though very silent disinclination for [Bath]9-bath ; caught the first dim view of [the extensive buildings]2931-the extensive buildings , smoking in rain , without any wish of seeing [them]2931-the extensive buildings better ; felt [their]2931-the extensive buildings progress through [the streets]2932-the streets to be , however disagreeable , yet too rapid ; for who would be glad to see [her]89-anne when [she]89-anne arrived ? And looked back , with fond regret , to the bustles of [Uppercross]3-uppercross and the seclusion of [Kellynch]5-kellynch . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ’s last letter had communicated a piece of news of some interest . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was in [Bath]9-bath . [He]98-mr elliot had called in [Camden Place]53-camden place ; had called a second time , a third ; had been pointedly attentive . If [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [[her]87-elizabeth father]1745-her father did not deceive [themselves]2931-the extensive buildings , had been taking much pains to seek the acquaintance , and proclaim the value of the connection , as [he]98-mr elliot had formerly taken pains to shew neglect . This was very wonderful if it were true ; and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell was in a state of very agreeable curiosity and perplexity about [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , already recanting the sentiment [she]97-lady russell had so lately expressed to [Mary]90-mary , of [his]98-mr elliot being “[0-i] [a man whom [she]943-she had no wish to see]942-a man whom she had no wish to see . ” [She]89-anne had a great wish to see [him]98-mr elliot . If [he]98-mr elliot really sought to reconcile [himself]98-mr elliot like a dutiful branch , [he]98-mr elliot must be forgiven for having dismembered [himself]98-mr elliot from the paternal tree . [Anne]89-anne was not animated to an equal pitch by the circumstance , but [she]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne would rather see [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot again than not , which was more than [she]89-anne could say for [many other persons in [Bath]9-bath]2934-many other persons in bath . [She]89-anne was put down in [Camden Place]53-camden place ; and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell then drove to [[her]97-lady russell own lodgings]2935-her own lodgings , in [Rivers Street]56-rivers street . [CHAPTER XV]57-chapter xv . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter had taken [a very good house in [Camden Place]53-camden place]2936-a very good house in camden place , a lofty dignified situation , such as becomes [a man of consequence]2937-a man of consequence ; and both [he]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were settled [there]1845-there , much to [their]2939-they satisfaction . [Anne]89-anne entered [it]1845-there with a sinking heart , anticipating an imprisonment of many months , and anxiously saying to [herself]89-anne , “[0-i] Oh ! when shall [I]0-i leave [you]944-you again ? ” A degree of unexpected cordiality , however , in the welcome [she]89-anne received , did [her]89-anne good . [[Her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister were glad to see [her]89-anne , for the sake of shewing [her]89-anne [the house]1780-the house and furniture , and met [her]89-anne with kindness . [Her]89-anne making a fourth , when [they]2939-they sat down to dinner , was noticed as an advantage . [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay was very pleasant , and very smiling , but [her]101-mrs clay courtesies and smiles were more a matter of course . [Anne]89-anne had always felt that [she]89-anne would pretend what was proper on [her]89-anne arrival , but the complaisance of [the others]1828-the others was unlooked for . [They]2939-they were evidently in excellent spirits , and [she]89-anne was soon to listen to the causes . [They]2939-they had no inclination to listen to [her]89-anne . After laying out for some compliments of being deeply regretted in [[their]2939-they old neighbourhood]2944-their old neighbourhood , which [Anne]89-anne could not pay , [they]2939-they had only a few faint enquiries to make , before the talk must be all [their]2939-they own . [Uppercross]139-uppercross excited no interest , [Kellynch]5-kellynch very little : it was all [Bath]9-bath . [They]2939-they had the pleasure of assuring [her]89-anne that [Bath]9-bath more than answered [their]2939-they expectations in every respect . [[Their]2939-they house]2743-their house was undoubtedly the best in [Camden Place]53-camden place ; [[their]2939-they drawing - rooms]2946-their drawing - rooms had many decided advantages over all the others which [they]2939-they had either seen or heard of , and the superiority was not less in the style of the fitting - up , or the taste of the furniture . [Their]2939-they acquaintance was exceedingly sought after . [Everybody]2119-everybody was wanting to visit [them]2939-they . [They]2939-they had drawn back from many introductions , and still were perpetually having cards left by [people of whom [they]2939-they knew nothing]2948-people of whom they knew nothing . Here were funds of enjoyment . Could [Anne]89-anne wonder that [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister were happy ? [She]89-anne might not wonder , but [she]89-anne must sigh that [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father should feel no degradation in [his]1745-her father change , should see nothing to regret in the duties and dignity of [the resident landholder]2952-the resident landholder , should find so much to be vain of in [the littlenesses of [a town]2954-a town]2953-the littlenesses of a town ; and [she]89-anne must sigh , and smile , and wonder too , as [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth threw open the folding - doors and walked with exultation from [one drawing - room]2955-one drawing - room to the other , boasting of [[their]2939-they space]2956-their space ; at the possibility of [that woman , who had been mistress of [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall]2957-that woman , who had been mistress of kellynch hall , finding extent to be proud of between two walls , perhaps thirty feet asunder . But this was not all which [they]2939-they had to make [them]2939-they happy . [They]2939-they had [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot too . [Anne]89-anne had a great deal to hear of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot was not only pardoned , [they]2939-they were delighted with [him]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot had been in [Bath]9-bath about a fortnight ; ( [he]98-mr elliot had passed through [Bath]9-bath in November , in [his]98-mr elliot way to [London]6-london , when the intelligence of [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ’s being settled [there]1845-there had of course reached [him]98-mr elliot , though only twenty - four hours in [the place]913-the place , but [he]98-mr elliot had not been able to avail [himself]98-mr elliot of it ;) but [he]98-mr elliot had now been a fortnight in [Bath]9-bath , and [his]98-mr elliot first object on arriving , had been to leave [his]98-mr elliot card in [Camden Place]53-camden place , following it up by such assiduous endeavours to meet , and when [they]2939-they did meet , by such great openness of conduct , such readiness to apologize for the past , such solicitude to be received as a relation again , that [their]2939-they former good understanding was completely re - established . [They]2939-they had not a fault to find in [him]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot had explained away all the appearance of neglect on [his]98-mr elliot own side . It had originated in misapprehension entirely . [He]98-mr elliot had never had an idea of throwing [himself]98-mr elliot off ; [he]98-mr elliot had feared that [he]98-mr elliot was thrown off , but knew not why , and delicacy had kept [him]98-mr elliot silent . Upon the hint of having spoken disrespectfully or carelessly of [the family]1782-the family and [the family honours]2961-the family honours , [he]98-mr elliot was quite indignant . [He]98-mr elliot , who had ever boasted of being [an Elliot , and whose feelings , as to connection , were only too strict to suit the unfeudal tone of the present day]2962-an elliot , and whose feelings , as to connection , were only too strict to suit the unfeudal tone of the present day . [He]98-mr elliot was astonished , indeed , but [his]98-mr elliot character and general conduct must refute it . [He]98-mr elliot could refer [Sir Walter]86-sir walter to [all who knew [him]98-mr elliot]2963-all who knew him ; and certainly , the pains [he]98-mr elliot had been taking on this , the first opportunity of reconciliation , to be restored to the footing of [a relation and heir - presumptive]2964-a relation and heir - presumptive , was a strong proof of [his]98-mr elliot opinions on the subject . The circumstances of [his]98-mr elliot marriage , too , were found to admit of much extenuation . This was an article not to be entered on by [himself]98-mr elliot ; but [a very intimate friend of [his]98-mr elliot]2965-a very intimate friend of his , [a Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis , [a highly respectable man]2966-a highly respectable man , perfectly [the gentleman]247-the gentleman , ( and not [an ill - looking man]2968-an ill - looking man , [Sir Walter]86-sir walter added ) , who was living in very good style in [Marlborough Buildings]58-marlborough buildings , and had , at [his]171-colonel wallis own particular request , been admitted to [their]2969-their acquaintance through [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , had mentioned one or two things relative to the marriage , which made a material difference in the discredit of it . [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis had known [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot long , had been well acquainted also with [[his]171-colonel wallis wife]1699-his wife , had perfectly understood the whole story . [She]1699-his wife was certainly not [a woman of [family]2972-family , but well educated , accomplished , rich , and excessively in love with [[his]171-colonel wallis friend]2516-his friend]2971-a woman of family , but well educated , accomplished , rich , and excessively in love with his friend . There had been the charm . [She]1699-his wife had sought [him]98-mr elliot . Without that attraction , not all [her]1699-his wife money would have tempted [Elliot]98-mr elliot , and [Sir Walter]86-sir walter was , moreover , assured of [her]1699-his wife having been [a very fine woman]2974-a very fine woman . Here was a great deal to soften the business . [A very fine woman with a large fortune , in love with [him]98-mr elliot]2975-a very fine woman with a large fortune , in love with him ! [Sir Walter]86-sir walter seemed to admit it as complete apology ; and though [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth could not see the circumstance in quite so favourable a light , [she]87-elizabeth allowed it be a great extenuation . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had called repeatedly , had dined with [them]2976-them once , evidently delighted by the distinction of being asked , for [they]2976-them gave no dinners in general ; delighted , in short , by every proof of cousinly notice , and placing [his]98-mr elliot whole happiness in being on intimate terms in [Camden Place]53-camden place . [Anne]89-anne listened , but without quite understanding it . Allowances , large allowances , [she]89-anne knew , must be made for the ideas of [those who spoke]2977-those who spoke . [She]89-anne heard it all under embellishment . All that sounded extravagant or irrational in the progress of the reconciliation might have no origin but in the language of [the relators]2978-the relators . Still , however , [she]89-anne had the sensation of there being something more than immediately appeared , in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s wishing , after an interval of so many years , to be well received by [them]2976-them . In a worldly view , [he]98-mr elliot had nothing to gain by being on terms with [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ; nothing to risk by a state of variance . In all probability [he]98-mr elliot was already [the richer of [the two]2980-the two]2979-the richer of the two , and [the Kellynch estate]1805-the kellynch estate would as surely be [his]98-mr elliot hereafter as the title . [A sensible man]1972-a sensible man , and [he]98-mr elliot had looked like [a very sensible man]2983-a very sensible man , why should it be an object to [him]98-mr elliot ? [She]89-anne could only offer one solution ; it was , perhaps , for [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ’s sake . There might really have been a liking formerly , though convenience and accident had drawn [him]98-mr elliot a different way ; and now that [he]98-mr elliot could afford to please [himself]98-mr elliot , [he]98-mr elliot might mean to pay [his]98-mr elliot addresses to [her]87-elizabeth . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was certainly very handsome , with well - bred , elegant manners , and [her]87-elizabeth character might never have been penetrated by [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , knowing [her]87-elizabeth but in public , and when very young [himself]98-mr elliot . How [her]87-elizabeth temper and understanding might bear the investigation of [his]98-mr elliot present keener time of life was another concern and rather a fearful one . Most earnestly did [she]89-anne wish that [he]98-mr elliot might not be too nice , or too observant if [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were [his]98-mr elliot object ; and that [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was disposed to believe [herself]87-elizabeth so , and that [[her]87-elizabeth friend]2014-her friend [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay was encouraging the idea , seemed apparent by a glance or two between [them]2985-them , while [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s frequent visits were talked of . [Anne]89-anne mentioned the glimpses [she]89-anne had had of [him]98-mr elliot at [Lyme]43-lyme , but without being much attended to . “[98-mr elliot] Oh ! yes , perhaps , it had been [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [They]945-they did not know . It might be [him]98-mr elliot , perhaps . ” [They]945-they could not listen to [her]89-anne description of [him]98-mr elliot . [They]945-they were describing [him]98-mr elliot [themselves]945-they ; [Sir Walter]86-sir walter especially . [He]98-mr elliot did justice to [his]98-mr elliot very gentlemanlike appearance , [his]98-mr elliot air of elegance and fashion , [his]98-mr elliot good shaped face , [his]98-mr elliot sensible eye ; but , at the same time , “[98-mr elliot] must lament [his]98-mr elliot being very much under - hung , a defect which time seemed to have increased ; nor could [he]98-mr elliot pretend to say that ten years had not altered almost every feature for the worse . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot appeared to think that [he]98-mr elliot ( [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ) was looking exactly as [he]98-mr elliot had done when [they]946-they last parted ; ” but [Sir Walter]86-sir walter had “[98-mr elliot] not been able to return the compliment entirely , which had embarrassed [him]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot did not mean to complain , however . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was better to look at than [most men]546-most men , and [he]98-mr elliot had no objection to being seen with [him]98-mr elliot anywhere . ” [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , and [[his]98-mr elliot friends in [Marlborough Buildings]58-marlborough buildings]2986-his friends in marlborough buildings , were talked of the whole evening . “[98-mr elliot] [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis had been so impatient to be introduced to [them]946-they ! and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot so anxious that [he]98-mr elliot should ! ” and there was [a Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis , at present known only to [them]946-they by description , as [she]172-mrs wallis was in daily expectation of [her]172-mrs wallis confinement ; but [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot spoke of [her]172-mrs wallis as “[948-a most charming woman] [a most charming woman]948-a most charming woman , quite worthy of being known in [Camden Place]949-camden place , ” and as soon as [she]172-mrs wallis recovered [they]946-they were to be acquainted . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter thought much of [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis ; [she]948-a most charming woman was said to be [an excessively pretty woman]2987-an excessively pretty woman , beautiful . “[948-a most charming woman] [He]98-mr elliot longed to see [her]948-a most charming woman . [He]98-mr elliot hoped [she]948-a most charming woman might make some amends for the many very plain faces [he]98-mr elliot was continually passing in [the streets]2932-the streets . The worst of [Bath]9-bath was the number of [its plain women]951-its plain women . [He]98-mr elliot did not mean to say that there were [no pretty women]952-no pretty women , but the number of the plain was out of all proportion . [He]98-mr elliot had frequently observed , as [he]98-mr elliot walked , that [one handsome face]953-one handsome face would be followed by thirty , or five - and - thirty frights ; and once , as [he]98-mr elliot had stood in [a shop on [Bond Street]59-bond street]954-a shop on bond street , [he]98-mr elliot had counted [eighty - seven women]955-eighty - seven women go by , [one after another]956-one after another , without there being a tolerable face among [them]955-eighty - seven women . It had been a frosty morning , to be sure , a sharp frost , which [hardly one woman in a thousand]957-hardly one woman in a thousand could stand the test of . But still , there certainly were a dreadful multitude of [ugly women in [Bath]9-bath]958-ugly women in bath ; and as for [the men]959-the men ! [they]959-the men were infinitely worse . [Such scarecrows as [the streets]2932-the streets]960-such scarecrows as the streets were full of ! It was evident how little [the women]962-the women were used to the sight of anything tolerable , by the effect which [a man of decent appearance]963-a man of decent appearance produced . [He]98-mr elliot had never walked anywhere arm - in - arm with [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis ( who was a fine military figure , though sandy - haired ) without observing that [every woman]964-every woman ’s eye was upon [him]98-mr elliot ; [every woman]964-every woman ’s eye was sure to be upon [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis . ” [Modest Sir Walter]173-sir walter ! [He]0-i was not allowed to escape , however . [[His]0-i daughter]1799-his daughter and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay united in hinting that [[Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis ’s companion]2989-colonel wallis ’s companion might have as good a figure as [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis , and certainly was not sandy - haired . “[171-colonel wallis] How is [Mary]90-mary looking ? ” said [Sir Walter]173-sir walter , in the height of [his]0-i good humour . “[171-colonel wallis] The last time [I]0-i saw [her]90-mary [she]90-mary had a red nose , but [I]0-i hope that may not happen every day . ” “[171-colonel wallis] Oh ! no , that must have been quite accidental . In general [she]90-mary has been in very good health and very good looks since [Michaelmas]122-michaelmas . ” “[90-mary] If [I]0-i thought it would not tempt [her]90-mary to go out in sharp winds , and grow coarse , [I]0-i would send [her]90-mary a new hat and pelisse . ” [Anne]89-anne was considering whether [she]89-anne should venture to suggest that a gown , or a cap , would not be liable to any such misuse , when a knock at the door suspended everything . “[0-i] A knock at the door ! and so late ! [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay decidedly thought it [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s knock . ” [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay was right . With all the state which [a butler]2990-a butler and [foot - boy]2991-foot - boy could give , [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was ushered into [the room]1874-the room .
