[Anne]89-anne drew a little back , while [the others]1828-the others received [his]98-mr elliot compliments , and [[her]101-mrs clay sister]1946-her sister [his]98-mr elliot apologies for calling at so unusual an hour , but “[98-mr elliot] [he]98-mr elliot could not be so near without wishing to know that neither [she]101-mrs clay nor [[her]101-mrs clay friend]2014-her friend had taken cold the day before , ” & c. & c. ; which was all as politely done , and as politely taken , as possible , but [her]101-mrs clay part must follow then . [Sir Walter]173-sir walter talked of [[his]98-mr elliot youngest daughter]2996-his youngest daughter ; “[98-mr elliot] [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot must give [him]98-mr elliot leave to present [him]98-mr elliot to [[his]98-mr elliot youngest daughter]2996-his youngest daughter ” ( there was no occasion for remembering [Mary]90-mary ) ; and [Anne]89-anne , smiling and blushing , very becomingly [shewed]2997-shewed to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot the pretty features which [he]98-mr elliot had by no means forgotten , and instantly saw , with amusement at [his]98-mr elliot little start of surprise , that [he]98-mr elliot had not been at all aware of who [she]89-anne was . [He]98-mr elliot looked completely astonished , but not more astonished than pleased ; [his]98-mr elliot eyes brightened ! and with the most perfect alacrity [he]98-mr elliot welcomed the relationship , alluded to the past , and entreated to be received as [an acquaintance]2998-an acquaintance already . [He]98-mr elliot was quite as good - looking as [he]98-mr elliot had appeared at [Lyme]43-lyme , [his]98-mr elliot countenance improved by speaking , and [his]98-mr elliot manners were so exactly what they ought to be , so polished , so easy , so particularly agreeable , that [she]89-anne could compare [them]2999-them in excellence to only [one person]3000-one person ’s manners . They were not the same , but [they]2999-them were , perhaps , equally good . [He]98-mr elliot sat down with [them]2999-them , and improved [their]2999-them conversation very much . There could be no doubt of [his]98-mr elliot being [a sensible man]1972-a sensible man . Ten minutes were enough to certify that . [His]98-mr elliot tone , [his]98-mr elliot expressions , [his]98-mr elliot choice of subject , [his]98-mr elliot knowing where to stop ; it was all the operation of [a sensible , discerning mind]3002-a sensible , discerning mind . As soon as [he]98-mr elliot could , [he]98-mr elliot began to talk to [her]89-anne of [Lyme]43-lyme , wanting to compare opinions respecting [the place]913-the place , but especially wanting to speak of the circumstance of [their]2999-them happening to be [guests]3004-guests in [the same inn]2676-the same inn at the same time ; to give [his]98-mr elliot own route , understand something of [hers]89-anne , and regret that [he]98-mr elliot should have lost such an opportunity of paying [his]98-mr elliot respects to [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne gave [him]98-mr elliot a short account of [her]89-anne party and business at [Lyme]43-lyme . [His]98-mr elliot regret increased as [he]98-mr elliot listened . [He]98-mr elliot had spent [his]98-mr elliot whole solitary evening in [the room adjoining [theirs]2999-them]3006-the room adjoining theirs ; had heard voices , mirth continually ; thought [they]2999-them must be [a most delightful set of people]3007-a most delightful set of people , longed to be with [them]2999-them , but certainly without the smallest suspicion of [his]98-mr elliot possessing the shadow of a right to introduce [himself]98-mr elliot . If [he]98-mr elliot had but asked who [the party were]3008-the party were ! The name of [Musgrove]139-uppercross would have told [him]98-mr elliot enough . “[98-mr elliot] Well , it would serve to cure [him]971-him of an absurd practice of never asking a question at [an inn]972-an inn , which [he]971-him had adopted , when quite [a young man]1938-a young man , on the principle of its being very ungenteel to be curious . ” “[98-mr elliot] The notions of [a young man of one or two and twenty]974-a young man of one or two and twenty , ” said [he]0-i , “[971-him] as to what is necessary in manners to make [him]974-a young man of one or two and twenty quite the thing , are more absurd , [I]0-i believe , than those of [any other set of beings in [the world]1711-the world]975-any other set of beings in the world . The folly of the means [they]977-they often employ is only to be equalled by the folly of what [they]977-they have in view . ” But [he]0-i must not be addressing [his]0-i reflections to [Anne]89-anne alone : [he]0-i knew it ; [he]0-i was soon diffused again among [the others]1828-the others , and it was only at intervals that [he]0-i could return to [Lyme]43-lyme . [His]0-i enquiries , however , produced at length an account of the scene [she]89-anne had been engaged in [there]1845-there , soon after [his]0-i leaving [the place]913-the place . Having alluded to “[978-you] an accident , ” [he]0-i must hear the whole . When [he]0-i questioned , [Sir Walter]173-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth began to question also , but the difference in [their]977-they manner of doing it could not be unfelt . [She]89-anne could only compare [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , in the wish of really comprehending what had passed , and in the degree of concern for what [she]89-anne must have suffered in witnessing it . [He]0-i staid an hour with [them]977-they . The elegant little clock on the mantel - piece had struck “[978-you] eleven with its silver sounds , ” and [the watchman]3012-the watchman was beginning to be heard at a distance telling the same tale , before [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot or [any of [them]977-they]3013-any of them seemed to feel that [he]0-i had been [there]1845-there long . [Anne]89-anne could not have supposed it possible that [her]89-anne first evening in [Camden Place]53-camden place could have passed so well ! CHAPTER XVI . There was one point which [Anne]89-anne , on returning to [[her]89-anne family]636-her family , would have been more thankful to ascertain even than [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s being in love with [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , which was , [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s not being in love with [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ; and [she]89-anne was very far from easy about it , when [she]89-anne had been at [home]1756-home a few hours . On going down to breakfast the next morning , [she]89-anne found there had just been a decent pretence on [the lady]2454-the lady ’s side of meaning to leave [them]636-her family . [She]89-anne could imagine [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay to have said , that “[978-you] now [Miss Anne]89-anne was come , [she]89-anne could not suppose [herself]89-anne at all wanted ; ” for [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was replying in a sort of whisper , “[89-anne] That must not be any reason , indeed . [I]0-i assure [you]978-you [I]0-i feel it none . [She]89-anne is nothing to [me]0-i , compared with [you]978-you ; ” and [she]89-anne was in full time to hear [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father say , “[89-anne] [[My]0-i dear madam]979-my dear madam , this must not be . As yet , [you]978-you have seen nothing of [Bath]9-bath . [You]978-you have been here only to be useful . [You]978-you must not run away from [us]980-us now . [You]978-you must stay to be acquainted with [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis , [the beautiful Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis . To [your]978-you fine mind , [I]0-i well know the sight of beauty is a real gratification . ” [He]1745-her father spoke and looked so much in earnest , that [Anne]89-anne was not surprised to see [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay stealing a glance at [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [herself]101-mrs clay . [Her]101-mrs clay countenance , perhaps , might express some watchfulness ; but the praise of the fine mind did not appear to excite a thought in [[her]89-anne sister]1946-her sister . [The lady]2454-the lady could not but yield to such joint entreaties , and promise to stay . In the course of the same morning , [Anne]89-anne and [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father chancing to be alone together , [he]1745-her father began to compliment [her]981-her on [her]981-her improved looks ; [he]1745-her father thought [her]981-her “[981-her] less thin in [her]981-her person , in [her]981-her cheeks ; [her]981-her skin , [her]981-her complexion , greatly improved ; clearer , fresher . Had [she]981-her been using any thing in particular ? ” “[981-her] No , nothing . ” “[981-her] [Merely Gowland]61-gowland , ” [he]1745-her father supposed . “[61-gowland] No , nothing at all . ” “[981-her] Ha ! [he]982-he was surprised at that ; ” and added , “[981-her] certainly [you]983-you can not do better than to continue as [you]983-you are ; [you]983-you can not be better than well ; or [I]0-i should recommend [Gowland]61-gowland , the constant use of [Gowland]61-gowland , during the spring months . [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay has been using it at [my]0-i recommendation , and [you]983-you see what it has done for [her]101-mrs clay . [You]983-you see how it has carried away [her]101-mrs clay freckles . ” If [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth could but have heard this ! Such personal praise might have struck [her]87-elizabeth , especially as it did not appear to [Anne]89-anne that the freckles were at all lessened . But everything must take its chance . The evil of a marriage would be much diminished , if [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were also to marry . As for [herself]87-elizabeth , [she]87-elizabeth might always command a home with [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s composed mind and polite manners were put to some trial on this point , in [her]97-lady russell intercourse in [Camden Place]53-camden place . The sight of [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay in such favour , and of [Anne]89-anne so overlooked , was a perpetual provocation to [her]101-mrs clay there ; and vexed [her]101-mrs clay as much when [she]101-mrs clay was away , as [a person in Bath who drinks the water]3023-a person in bath who drinks the water , gets all the new publications , and has [a very large acquaintance]3024-a very large acquaintance , has time to be vexed . As [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot became known to [her]101-mrs clay , [she]101-mrs clay grew more charitable , or more indifferent , towards [the others]1828-the others . [His]98-mr elliot manners were an immediate recommendation ; and on conversing with [him]98-mr elliot [she]101-mrs clay found the solid so fully supporting the superficial , that [she]101-mrs clay was at first , as [she]101-mrs clay told [Anne]89-anne , almost ready to exclaim , “[983-you] Can this be [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ? ” and could not seriously picture to [herself]101-mrs clay [a more agreeable or estimable man]3026-a more agreeable or estimable man . Everything united in [him]98-mr elliot ; good understanding , correct opinions , knowledge of [the world]1711-the world , and a warm heart . [He]98-mr elliot had strong feelings of family attachment and family honour , without pride or weakness ; [he]98-mr elliot lived with the liberality of [a man of fortune , without display]3028-a man of fortune , without display ; [he]98-mr elliot judged for [himself]98-mr elliot in everything essential , without defying public opinion in any point of worldly decorum . [He]98-mr elliot was steady , observant , moderate , candid ; never run away with by spirits or by selfishness , which fancied itself strong feeling ; and yet , with a sensibility to what was amiable and lovely , and a value for all the felicities of domestic life , which [characters of fancied enthusiasm and violent agitation]3029-characters of fancied enthusiasm and violent agitation seldom really possess . [She]101-mrs clay was sure that [he]98-mr elliot had not been happy in marriage . [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis said it , and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell saw it ; but it had been no unhappiness to sour [his]98-mr elliot mind , nor ( [she]101-mrs clay began pretty soon to suspect ) to prevent [his]98-mr elliot thinking of a second choice . [Her]101-mrs clay satisfaction in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot outweighed all the plague of [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . It was now some years since [Anne]89-anne had begun to learn that [she]89-anne and [[her]89-anne excellent friend]3030-her excellent friend could sometimes think differently ; and it did not surprise [her]89-anne , therefore , that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell should see nothing suspicious or inconsistent , nothing to require more motives than appeared , in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s great desire of a reconciliation . In [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s view , it was perfectly natural that [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , at a mature time of life , should feel it a most desirable object , and what would very generally recommend [him]98-mr elliot among [all sensible people]3031-all sensible people , to be on good terms with [the head of [[his]98-mr elliot family]1698-his family]940-the head of his family ; the simplest process in [the world]1711-the world of time upon a head naturally clear , and only erring in the heyday of youth . [Anne]89-anne presumed , however , still to smile about it , and at last to mention “[87-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth . ” [Lady Russell]97-lady russell listened , and looked , and made only this cautious reply:—“Elizabeth[87-elizabeth] ! very well ; time will explain . ” It was a reference to the future , which [Anne]89-anne , after a little observation , felt [she]89-anne must submit to . [She]89-anne could determine nothing at present . In [that house]1913-that house [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth must be first ; and [she]87-elizabeth was in the habit of such general observance as “[89-anne] [Miss Elliot]89-anne , ” that any particularity of attention seemed almost impossible . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , too , it must be remembered , had not been [a widower]1727-a widower seven months . A little delay on [his]98-mr elliot side might be very excusable . In fact , [Anne]89-anne could never see the crape round [his]98-mr elliot hat , without fearing that [she]89-anne was [the inexcusable one]3037-the inexcusable one , in attributing to [him]98-mr elliot such imaginations ; for though [his]98-mr elliot marriage had not been very happy , still it had existed so many years that [she]89-anne could not comprehend a very rapid recovery from the awful impression of its being dissolved . However it might end , [he]98-mr elliot was without any question [their]3038-their pleasantest acquaintance in [Bath]9-bath : [she]89-anne saw [[nobody]271-nobody equal to [him]98-mr elliot]3040-nobody equal to him ; and it was a great indulgence now and then to talk to [him]98-mr elliot about [Lyme]43-lyme , which [he]98-mr elliot seemed to have as lively a wish to see again , and to see more of , as [herself]89-anne . [They]3038-their went through the particulars of [their]3038-their first meeting a great many times . [He]98-mr elliot gave [her]89-anne to understand that [he]98-mr elliot had looked at [her]89-anne with some earnestness . [She]89-anne knew it well ; and [she]89-anne remembered [another person]783-another person ’s look also . [They]3038-their did not always think alike . [His]98-mr elliot value for rank and connexion [she]89-anne perceived was greater than [hers]89-anne . It was not merely complaisance , it must be a liking to the cause , which made [him]98-mr elliot enter warmly into [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister ’s solicitudes on a subject which [she]89-anne thought unworthy to excite [them]3038-their . The Bath paper one morning announced the arrival of [the Dowager Viscountess Dalrymple]175-the dowager viscountess dalrymple , and [[her]175-the dowager viscountess dalrymple daughter]3044-her daughter , [the Honourable Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret ; and all the comfort of No . — , [Camden Place]53-camden place , was swept away for many days ; for [the Dalrymples]177-the dalrymples ( in [Anne]89-anne ’s opinion , most unfortunately ) were [cousins of [the Elliots]178-the elliots]3045-cousins of the elliots ; and the agony was how to introduce [themselves]177-the dalrymples properly . [Anne]89-anne had never seen [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister before in contact with [nobility]3048-nobility , and [she]89-anne must acknowledge [herself]89-anne disappointed . [She]89-anne had hoped better things from [their]985-our cousins high ideas of [their]985-our cousins own situation in life , and was reduced to form a wish which [she]89-anne had never foreseen ; a wish that [they]985-our cousins had more pride ; for “[89-anne] [[our]984-our cousins]985-our cousins [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret ; ” “[985-our cousins] [[our]984-our cousins]985-our cousins , [the Dalrymples]177-the dalrymples , ” sounded in [her]89-anne ears all day long . [Sir Walter]173-sir walter had once been in company with [the late viscount]3049-the late viscount , but had never seen any of [the rest of [the family]1782-the family]3050-the rest of the family ; and the difficulties of the case arose from there having been a suspension of all intercourse by letters of ceremony , ever since the death of [that said late viscount]3052-that said late viscount , when , in consequence of a dangerous illness of [Sir Walter]173-sir walter ’s at the same time , there had been an unlucky omission at [Kellynch]5-kellynch . No letter of condolence had been sent to [Ireland]63-ireland . The neglect had been visited on the head of [the sinner]3053-the sinner ; for when poor [Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot died [herself]96-lady elliot , no letter of condolence was received at [Kellynch]5-kellynch , and , consequently , there was but too much reason to apprehend that [the Dalrymples]177-the dalrymples considered the relationship as closed . How to have this anxious business set to rights , and be admitted as [cousins]2125-cousins again , was the question : and it was a question which , in a more rational manner , neither [Lady Russell]97-lady russell nor [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot thought unimportant . “[177-the dalrymples] [Family connexions]987-family connexions were always worth preserving , good company always worth seeking ; [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple had taken [a house]249-a house , for three months , in [Laura Place]64-laura place , and would be living in style . [She]179-lady dalrymple had been at [Bath]9-bath the year before , and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had heard [her]179-lady dalrymple spoken of as [a charming woman]989-a charming woman . It was very desirable that the connexion should be renewed , if it could be done , without any compromise of propriety on the side of [the Elliots]178-the elliots . ” [Sir Walter]173-sir walter , however , would choose [his]173-sir walter own means , and at last wrote a very fine letter of ample explanation , regret , and entreaty , to [[his]173-sir walter right honourable cousin]3055-his right honourable cousin . Neither [Lady Russell]97-lady russell nor [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot could admire the letter ; but it did all that was wanted , in bringing three lines of scrawl from [the Dowager Viscountess]3056-the dowager viscountess . “[179-lady dalrymple] [She]179-lady dalrymple was very much honoured , and should be happy in [their]990-they acquaintance . ” The toils of the business were over , the sweets began . [They]990-they visited in [Laura Place]64-laura place , [they]990-they had the cards of [Dowager Viscountess Dalrymple]175-the dowager viscountess dalrymple , and [the Honourable Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , to be arranged wherever [they]990-they might be most visible : and “[179-lady dalrymple] [[Our]991-our cousins]985-our cousins in [Laura]65-laura Place,”—“Our cousin , [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , ”[179-lady dalrymple] were talked of to [everybody]2119-everybody . [Anne]89-anne was ashamed . Had [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [[her]179-lady dalrymple daughter]3044-her daughter even been very agreeable , [she]89-anne would still have been ashamed of the agitation [they]990-they created , but [they]990-they were nothing . There was no superiority of manner , accomplishment , or understanding . [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple had acquired the name of “ [a charming woman]989-a charming woman , ”[179-lady dalrymple] because [she]179-lady dalrymple had a smile and a civil answer for [everybody]2119-everybody . [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , with still less to say , was so plain and so awkward , that [she]176-miss carteret would never have been tolerated in [Camden Place]53-camden place but for [her]176-miss carteret birth . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell confessed [she]97-lady russell had expected something better ; but yet “ it was an acquaintance worth having ; ”[97-lady russell] and when [Anne]89-anne ventured to speak [her]89-anne opinion of [them]990-they to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , [he]98-mr elliot agreed to [their]990-they being nothing in [themselves]990-they , but still maintained that , as [a family]1907-a family connexion , as good company , as [those who would collect good company around [them]990-they]997-those who would collect good company around them , [they]990-they had [their]990-they value . [Anne]89-anne smiled and said , “ [My]89-anne idea of good company , [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , is the company of [clever , well - informed people , who have a great deal of conversation]3058-clever , well - informed people , who have a great deal of conversation ; that is what [I]89-anne call good company . ”[89-anne] “ [You]89-anne are mistaken , ”[98-mr elliot] said [he]98-mr elliot gently , “ that is not good company ; that is the best . [Good company]3059-good company requires only birth , education , and manners , and with regard to education is not very nice . Birth and good manners are essential ; but a little learning is by no means a dangerous thing in good company ; on the contrary , it will do very well . [[My]98-mr elliot cousin]3060-my cousin [Anne]89-anne shakes [her]89-anne head . [She]89-anne is not satisfied . [She]89-anne is fastidious . [[My]98-mr elliot dear cousin]3061-my dear cousin ”[98-mr elliot] ( sitting down by [her]89-anne ) , “ [you]89-anne have a better right to be fastidious than almost [any other woman [I]98-mr elliot know]3062-any other woman i know ; but will it answer ? Will it make [you]89-anne happy ? Will it not be wiser to accept [the society of [those good ladies in [Laura Place]64-laura place]3064-those good ladies in laura place]3063-the society of those good ladies in laura place , and enjoy all the advantages of the connexion as far as possible ? [You]89-anne may depend upon it , that [they]3064-those good ladies in laura place will move in the first set in [Bath]9-bath this winter , and as rank is rank , [your]89-anne being known to be related to [them]3064-those good ladies in laura place will have its use in fixing [[your]89-anne family]3065-your family ( [[our]3066-we family]777-our family let [me]98-mr elliot say ) in that degree of consideration which [we]3066-we must all wish for . ”[98-mr elliot] “ Yes , ”[89-anne] sighed [Anne]89-anne , “ [we]3066-we shall , indeed , be known to be related to [them]3064-those good ladies in laura place ! ”[89-anne] then recollecting [herself]89-anne , and not wishing to be answered , [she]89-anne added , “ [I]89-anne certainly do think there has been by far too much trouble taken to procure the acquaintance . [I]89-anne suppose ”[89-anne] ( smiling ) “ [I]89-anne have more pride than any of [you]89-anne ; but [I]89-anne confess it does vex [me]89-anne , that [we]3066-we should be so solicitous to have the relationship acknowledged , which [we]3066-we may be very sure is a matter of perfect indifference to [them]3064-those good ladies in laura place . ”[89-anne] “ Pardon [me]98-mr elliot , [dear cousin]3068-dear cousin , [you]3068-dear cousin are unjust in [your]3068-dear cousin own claims . In [London]6-london , perhaps , in [your]3068-dear cousin present quiet style of living , it might be as [you]3068-dear cousin say : but in [Bath]9-bath ; [Sir Walter Elliot]86-sir walter and [[his]86-sir walter family]1698-his family will always be worth knowing : always acceptable as acquaintance . ”[98-mr elliot] “ Well , ”[89-anne] said [Anne]89-anne , “ [I]89-anne certainly am proud , too proud to enjoy a welcome which depends so entirely upon place . ”[89-anne] “ [I]998-i love [your]89-anne indignation , ”[998-i] said [he]998-i ; “ it is very natural . But here [you]89-anne are in [Bath]9-bath , and the object is to be established [here]376-here with all the credit and dignity which ought to belong to [Sir Walter Elliot]86-sir walter . [You]89-anne talk of being proud ; [I]998-i am called proud , [I]998-i know , and [I]998-i shall not wish to believe [myself]998-i otherwise ; for [our]3071-we pride , if investigated , would have the same object , [I]998-i have no doubt , though the kind may seem a little different . In one point , [I]998-i am sure , [[my]998-i dear cousin]3061-my dear cousin , ”[998-i] ( [he]998-i continued , speaking lower , though there was [no one else]968-no one else in [the room]1874-the room ) “ in one point , [I]998-i am sure , [we]3071-we must feel alike . [We]3071-we must feel that [every addition to [[your]89-anne father]240-your father ’s society , among [[his]240-your father equals or [superiors]3076-superiors]3075-his equals or superiors]3073-every addition to your father ’s society , among his equals or superiors , may be of use in diverting [his]240-your father thoughts from [those who are beneath [him]240-your father]3077-those who are beneath him . ”[998-i] [He]998-i looked , as [he]998-i spoke , to the seat which [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay had been lately occupying : a sufficient explanation of what [he]998-i particularly meant ; and though [Anne]89-anne could not believe in [their]1001-their having the same sort of pride , [she]89-anne was pleased with [him]998-i for not liking [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ; and [her]89-anne conscience admitted that [his]998-i wishing to promote [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s getting great acquaintance was more than excusable in the view of defeating [her]89-anne . CHAPTER XVII . While [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were assiduously pushing [their]1001-their good fortune in [Laura Place]64-laura place , [Anne]89-anne was renewing an acquaintance of a very different description . [She]89-anne had called on [[her]89-anne former governess]1003-her former governess , and had heard from [her]1003-her former governess of there being [an old schoolfellow in [Bath]9-bath]1004-an old schoolfellow in bath , who had the two strong claims on [her]1003-her former governess attention of past kindness and present suffering . [Miss Hamilton]180-miss hamilton , now [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , had shewn [her]180-miss hamilton kindness in one of those periods of [her]180-miss hamilton life when it had been most valuable . [Anne]89-anne had gone unhappy to [school]1848-school , grieving for the loss of [a mother whom [she]89-anne had dearly loved , feeling [her]89-anne separation from [home]1756-home]1006-a mother whom she had dearly loved , feeling her separation from home , and suffering as [a girl of fourteen , of strong sensibility and not high spirits]1008-a girl of fourteen , of strong sensibility and not high spirits , must suffer at such a time ; and [Miss Hamilton]180-miss hamilton , three years older than [herself]89-anne , but still from the want of near relations and a settled home , remaining another year at [school]1848-school , had been useful and good to [her]89-anne in a way which had considerably lessened [her]89-anne misery , and could never be remembered with indifference . [Miss Hamilton]180-miss hamilton had left [school]1848-school , had married not long afterwards , was said to have married [a man of fortune]1011-a man of fortune , and this was all that [Anne]89-anne had known of [her]180-miss hamilton , till now that [[their]1012-their governess]1013-their governess ’s account brought [her]180-miss hamilton situation forward in a more decided but very different form . [She]180-miss hamilton was [a widow and poor]1014-a widow and poor . [[Her]180-miss hamilton husband]347-her husband had been extravagant ; and at [his]347-her husband death , about two years before , had left [his]347-her husband affairs dreadfully involved . [She]180-miss hamilton had had difficulties of every sort to contend with , and in addition to these distresses had been afflicted with a severe rheumatic fever , which , finally settling in [her]180-miss hamilton legs , had made [her]180-miss hamilton for the present a cripple . [She]180-miss hamilton had come to [Bath]9-bath on that account , and was now in lodgings near [the hot baths]1016-the hot baths , living in a very humble way , unable even to afford [herself]180-miss hamilton the comfort of [a servant]1017-a servant , and of course almost excluded from [society]1018-society . [[Their]1012-their mutual friend]1019-their mutual friend answered for the satisfaction which a visit from [Miss Elliot]89-anne would give [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , and [Anne]89-anne therefore lost no time in going . [She]89-anne mentioned nothing of what [she]89-anne had heard , or what [she]89-anne intended , at [home]1756-home . It would excite no proper interest there . [She]89-anne only consulted [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , who entered thoroughly into [her]180-miss hamilton sentiments , and was most happy to convey [her]180-miss hamilton as near to [[Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s lodgings in [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings]1021-mrs smith ’s lodgings in westgate buildings , as [Anne]89-anne chose to be taken . The visit was paid , [their]1012-their acquaintance re - established , [their]1012-their interest in [each other]1959-each other more than re - kindled . The first ten minutes had its awkwardness and its emotion . Twelve years were gone since [they]1012-their had parted , and each presented [a somewhat different person]1023-a somewhat different person from what [the other]2101-the other had imagined . Twelve years had changed [Anne]89-anne from [the blooming , silent , unformed girl of fifteen]1025-the blooming , silent , unformed girl of fifteen , to [the elegant little woman of seven - and - twenty , with every beauty except bloom]1026-the elegant little woman of seven - and - twenty , with every beauty except bloom , and with manners as consciously right as [they]1027-they were invariably gentle ; and twelve years had transformed [the fine - looking , well - grown Miss Hamilton]1028-the fine - looking , well - grown miss hamilton , in all the glow of health and confidence of superiority , into [a poor , infirm , helpless widow]1029-a poor , infirm , helpless widow , receiving the visit of [[her]1028-the fine - looking , well - grown miss hamilton former protegee]1030-her former protegee as a favour ; but all that was uncomfortable in the meeting had soon passed away , and left only the interesting charm of remembering former partialities and talking over old times . [Anne]89-anne found in [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith the good sense and agreeable manners which [she]89-anne had almost ventured to depend on , and a disposition to converse and be cheerful beyond [her]89-anne expectation . Neither the dissipations of the past — and [she]89-anne had lived very much in [the world]1711-the world — nor the restrictions of the present , neither sickness nor sorrow seemed to have closed [her]89-anne heart or ruined [her]89-anne spirits . In the course of a second visit [she]89-anne talked with great openness , and [Anne]89-anne ’s astonishment increased . [She]89-anne could scarcely imagine a more cheerless situation in itself than [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s . [She]89-anne had been very fond of [[her]89-anne husband]347-her husband : [she]89-anne had buried [him]347-her husband . [She]89-anne had been used to affluence : it was gone . [She]89-anne had [no child]1033-no child to connect [her]89-anne with life and happiness again , no relations to assist in the arrangement of perplexed affairs , no health to make all the rest supportable . [[Her]89-anne accommodations]1034-her accommodations were limited to [a noisy parlour]1035-a noisy parlour , and [a dark bedroom]1036-a dark bedroom behind , with no possibility of moving from one to the other without assistance , which there was only [one servant in [the house]1780-the house]1037-one servant in the house to afford , and [she]89-anne never quitted [the house]1780-the house but to be conveyed into the warm bath . Yet , in spite of all this , [Anne]89-anne had reason to believe that [she]89-anne had moments only of languor and depression , to hours of occupation and enjoyment . How could it be ? [She]89-anne watched , observed , reflected , and finally determined that this was not a case of fortitude or of resignation only . [A submissive spirit]1040-a submissive spirit might be patient , a strong understanding would supply resolution , but here was something more ; here was that elasticity of mind , that disposition to be comforted , that power of turning readily from evil to good , and of finding employment which carried [her]89-anne out of [herself]89-anne , which was from nature alone . It was the choicest gift of Heaven ; and [Anne]89-anne viewed [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend as one of those instances in which , by a merciful appointment , it seems designed to counterbalance almost every other want . There had been a time , [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith told [her]89-anne , when [her]89-anne spirits had nearly failed . [She]89-anne could not call [herself]89-anne [an invalid]1042-an invalid now , compared with [her]89-anne state on first reaching Bath . Then [she]89-anne had , indeed , been [a pitiable object]1043-a pitiable object ; for [she]89-anne had caught cold on the journey , and had hardly taken possession of [[her]89-anne lodgings]1044-her lodgings before [she]89-anne was again confined to [her]89-anne bed and suffering under severe and constant pain ; and all this among [strangers]2276-strangers , with the absolute necessity of having [a regular nurse]1046-a regular nurse , and finances at that moment particularly unfit to meet any extraordinary expense . [She]89-anne had weathered it , however , and could truly say that it had done [her]89-anne good . It had increased [her]89-anne comforts by making [her]89-anne feel [herself]89-anne to be in good hands . [She]89-anne had seen too much of [the world]1711-the world , to expect sudden or disinterested attachment anywhere , but [her]89-anne illness had proved to [her]89-anne that [[her]89-anne landlady]1048-her landlady had a character to preserve , and would not use [her]89-anne ill ; and [she]89-anne had been particularly fortunate in [[her]89-anne nurse]1049-her nurse , as [a sister of [[her]89-anne landlady]1048-her landlady , [a nurse]2813-a nurse by profession , and who had always [a home in [that house]1913-that house when unemployed]1053-a home in that house when unemployed , chanced to be at liberty just in time to attend [her]89-anne]1050-a sister of her landlady , a nurse by profession , and who had always a home in that house when unemployed , chanced to be at liberty just in time to attend her . “ And [she]89-anne , ”[181-mrs smith] said [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , “ besides nursing [me]181-mrs smith most admirably , has really proved an invaluable acquaintance . As soon as [I]181-mrs smith could use [my]181-mrs smith hands [she]89-anne taught [me]181-mrs smith to knit , which has been a great amusement ; and [she]89-anne put [me]181-mrs smith in the way of making these little thread - cases , pin - cushions and card - racks , which [you]3078-you always find [me]181-mrs smith so busy about , and which supply [me]181-mrs smith with the means of doing a little good to one or [two very poor families in [this neighbourhood]3080-this neighbourhood]3079-two very poor families in this neighbourhood . [She]89-anne had a large acquaintance , of course professionally , among [those who can afford to buy]3081-those who can afford to buy , and [she]89-anne disposes of [my]181-mrs smith merchandise . [She]89-anne always takes the right time for applying . [Everybody]2119-everybody ’s heart is open , [you]3078-you know , when [they]2119-everybody have recently escaped from severe pain , or are recovering the blessing of health , and [Nurse Rooke]182-nurse rooke thoroughly understands when to speak . [She]182-nurse rooke is [a shrewd , intelligent , sensible woman]3083-a shrewd , intelligent , sensible woman . [Hers]182-nurse rooke is a line for seeing human nature ; and [she]182-nurse rooke has a fund of good sense and observation , which , as a companion , make [her]182-nurse rooke infinitely superior to [thousands of those who having only received ‘ the best education in [the world]1711-the world]3084-thousands of those who having only received ‘ the best education in the world , ’ know nothing worth attending to . Call it gossip , if [you]3078-you will , but when [Nurse Rooke]182-nurse rooke has half an hour ’s leisure to bestow on [me]181-mrs smith , [she]182-nurse rooke is sure to have something to relate that is entertaining and profitable : something that makes [one]1726-one know [one]1726-one ’s species better . [One]1726-one likes to hear what is going on , to be au fait as to the newest modes of being trifling and silly . To [me]181-mrs smith , who live so much alone , [her]182-nurse rooke conversation , [I]181-mrs smith assure [you]3078-you , is a treat . ”[181-mrs smith] [Anne]89-anne , far from wishing to cavil at the pleasure , replied , “ [I]89-anne can easily believe it . [Women of that class]3089-women of that class have great opportunities , and if [they]3089-women of that class are intelligent may be well worth listening to . Such varieties of human nature as they are in the habit of witnessing ! And it is not merely in its follies , that they are well read ; for [they]3089-women of that class see it occasionally under every circumstance that can be most interesting or affecting . What instances must pass before [them]3089-women of that class of ardent , disinterested , self - denying attachment , of heroism , fortitude , patience , resignation : of all the conflicts and all the sacrifices that ennoble [us]3090-us most . [A sick chamber]3091-a sick chamber may often furnish the worth of volumes . ”[89-anne] “ Yes , ”[181-mrs smith] said [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith more doubtingly , “ sometimes it may , though [I]181-mrs smith fear its lessons are not often in the elevated style [you]3078-you describe . Here and there , human nature may be great in times of trial ; but generally speaking , it is its weakness and not its strength that appears in [a sick chamber]3091-a sick chamber : it is selfishness and impatience rather than generosity and fortitude , that [one]1726-one hears of . There is so little real friendship in [the world]1711-the world ! and unfortunately ”[181-mrs smith] ( speaking low and tremulously ) “ there are [so many who forget to think seriously till it is almost too late]3095-so many who forget to think seriously till it is almost too late . ”[181-mrs smith] [Anne]89-anne saw the misery of such feelings . [The husband]1055-the husband had not been what [he]1055-the husband ought , and [the wife]1056-the wife had been led among that part of [mankind]1057-mankind which made [her]1056-the wife think worse of [the world]1711-the world than [she]1056-the wife hoped it deserved . It was but a passing emotion however with [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ; [she]181-mrs smith shook it off , and soon added in a different tone — “ [I]181-mrs smith do not suppose the situation [[my]181-mrs smith friend]3096-my friend [Mrs Rooke]183-mrs rooke is in at present , will furnish much either to interest or edify [me]181-mrs smith . [She]3096-my friend is only nursing [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis of [Marlborough Buildings]58-marlborough buildings ; [a mere pretty , silly , expensive , fashionable woman]3097-a mere pretty , silly , expensive , fashionable woman , [I]181-mrs smith believe ; and of course will have nothing to report but of lace and finery . [I]181-mrs smith mean to make [my]181-mrs smith profit of [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis , however . [She]172-mrs wallis has plenty of money , and [I]181-mrs smith intend [she]172-mrs wallis shall buy all the high - priced things [I]181-mrs smith have in hand now . ”[181-mrs smith] [Anne]89-anne had called several times on [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend , before the existence of [such a person]730-such a person was known in [Camden Place]53-camden place . At last , it became necessary to speak of [her]2014-her friend . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter , [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , returned one morning from [Laura Place]64-laura place , with a sudden invitation from [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple for the same evening , and [Anne]89-anne was already engaged , to spend that evening in [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings . [She]89-anne was not sorry for the excuse . [They]1061-they were only asked , [she]89-anne was sure , because [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple being kept at [home]1756-home by a bad cold , was glad to make use of the relationship which had been so pressed on [her]179-lady dalrymple ; and [she]179-lady dalrymple declined on [her]179-lady dalrymple own account with great alacrity—“She was engaged to spend the evening with [an old schoolfellow]3098-an old schoolfellow . ”[1061-they] [They]1061-they were not much interested in anything relative to [Anne]89-anne ; but still there were questions enough asked , to make it understood what [this old schoolfellow]1063-this old schoolfellow was ; and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was disdainful , and [Sir Walter]86-sir walter severe . “ [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings ! ”[86-sir walter] said [he]86-sir walter , “ and who is [Miss Anne Elliot]89-anne to be visiting in [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings ? [A Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith . [A widow [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith]3099-a widow mrs smith ; and who was [[her]181-mrs smith husband]347-her husband ? One of five thousand [Mr Smiths whose names are to be met with everywhere]3101-mr smiths whose names are to be met with everywhere . And what is [her]181-mrs smith attraction ? That [she]181-mrs smith is old and sickly . Upon [my]86-sir walter word , [Miss Anne Elliot]89-anne , [you]89-anne have the most extraordinary taste ! Everything that revolts [other people]3102-other people , low company , [paltry rooms]3103-paltry rooms , foul air , disgusting associations are inviting to [you]89-anne . But surely [you]89-anne may put off [this old lady]3104-this old lady till to - morrow : [she]3104-this old lady is not so near [her]3104-this old lady end , [I]86-sir walter presume , but that [she]3104-this old lady may hope to see another day . What is [her]3104-this old lady age ? Forty ? ”[86-sir walter] “ No , [sir]592-sir , [she]3104-this old lady is not one - and - thirty ; but [I]87-elizabeth do not think [I]87-elizabeth can put off [my]87-elizabeth engagement , because it is the only evening for some time which will at once suit [her]3104-this old lady and [myself]87-elizabeth . [She]3104-this old lady goes into the warm bath to - morrow , and for the rest of the week , [you]592-sir know , [we]3106-we are engaged . ”[87-elizabeth] “ But what does [Lady Russell]97-lady russell think of [this acquaintance]3107-this acquaintance ? ”[87-elizabeth] asked [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth . “ [She]97-lady russell sees nothing to blame in it , ”[89-anne] replied [Anne]89-anne ; “ on the contrary , [she]97-lady russell approves it , and has generally taken [me]89-anne when [I]89-anne have called on [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith . ”[89-anne] “ [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings must have been rather surprised by the appearance of [a carriage]414-a carriage drawn up near [its]67-westgate buildings pavement , ”[86-sir walter] observed [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . “ [[Sir Henry Russell]184-sir henry russell ’s widow]3109-sir henry russell ’s widow , indeed , has no honours to distinguish [her]3104-this old lady arms , but still it is [a handsome equipage]3110-a handsome equipage , and no doubt is well known to convey [a Miss Elliot]89-anne . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ! Such a name ! ”[86-sir walter] [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , who had been present while all this passed , now thought it advisable to leave [the room]1874-the room , and [Anne]89-anne could have said much , and did long to say a little in defence of [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend ’s not very dissimilar claims to [theirs]1066-theirs , but [her]89-anne sense of personal respect to [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father prevented [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne made no reply . [She]89-anne left it to [himself]1745-her father to recollect , that [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith was not [the only widow in [Bath]9-bath]1068-the only widow in bath between thirty and forty , with little to live on , and no surname of dignity . [Anne]89-anne kept [her]89-anne appointment ; [the others]1828-the others kept [theirs]1828-the others , and of course [she]89-anne heard the next morning that [they]1066-theirs had had a delightful evening . [She]181-mrs smith had been [the only one of [the set absent]1071-the set absent]1070-the only one of the set absent , for [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth had not only been quite at [[her]181-mrs smith ladyship]1072-her ladyship ’s service [themselves]1066-theirs , but had actually been happy to be employed by [her]181-mrs smith in collecting [others]1859-others , and had been at the trouble of inviting both [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had made a point of leaving [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis early , and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had fresh arranged all [her]97-lady russell evening engagements in order to wait on [her]97-lady russell . [Anne]89-anne had the whole history of all that such an evening could supply from [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . To [her]89-anne , its greatest interest must be , in having been very much talked of between [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; in having been wished for , regretted , and at the same time honoured for staying away in such a cause . [Her]89-anne kind , compassionate visits to [this old schoolfellow , sick and reduced]1075-this old schoolfellow , sick and reduced , seemed to have quite delighted [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot thought [her]89-anne [a most extraordinary young woman]1076-a most extraordinary young woman ; in [her]89-anne temper , manners , mind , [a model of female excellence]1077-a model of female excellence . [He]98-mr elliot could meet even [Lady Russell]97-lady russell in a discussion of [her]89-anne merits ; and [Anne]89-anne could not be given to understand so much by [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend , could not know [herself]89-anne to be so highly rated by [a sensible man]1972-a sensible man , without many of those agreeable sensations which [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend meant to create . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell was now perfectly decided in [her]97-lady russell opinion of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [She]97-lady russell was as much convinced of [his]98-mr elliot meaning to gain [Anne]89-anne in time as of [his]98-mr elliot deserving [her]89-anne , and was beginning to calculate the number of weeks which would free [him]98-mr elliot from all the remaining restraints of widowhood , and leave [him]98-mr elliot at liberty to exert [his]98-mr elliot most open powers of pleasing . [She]97-lady russell would not speak to [Anne]89-anne with half the certainty [she]97-lady russell felt on the subject , [she]97-lady russell would venture on little more than hints of what might be hereafter , of a possible attachment on [his]98-mr elliot side , of the desirableness of the alliance , supposing such attachment to be real and returned . [Anne]89-anne heard [her]97-lady russell , and made no violent exclamations ; [she]89-anne only smiled , blushed , and gently shook [her]89-anne head . “ [I]97-lady russell am [no match - maker]3118-no match - maker , as [you]89-anne well know , ”[97-lady russell] said [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , “ being much too well aware of the uncertainty of all human events and calculations . [I]97-lady russell only mean that if [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot should some time hence pay [his]98-mr elliot addresses to [you]89-anne , and if [you]89-anne should be disposed to accept [him]98-mr elliot , [I]97-lady russell think there would be every possibility of [your]89-anne being happy together . A most suitable connection [everybody]2119-everybody must consider it , but [I]97-lady russell think it might be a very happy one . ”[97-lady russell] “ [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot is [an exceedingly agreeable man]3120-an exceedingly agreeable man , and in many respects [I]89-anne think highly of [him]98-mr elliot , ”[89-anne] said [Anne]89-anne ; “ but [we]3121-we should not suit . ”[89-anne] [Lady Russell]97-lady russell let this pass , and only said in rejoinder , “ [I]97-lady russell own that to be able to regard [you]89-anne as [the future mistress of [Kellynch]5-kellynch]3122-the future mistress of kellynch , [the future Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot , to look forward and see [you]89-anne occupying [[[your]89-anne dear mother]3123-your dear mother ’s place]3124-your dear mother ’s place , succeeding to all [her]3123-your dear mother rights , and all [her]3123-your dear mother popularity , as well as to all [her]3123-your dear mother virtues , would be the highest possible gratification to [me]97-lady russell . [You]89-anne are [[your]89-anne mother]3125-your mother ’s self in countenance and disposition ; and if [I]97-lady russell might be allowed to fancy [you]89-anne such as [she]3123-your dear mother was , in situation and name , and [home]1756-home , presiding and blessing in the same spot , and only superior to [her]3123-your dear mother in being more highly valued ! [[My]97-lady russell dearest]3127-my dearest [Anne]89-anne , it would give [me]97-lady russell more delight than is often felt at [my]97-lady russell time of life ! ”[97-lady russell] [Anne]89-anne was obliged to turn away , to rise , to walk to a distant table , and , leaning there in pretended employment , try to subdue the feelings this picture excited . For a few moments [her]89-anne imagination and [her]89-anne heart were bewitched . The idea of becoming what [[her]89-anne mother]1735-her mother had been ; of having the precious name of “ [Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot ”[97-lady russell] first revived in [herself]89-anne ; of being restored to [Kellynch]5-kellynch , calling it [[her]89-anne home]1841-her home again , [[her]89-anne home]1841-her home for ever , was a charm which [she]89-anne could not immediately resist . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell said not another word , willing to leave the matter to [its]1084-its own operation ; and believing that , could [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot at that moment with propriety have spoken for [himself!—she]98-mr elliot believed , in short , what [Anne]89-anne did not believe . The same image of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot speaking for [himself]98-mr elliot brought [Anne]89-anne to composure again . The charm of [Kellynch]5-kellynch and of “ [Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot ”[5-kellynch] all faded away . [She]89-anne never could accept [him]98-mr elliot . And it was not only that [her]89-anne feelings were still adverse to [any man]1085-any man save [one]1726-one ; [her]89-anne judgement , on a serious consideration of the possibilities of such a case , was against [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . Though [they]1087-they had now been acquainted a month , [she]89-anne could not be satisfied that [she]89-anne really knew [his]98-mr elliot character . That [he]98-mr elliot was [a sensible man]1972-a sensible man , [an agreeable man]1089-an agreeable man , that [he]98-mr elliot talked well , professed good opinions , seemed to judge properly and as [a man of principle]242-a man of principle , this was all clear enough . [He]98-mr elliot certainly knew what was right , nor could [she]89-anne fix on any one article of moral duty evidently transgressed ; but yet [she]89-anne would have been afraid to answer for [his]98-mr elliot conduct . [She]89-anne distrusted the past , if not the present . The names which occasionally dropt of [former associates]1091-former associates , the allusions to former practices and pursuits , suggested suspicions not favourable of what [he]98-mr elliot had been . [She]89-anne saw that there had been bad habits ; that [Sunday]185-sunday travelling had been a common thing ; that there had been a period of [his]98-mr elliot life ( and probably not a short one ) when [he]98-mr elliot had been , at least , careless in all serious matters ; and , though [he]98-mr elliot might now think very differently , who could answer for the true sentiments of [a clever , cautious man , grown old enough to appreciate a fair character]1092-a clever , cautious man , grown old enough to appreciate a fair character ? How could it ever be ascertained that [his]98-mr elliot mind was truly cleansed ? [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was rational , discreet , polished , but [he]98-mr elliot was not open . There was never any burst of feeling , any warmth of indignation or delight , at the evil or good of [others]1859-others . This , to [Anne]89-anne , was a decided imperfection . [Her]89-anne early impressions were incurable . [She]89-anne prized the frank , the open - hearted , the eager character beyond all others . Warmth and enthusiasm did captivate [her]89-anne still . [She]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne could so much more depend upon the sincerity of [those who sometimes looked or said a careless or a hasty thing]1094-those who sometimes looked or said a careless or a hasty thing , than of [those whose presence of mind never varied , whose tongue never slipped]1095-those whose presence of mind never varied , whose tongue never slipped . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was too generally agreeable . Various as were the tempers in [[[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s house]1866-her father ’s house , [he]98-mr elliot pleased [them]1098-them all . [He]98-mr elliot endured too well , stood too well with every body . [He]98-mr elliot had spoken to [her]89-anne with some degree of openness of [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ; had appeared completely to see what [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay was about , and to hold [her]89-anne in contempt ; and yet [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay found [him]98-mr elliot as agreeable as any body . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell saw either less or more than [[her]97-lady russell young friend]1853-her young friend , for [she]97-lady russell saw nothing to excite distrust . [She]97-lady russell could not imagine [a man]307-a man more exactly what [he]307-a man ought to be than [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; nor did [she]97-lady russell ever enjoy a sweeter feeling than the hope of seeing [him]98-mr elliot receive the hand of [[her]97-lady russell beloved]1101-her beloved [Anne]89-anne in [Kellynch church]5-kellynch , in the course of the following autumn . CHAPTER XVIII . It was the beginning of February ; and [Anne]89-anne , having been a month in [Bath]9-bath , was growing very eager for news from [Uppercross]3-uppercross and [Lyme]43-lyme . [She]89-anne wanted to hear much more than [Mary]90-mary had communicated . It was three weeks since [she]89-anne had heard at all . [She]89-anne only knew that [Henrietta]117-henrietta was at [home]1756-home again ; and that [Louisa]118-louisa , though considered to be recovering fast , was still in [Lyme]43-lyme ; and [she]89-anne was thinking of [them]1103-them all very intently one evening , when a thicker letter than usual from [Mary]90-mary was delivered to [her]89-anne ; and , to quicken the pleasure and surprise , with [Admiral]106-admiral croft and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft ’s compliments . [The Crofts]111-the crofts must be in [Bath]9-bath ! A circumstance to interest [her]89-anne . [They]111-the crofts were people whom [her]89-anne heart turned to very naturally . “ What is this ? ”[86-sir walter] cried [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . “ [The Crofts]111-the crofts have arrived in [Bath]9-bath ? [The Crofts who rent [Kellynch]5-kellynch]3128-the crofts who rent kellynch ? What have [they]3128-the crofts who rent kellynch brought [you]89-anne ? ”[86-sir walter] “ A letter from [Uppercross Cottage]19-uppercross cottage , [Sir]592-sir . ”[111-the crofts] “ Oh ! those letters are convenient passports . They secure an introduction . [I]89-anne should have visited [Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft , however , at any rate . [I]89-anne know what is due to [[my]89-anne tenant]3130-my tenant . ”[89-anne] [Anne]89-anne could listen no longer ; [she]89-anne could not even have told how [the poor Admiral]1104-the poor admiral ’s complexion escaped ; [her]89-anne letter engrossed [her]89-anne . It had been begun several days back . “ February 1st . “[0-i] [[MY]0-i DEAR]351-my dear [ANNE]89-anne , [I]0-i make no apology for [my]0-i silence , because [I]0-i know how [little people]1106-little people think of letters in such a place as [Bath]9-bath . [You]89-anne must be a great deal too happy to care for [Uppercross]3-uppercross , which , as [you]89-anne well know , affords little to write about . [We]1107-we have had a very dull Christmas ; [Mr]1108-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove have not had one dinner party all the holidays . [I]0-i do not reckon [the Hayters]137-the hayters as [anybody]462-anybody . The holidays , however , are over at last : [I]0-i believe [no children]1110-no children ever had such long ones . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i had not . [The house]1780-the house was cleared yesterday , except of [the little Harvilles]152-the harvilles ; but [you]89-anne will be surprised to hear [they]152-the harvilles have never gone [home]1756-home . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville must be [an odd mother]1113-an odd mother to part with [them]152-the harvilles so long . [I]0-i do not understand it . [They]152-the harvilles are not at all [nice children]1114-nice children , in [my]0-i opinion ; but [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove seems to like [them]152-the harvilles quite as well , if not better , than [[her]134-mrs harville grandchildren]1115-her grandchildren . What dreadful weather [we]1116-we have had ! It may not be felt in [Bath]9-bath , with [[your]89-anne nice pavements]1117-your nice pavements ; but in [the country]1758-the country it is of some consequence . [I]0-i have not had a creature call on [me]0-i since the second week in January , except [Charles Hayter]91-charles , who had been calling much oftener than was welcome . Between [ourselves]1116-we , [I]0-i think it a great pity [Henrietta]117-henrietta did not remain at [Lyme]43-lyme as long as [Louisa]118-louisa ; it would have kept [her]117-henrietta a little out of [his]91-charles way . [The carriage]2151-the carriage is gone to - day , to bring [Louisa]118-louisa and [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles to - morrow . [We]1116-we are not asked to dine with [them]152-the harvilles , however , till the day after , [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove is so afraid of [her]117-henrietta being fatigued by the journey , which is not very likely , considering the care that will be taken of [her]117-henrietta ; and it would be much more convenient to [me]0-i to dine there to - morrow . [I]0-i am glad [you]1120-you find [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot so agreeable , and wish [I]0-i could be acquainted with [him]98-mr elliot too ; but [I]0-i have [my]0-i usual luck : [I]0-i am always out of the way when any thing desirable is going on ; always the last of [[my]0-i family]1121-my family to be noticed . What an immense time [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay has been staying with [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ! Does [she]101-mrs clay never mean to go away ? But perhaps if [she]101-mrs clay were to leave [the room]1874-the room vacant , [we]1123-we might not be invited . Let [me]0-i know what [you]1120-you think of this . [I]0-i do not expect [[my]0-i children]1124-my children to be asked , [you]1120-you know . [I]0-i can leave [them]1124-my children at [the Great House]2032-the great house very well , for a month or six weeks . [I]0-i have this moment heard that [the Crofts]111-the crofts are going to [Bath]9-bath almost immediately ; [they]111-the crofts think [the Admiral]186-the admiral gouty . [Charles]91-charles heard it quite by chance ; [they]111-the crofts have not had the civility to give [me]0-i any notice , or of offering to take anything . [I]0-i do not think [they]111-the crofts improve at all as [neighbours]1724-neighbours . [We]1127-we see nothing of [them]111-the crofts , and this is really an instance of gross inattention . [Charles]91-charles joins [me]0-i in love , and everything proper . [Yours]1120-you affectionately , “ [MARY M——.]187-mary “[1120-you] [I]0-i am sorry to say that [I]0-i am very far from well ; and [Jemima]120-jemima has just told [me]0-i that [the butcher]1128-the butcher says there is a bad sore - throat very much about . [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i shall catch it ; and [my]0-i sore - throats , [you]1120-you know , are always worse than [anybody]462-anybody ’s . ” So ended the first part , which had been afterwards put into an envelope , containing nearly as much more . “[0-i] [I]0-i kept [my]0-i letter open , that [I]0-i might send [you]1120-you word how [Louisa]118-louisa bore [her]118-louisa journey , and now [I]0-i am extremely glad [I]0-i did , having a great deal to add . In the first place , [I]0-i had a note from [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft yesterday , offering to convey anything to [you]1120-you ; a very kind , friendly note indeed , addressed to [me]0-i , just as it ought ; [I]0-i shall therefore be able to make [my]0-i letter as long as [I]0-i like . [The Admiral]1880-the admiral does not seem very ill , and [I]0-i sincerely hope [Bath]9-bath will do [him]1880-the admiral all the good [he]1880-the admiral wants . [I]0-i shall be truly glad to have [them]1131-them back again . [[Our]1132-we neighbourhood]1133-our neighbourhood can not spare such [a pleasant family]1134-a pleasant family . But now for [Louisa]118-louisa . [I]0-i have something to communicate that will astonish [you]1120-you not a little . [She]118-louisa and [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles came on Tuesday very safely , and in the evening [we]1132-we went to ask [her]118-louisa how [she]118-louisa did , when [we]1132-we were rather surprised not to find [Captain Benwick of the party]1135-captain benwick of the party , for [he]1135-captain benwick of the party had been invited as well as [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles ; and what do [you]1120-you think was the reason ? Neither more nor less than [his]1135-captain benwick of the party being in love with [Louisa]118-louisa , and not choosing to venture to [Uppercross]3-uppercross till [he]1135-captain benwick of the party had had an answer from [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove ; for it was all settled between [him]1135-captain benwick of the party and [her]118-louisa before [she]118-louisa came away , and [he]1135-captain benwick of the party had written to [[her]118-louisa father]1745-her father by [Captain Harville]151-captain harville . True , upon [my]0-i honour ! Are not [you]1120-you astonished ? [I]0-i shall be surprised at least if [you]1120-you ever received a hint of it , for [I]0-i never did . [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove protests solemnly that [she]118-louisa knew nothing of the matter . [We]1137-we are all very well pleased , however , for though it is not equal to [her]118-louisa marrying [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , it is infinitely better than [Charles Hayter]91-charles ; and [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove has written [his]114-mrs musgrove consent , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick is expected to - day . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville says [[her]134-mrs harville husband]347-her husband feels a good deal on [[his]347-her husband poor sister]1139-his poor sister ’s account ; but , however , [Louisa]118-louisa is a great favourite with both . Indeed , [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville and [I]0-i quite agree that [we]1137-we love [her]118-louisa the better for having nursed [her]118-louisa . [Charles]91-charles wonders what [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth will say ; but if [you]1140-you remember , [I]0-i never thought [him]112-captain wentworth attached to [Louisa]118-louisa ; [I]0-i never could see anything of it . And this is the end , [you]1140-you see , of [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ’s being supposed to be [an admirer of [yours]1140-you]1141-an admirer of yours . How [Charles]91-charles could take such a thing into [his]91-charles head was always incomprehensible to [me]0-i . [I]0-i hope [he]112-captain wentworth will be more agreeable now . Certainly not a great match for [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa , but a million times better than marrying among [the Hayters]137-the hayters . ” [Mary]187-mary need not have feared [[her]187-mary sister]1946-her sister ’s being in any degree prepared for the news . [She]187-mary had never in [her]187-mary life been more astonished . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick and [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa ! It was almost too wonderful for belief , and it was with the greatest effort that [she]187-mary could remain in [the room]1874-the room , preserve an air of calmness , and answer the common questions of the moment . Happily for [her]187-mary , [they]3133-they were not many . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter wanted to know whether [the Crofts]111-the crofts travelled with four horses , and whether [they]111-the crofts were likely to be situated in [such a part of [Bath]9-bath]3134-such a part of bath as it might suit [Miss Elliot]89-anne and [himself]86-sir walter to visit in ; but had little curiosity beyond . “[137-the hayters] How is [Mary]187-mary ? ” said [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ; and without waiting for an answer , “[187-mary] And pray what brings [the Crofts]111-the crofts to [Bath]9-bath ? ” “[111-the crofts] [They]111-the crofts come on [the Admiral]1880-the admiral ’s account . [He]1880-the admiral is thought to be gouty . ” “[1880-the admiral] Gout and decrepitude ! ” said [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . “[1143-poor old gentleman] [Poor old gentleman]1143-poor old gentleman . ” “[1143-poor old gentleman] Have [they]111-the crofts any acquaintance [here]376-here ? ” asked [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth . “[0-i] [I]0-i do not know ; but [I]0-i can hardly suppose that , at [Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft ’s time of life , and in [his]106-admiral croft profession , [he]106-admiral croft should not have many acquaintance in such a place as this . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i suspect , ” said [Sir Walter]86-sir walter coolly , “[0-i] that [Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft will be best known in [Bath]9-bath as [the renter of [Kellynch Hall]1-kellynch hall]1145-the renter of kellynch hall . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , may [we]1146-we venture to present [him]106-admiral croft and [[his]106-admiral croft wife]1699-his wife in [Laura Place]64-laura place ? ” “[87-elizabeth] Oh , no ! [I]0-i think not . Situated as [we]1146-we are with [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple , [cousins]2125-cousins , [we]1146-we ought to be very careful not to embarrass [her]179-lady dalrymple with acquaintance [she]179-lady dalrymple might not approve . If [we]1146-we were not related , it would not signify ; but as [cousins]2125-cousins , [she]179-lady dalrymple would feel scrupulous as to any proposal of [ours]1146-we . [We]1146-we had better leave [the Crofts]111-the crofts to find [their]111-the crofts own level . There are [several odd - looking men walking about here , who , [I]0-i am told , are [sailors]301-sailors]1150-several odd - looking men walking about here , who , i am told , are sailors . [The Crofts]111-the crofts will associate with [them]1150-several odd - looking men walking about here , who , i am told , are sailors . ” This was [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ’s share of interest in the letter ; when [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay had paid [her]101-mrs clay tribute of more decent attention , in an enquiry after [Mrs Charles Musgrove]92-charles , and [[her]101-mrs clay fine little boys]3135-her fine little boys , [Anne]89-anne was at liberty . In [[her]89-anne own room]3136-her own room , [she]89-anne tried to comprehend it . Well might [Charles]92-charles wonder how [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth would feel ! Perhaps [he]112-captain wentworth had quitted [the field]2414-the field , had given [Louisa]118-louisa up , had ceased to love , had found [he]112-captain wentworth did not love [her]118-louisa . [She]118-louisa could not endure the idea of treachery or levity , or anything akin to ill usage between [him]112-captain wentworth and [[his]112-captain wentworth friend]2516-his friend . [She]118-louisa could not endure that such a friendship as [theirs]3139-they should be severed unfairly . [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick and [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa ! [The high - spirited , joyous - talking Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa , and [the dejected , thinking , feeling , reading]3140-the dejected , thinking , feeling , reading , [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , seemed each of [them]3139-they everything that would not suit [the other]2101-the other . [Their]3139-they minds most dissimilar ! Where could have been the attraction ? The answer soon presented itself . It had been in situation . [They]3139-they had been thrown together several weeks ; [they]3139-they had been living in [the same small family party]3142-the same small family party : since [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s coming away , [they]3139-they must have been depending almost entirely on [each other]1959-each other , and [Louisa]118-louisa , just recovering from illness , had been in an interesting state , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick was not inconsolable . That was a point which [Anne]89-anne had not been able to avoid suspecting before ; and instead of drawing the same conclusion as [Mary]187-mary , from the present course of events , [they]3139-they served only to confirm the idea of [his]153-captain benwick having felt some dawning of tenderness toward [herself]89-anne . [She]89-anne did not mean , however , to derive much more from it to gratify [her]89-anne vanity , than [Mary]187-mary might have allowed . [She]89-anne was persuaded that [any tolerably pleasing young woman who had listened and seemed to feel]3144-any tolerably pleasing young woman who had listened and seemed to feel for [him]153-captain benwick would have received the same compliment . [He]153-captain benwick had an affectionate heart . [He]153-captain benwick must love [somebody]2685-somebody . [She]89-anne saw no reason against [their]3139-they being happy . [Louisa]118-louisa had fine naval fervour to begin with , and [they]3139-they would soon grow more alike . [He]153-captain benwick would gain cheerfulness , and [she]118-louisa would learn to be an enthusiast for [Scott]162-mr scott and [Lord Byron]163-lord byron ; nay , that was probably learnt already ; of course [they]3139-they had fallen in love over poetry . The idea of [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa turned into [a person of literary taste]3146-a person of literary taste , and sentimental reflection was amusing , but [she]118-louisa had no doubt of its being so . The day at [Lyme]43-lyme , the fall from [the Cobb]44-the cobb , might influence [her]118-louisa health , [her]118-louisa nerves , [her]118-louisa courage , [her]118-louisa character to the end of [her]118-louisa life , as thoroughly as it appeared to have influenced [her]118-louisa fate . The conclusion of the whole was , that if [the woman who had been sensible of]3147-the woman who had been sensible of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s merits could be allowed to prefer [another man]3148-another man , there was nothing in the engagement to excite lasting wonder ; and if [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth lost [no friend]3149-no friend by it , certainly nothing to be regretted . No , it was not regret which made [Anne]89-anne ’s heart beat in spite of [herself]89-anne , and brought the colour into [her]89-anne cheeks when [she]89-anne thought of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth unshackled and free . [She]89-anne had some feelings which [she]89-anne was ashamed to investigate . They were too much like joy , senseless joy ! [She]89-anne longed to see [the Crofts]111-the crofts ; but when the meeting took place , it was evident that no rumour of the news had yet reached [them]111-the crofts . The visit of ceremony was paid and returned ; and [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa was mentioned , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , too , without even half a smile . [The Crofts]111-the crofts had placed [themselves]111-the crofts in [lodgings in [Gay Street]69-gay street]3150-lodgings in gay street , perfectly to [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ’s satisfaction . [He]86-sir walter was not at all ashamed of the acquaintance , and did , in fact , think and talk a great deal more about [the Admiral]1880-the admiral , than [the Admiral]1880-the admiral ever thought or talked about [him]1880-the admiral . [The Crofts]111-the crofts knew quite as many people in [Bath]9-bath as [they]111-the crofts wished for , and considered [their]111-the crofts intercourse with [the Elliots]178-the elliots as a mere matter of form , and not in the least likely to afford [them]111-the crofts any pleasure . [They]111-the crofts brought with [them]111-the crofts [their]111-the crofts country habit of being almost always together . [He]1880-the admiral was ordered to walk to keep off the gout , and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft seemed to go shares with [him]1880-the admiral in everything , and to walk for [her]107-mrs croft life to do [him]1880-the admiral good . [Anne]89-anne saw [them]111-the crofts wherever [she]89-anne went . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell took [her]89-anne out in [[her]97-lady russell carriage]3153-her carriage almost every morning , and [she]89-anne never failed to think of [them]111-the crofts , and never failed to see [them]111-the crofts . Knowing [their]111-the crofts feelings as [she]89-anne did , it was a most attractive picture of happiness to [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne always watched [them]111-the crofts as long as [she]89-anne could , delighted to fancy [she]89-anne understood what [they]111-the crofts might be talking of , as [they]111-the crofts walked along in happy independence , or equally delighted to see [the Admiral]1880-the admiral ’s hearty shake of the hand when [he]1880-the admiral encountered [an old friend]2145-an old friend , and observe [their]111-the crofts eagerness of conversation when occasionally forming into a little knot of [the navy]297-the navy , [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft looking as intelligent and keen as any of [the officers around [her]89-anne]3157-the officers around her . [Anne]89-anne was too much engaged with [Lady Russell]97-lady russell to be often walking [herself]89-anne ; but it so happened that one morning , about a week or ten days after [the Croft]107-mrs croft ’s arrival , it suited [her]89-anne best to leave [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend , or [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend ’s carriage , in [the lower part of [the town]2536-the town]3160-the lower part of the town , and return alone to [Camden Place]53-camden place , and in walking up [Milsom Street]71-milsom street [she]89-anne had the good fortune to meet with [the Admiral]1880-the admiral . [He]1880-the admiral was standing by [himself]1880-the admiral at a printshop window , with [his]1880-the admiral hands behind [him]1880-the admiral , in earnest contemplation of some print , and [she]1152-you not only might have passed [him]1880-the admiral unseen , but was obliged to touch as well as address [him]1880-the admiral before [she]1152-you could catch [his]1880-the admiral notice . When [he]1880-the admiral did perceive and acknowledge [her]1152-you , however , it was done with all [his]1880-the admiral usual frankness and good humour . “[111-the crofts] Ha ! is it [you]1152-you ? Thank [you]1152-you , thank [you]1152-you . This is treating [me]0-i like [a friend]2797-a friend . Here [I]0-i am , [you]1152-you see , staring at a picture . [I]0-i can never get by [this shop]1154-this shop without stopping . But what a thing [here]376-here is , by way of [a boat]1156-a boat ! Do look at it . Did [you]1152-you ever see the like ? What [queer fellows [your]1152-you fine painters]1157-queer fellows your fine painters must be , to think that [anybody]462-anybody would venture [their]1157-queer fellows your fine painters lives in such a shapeless old cockleshell as that ? And yet here are [two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at [their]1159-two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease ease]1159-two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease , and looking about [them]1159-two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease at [the rocks]1160-the rocks and [mountains]1161-mountains , as if [they]1159-two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease were not to be upset the next moment , which [they]1159-two gentlemen stuck up in it mightily at their ease certainly must be . [I]0-i wonder where [that boat]1162-that boat was built ! ” ( laughing heartily ) ; “[0-i] [I]0-i would not venture over a horsepond in [it]1162-that boat . Well , ” ( turning away ) , “[0-i] now , where are [you]1152-you bound ? Can [I]0-i go anywhere for [you]1152-you , or with [you]1152-you ? Can [I]0-i be of any use ? ” “[0-i] None , [I]0-i thank [you]1152-you , unless [you]1152-you will give [me]0-i the pleasure of [your]1152-you company the little way [[our]1163-we road]1164-our road lies together . [I]0-i am going [home]1756-home . ” “[0-i] That [I]0-i will , with all [my]0-i heart , and farther , too . Yes , yes [we]1163-we will have a snug walk together , and [I]0-i have something to tell [you]1152-you as [we]1163-we go along . There , take [my]0-i arm ; that ’s right ; [I]0-i do not feel comfortable if [I]0-i have not [a woman]1730-a woman [there]1845-there . [Lord]1168-lord ! what a boat it is ! ” taking a last look at the picture , as [they]1163-we began to be in motion . “[1168-lord] Did [you]1152-you say that [you]1152-you had something to tell [me]0-i , [sir]592-sir ? ” “[1152-you] Yes , [I]0-i have , presently . But here comes [a friend]2797-a friend , [Captain Brigden]188-captain brigden ; [I]0-i shall only say , ‘ How [d’ye]1171-d’ye do ? ’ as [we]1163-we pass , however . [I]0-i shall not stop . ‘ How [d’ye]1171-d’ye do ? ’ [Brigden]188-captain brigden stares to see anybody with [me]0-i but [[my]0-i wife]901-my wife . [She]901-my wife , [poor soul]1173-poor soul , is tied by the leg . [She]901-my wife has a blister on one of [her]901-my wife heels , as large as a three - shilling piece . If [you]1174-you look across [the street]2708-the street , [you]1174-you will see [Admiral Brand]189-admiral brand coming down and [[his]2797-a friend brother]2921-his brother . [Shabby fellows]1177-shabby fellows , [both of [them]1177-shabby fellows]1178-both of them ! [I]0-i am glad [they]1177-shabby fellows are not on this side of the way . [Sophy]129-sophy can not bear [them]1177-shabby fellows .
