[They]1177-shabby fellows played [me]0-i a pitiful trick once : got away with [some of [[my]0-i best men]1180-my best men]1179-some of my best men . [I]0-i will tell [you]1174-you the whole story another time . There comes [old Sir Archibald Drew]190-old sir archibald drew and [[his]190-old sir archibald drew grandson]1181-his grandson . Look , [he]190-old sir archibald drew sees [us]1182-we ; [he]190-old sir archibald drew kisses [his]190-old sir archibald drew hand to [you]1174-you ; [he]190-old sir archibald drew takes [you]1174-you for [[my]0-i wife]901-my wife . Ah ! the peace has come too soon for that [younker]1174-you . [Poor old Sir Archibald]190-old sir archibald drew ! How do [you]1174-you like [Bath]9-bath , [Miss Elliot]89-anne ? It suits [us]1182-we very well . [We]1182-we are always meeting with [some old friend]1184-some old friend or other ; [the streets]2932-the streets full of [them]1184-some old friend every morning ; sure to have plenty of chat ; and then [we]1182-we get away from [them]1184-some old friend all , and shut [ourselves]1182-we in [[our]1182-we lodgings]1186-our lodgings , and draw in [our]1182-we chairs , and are as snug as if [we]1182-we were at [Kellynch]5-kellynch , ay , or as [we]1182-we used to be even at [North Yarmouth]42-north yarmouth and [Deal]37-deal . [We]1182-we do not like [[our]1182-we lodgings]1186-our lodgings here the worse , [I]0-i can tell [you]1188-you , for putting [us]1182-we in mind of those [we]1182-we first had at [North Yarmouth]42-north yarmouth . The wind blows through one of the cupboards just in the same way . ” When [they]1182-we were got a little farther , [Anne]89-anne ventured to press again for what [he]0-i had to communicate . [She]89-anne hoped when clear of [Milsom Street]71-milsom street to have [her]89-anne curiosity gratified ; but [she]89-anne was still obliged to wait , for [the Admiral]1880-the admiral had made up [his]1880-the admiral mind not to begin till [they]1182-we had gained the greater space and quiet of [Belmont]72-belmont ; and as [she]89-anne was not really [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , [she]89-anne must let [him]0-i have [his]0-i own way . As soon as [they]1182-we were fairly ascending [Belmont]72-belmont , [he]0-i began — “[1189-you] Well , now [you]1189-you shall hear something that will surprise [you]1189-you . But first of all , [you]1189-you must tell [me]0-i the name of [the young lady]1190-the young lady [I]0-i am going to talk about . [That young lady]1191-that young lady , [you]1189-you know , that [we]1192-we have all been so concerned for . [The Miss Musgrove]118-louisa , that all this has been happening to . [Her]118-louisa Christian name : [I]0-i always forget [her]118-louisa Christian name . ” [Anne]89-anne had been ashamed to appear to comprehend so soon as [she]89-anne really did ; but now [she]89-anne could safely suggest the name of “[118-louisa] [Louisa]118-louisa . ” “[118-louisa] Ay , ay , [Miss Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa , that is the name . [I]0-i wish [young ladies]1193-young ladies had not such a number of fine Christian names . [I]0-i should never be out if [they]1193-young ladies were [all Sophys]1194-all sophys , or something of that sort . Well , this [Miss Louisa]118-louisa , [we]1192-we all thought , [you]1189-you know , was to marry [Frederick]112-captain wentworth . [He]112-captain wentworth was courting [her]118-louisa week after week . The only wonder was , what [they]1193-young ladies could be waiting for , till the business at [Lyme]43-lyme came ; then , indeed , it was clear enough that [they]1193-young ladies must wait till [her]118-louisa brain was set to right . But even then there was something odd in [their]1193-young ladies way of going on . Instead of staying at [Lyme]43-lyme , [he]112-captain wentworth went off to [Plymouth]27-plymouth , and then [he]112-captain wentworth went off to see [Edward]123-edward . When [we]1192-we came back from [Minehead]73-minehead [he]112-captain wentworth was gone down to [[Edward]123-edward ’s]1195-edward ’s , and there [he]112-captain wentworth has been ever since . [We]1192-we have seen nothing of [him]112-captain wentworth since [November]192-november . Even [Sophy]129-sophy could not understand it . But now , the matter has taken the strangest turn of all ; for [this young lady]1196-this young lady , the same [Miss Musgrove]118-louisa , instead of being to marry [Frederick]112-captain wentworth , is to marry [James Benwick]193-james benwick . [You]1197-you know [James Benwick]193-james benwick . ” “[193-james benwick] A little . [I]0-i am a little acquainted with [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . ” “[153-captain benwick] Well , [she]1196-this young lady is to marry [him]153-captain benwick . Nay , most likely [they]1198-they are married already , for [I]0-i do not know what [they]1198-they should wait for . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick [a very pleasing young man]1199-a very pleasing young man , ” said [Anne]89-anne , “[1199-a very pleasing young man] and [I]0-i understand that [he]153-captain benwick bears an excellent character . ” “[1199-a very pleasing young man] Oh ! yes , yes , there is not a word to be said against [James Benwick]193-james benwick . [He]153-captain benwick is only [a commander]1200-a commander , it is true , made last summer , and these are bad times for getting on , but [he]153-captain benwick has not another fault that [I]0-i know of . [An excellent , good - hearted fellow]1201-an excellent , good - hearted fellow , [I]0-i assure [you]1202-you ; [a very active , zealous officer]1203-a very active , zealous officer too , which is more than [you]1202-you would think for , perhaps , for that soft sort of manner does not do [him]153-captain benwick justice . ” “[1202-you] Indeed [you]1202-you are mistaken there , [sir]592-sir ; [I]0-i should never augur want of spirit from [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ’s manners . [I]0-i thought [them]1205-them particularly pleasing , and [I]0-i will answer for it , [they]1205-them would generally please . ” “[1207-the best judges] Well , well , [ladies]1206-ladies are [the best judges]1207-the best judges ; but [James Benwick]193-james benwick is rather too piano for [me]0-i ; and though very likely it is all [our]1208-our partiality , [Sophy]129-sophy and [I]0-i can not help thinking [Frederick]112-captain wentworth ’s manners better than [his]153-captain benwick . There is something about [Frederick]112-captain wentworth more to [our]1208-our taste . ” [Anne]89-anne was caught . [She]89-anne had only meant to oppose the too common idea of spirit and gentleness being incompatible with each other , not at all to represent [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick ’s manners as the very best that could possibly be ; and , after a little hesitation , [she]89-anne was beginning to say , “[0-i] [I]0-i was not entering into any comparison of [the two friends]1209-the two friends , ” but [the Admiral]1880-the admiral interrupted [her]89-anne with — “[0-i] And the thing is certainly true . It is not a mere bit of gossip . [We]1208-our have it from [Frederick]112-captain wentworth [himself]112-captain wentworth . [[His]112-captain wentworth sister]2264-his sister had a letter from [him]112-captain wentworth yesterday , in which [he]112-captain wentworth tells [us]1208-our of it , and [he]112-captain wentworth had just had it in a letter from [Harville]134-mrs harville , written upon the spot , from [Uppercross]3-uppercross . [I]0-i fancy [they]1211-they are all at [Uppercross]3-uppercross . ” This was an opportunity which [Anne]89-anne could not resist ; [she]89-anne said , therefore , “[0-i] [I]0-i hope , [Admiral]1981-admiral , [I]0-i hope there is nothing in the style of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s letter to make [you]1981-admiral and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft particularly uneasy . It did seem , last autumn , as if there were an attachment between [him]112-captain wentworth and [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa ; but [I]0-i hope it may be understood to have worn out on each side equally , and without violence . [I]0-i hope [his]112-captain wentworth letter does not breathe the spirit of [an ill - used man]1213-an ill - used man . ” “[1213-an ill - used man] Not at all , not at all ; there is not an oath or a murmur from beginning to end . ” [Anne]89-anne looked down to hide [her]89-anne smile . “[1213-an ill - used man] No , no ; [Frederick]112-captain wentworth is not [a man to whine and complain]1214-a man to whine and complain ; [he]112-captain wentworth has too much spirit for that . If [the girl]1215-the girl likes [another man]3148-another man better , it is very fit [she]1215-the girl should have [him]112-captain wentworth . ” “[1215-the girl] Certainly . But what [I]0-i mean is , that [I]0-i hope there is nothing in [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s manner of writing to make [you]1217-you suppose [he]112-captain wentworth thinks [himself]112-captain wentworth ill - used by [[his]112-captain wentworth friend]2516-his friend , which might appear , [you]1217-you know , without its being absolutely said . [I]0-i should be very sorry that such a friendship as has subsisted between [him]112-captain wentworth and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick should be destroyed , or even wounded , by a circumstance of this sort . ” “[112-captain wentworth] Yes , yes , [I]0-i understand [you]1217-you . But there is nothing at all of that nature in the letter . [He]112-captain wentworth does not give the least fling at [Benwick]153-captain benwick ; does not so much as say , ‘ [I]0-i wonder at it , [I]0-i have a reason of [my]0-i own for wondering at it . ’ No , [you]1217-you would not guess , from [his]112-captain wentworth way of writing , that [he]112-captain wentworth had ever thought of [this Miss]1219-this miss ( what ’s [her]1219-this miss name ? ) for [himself]112-captain wentworth . [He]112-captain wentworth very handsomely hopes [they]1220-they will be happy together ; and there is nothing very unforgiving in that , [I]0-i think . ” [Anne]89-anne did not receive the perfect conviction which [the Admiral]1880-the admiral meant to convey , but it would have been useless to press the enquiry farther . [She]89-anne therefore satisfied [herself]89-anne with common - place remarks or quiet attention , and [the Admiral]1880-the admiral had it all [his]1880-the admiral own way . “[0-i] [Poor Frederick]194-poor frederick ! ” said [he]0-i at last . “[194-poor frederick] Now [he]194-poor frederick must begin all over again with [somebody else]1221-somebody else . [I]0-i think [we]1222-them must get [him]194-poor frederick to [Bath]9-bath . [Sophy]129-sophy must write , and beg [him]194-poor frederick to come to [Bath]9-bath . Here are [pretty girls]1223-pretty girls enough , [I]0-i am sure . It would be of no use to go to [Uppercross]3-uppercross again , for that other [Miss Musgrove]118-louisa , [I]0-i find , is bespoke by [[her]118-louisa cousin]620-her cousin , [the young parson]1225-the young parson . Do not [you]1226-you think , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , [we]1222-them had better try to get [him]194-poor frederick to [Bath]9-bath ? ” CHAPTER XIX . While [Admiral Croft]106-admiral croft was taking this walk with [Anne]89-anne , and expressing [his]106-admiral croft wish of getting [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth to [Bath]9-bath , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was already on [his]112-captain wentworth way thither . Before [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft had written , [he]112-captain wentworth was arrived , and the very next time [Anne]89-anne walked out , [she]89-anne saw [him]112-captain wentworth . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was attending [[his]98-mr elliot two cousins]3167-his two cousins and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . [They]1222-them were in [Milsom Street]71-milsom street . It began to rain , not much , but enough to make shelter desirable for [women]542-women , and quite enough to make it very desirable for [Miss Elliot]89-anne to have the advantage of being conveyed [home]1756-home in [[Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple ’s carriage , which was seen waiting at a little distance]3170-lady dalrymple ’s carriage , which was seen waiting at a little distance ; [she]179-lady dalrymple , [Anne]89-anne , and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , therefore , turned into [Molland]195-molland ’s , while [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot stepped to [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple , to request [her]179-lady dalrymple assistance . [He]98-mr elliot soon joined [them]1222-them again , successful , of course ; [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple would be most happy to take [them]1222-them [home]1756-home , and would call for [them]1222-them in a few minutes . [[Her]179-lady dalrymple ladyship]1072-her ladyship ’s carriage was a barouche , and did not hold more than four with any comfort . [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret was with [[her]176-miss carteret mother]1735-her mother ; consequently it was not reasonable to expect accommodation for [all the three Camden Place ladies]3174-all the three camden place ladies . There could be no doubt as to [Miss Elliot]89-anne . Whoever suffered inconvenience , [she]89-anne must suffer none , but it occupied a little time to settle the point of civility between [the other two]2477-the other two . The rain was a mere trifle , and [Anne]89-anne was most sincere in preferring a walk with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . But the rain was also a mere trifle to [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ; [she]101-mrs clay would hardly allow it even to drop at all , and [her]101-mrs clay boots were so thick ! much thicker than [Miss Anne]89-anne ’s ; and , in short , [her]101-mrs clay civility rendered [her]101-mrs clay quite as anxious to be left to walk with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot as [Anne]89-anne could be , and it was discussed between [them]2477-the other two with a generosity so polite and so determined , that [the others]1828-the others were obliged to settle it for [them]2477-the other two ; [Miss Elliot]89-anne maintaining that [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay had a little cold already , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot deciding on appeal , that [[his]98-mr elliot cousin]2369-his cousin [Anne]89-anne ’s boots were rather the thickest . It was fixed accordingly , that [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay should be of [the party in [the carriage]2151-the carriage]3178-the party in the carriage ; and [they]2477-the other two had just reached this point , when [Anne]89-anne , as [she]89-anne sat near the window , descried , most decidedly and distinctly , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth walking down [the street]2708-the street . [Her]89-anne start was perceptible only to [herself]89-anne ; but [she]89-anne instantly felt that [she]89-anne was [the greatest simpleton in [the world]1711-the world]3181-the greatest simpleton in the world , the most unaccountable and absurd ! For a few minutes [she]89-anne saw nothing before [her]89-anne ; it was all confusion . [She]89-anne was lost , and when [she]89-anne had scolded back [her]89-anne senses , [she]89-anne found [the others]1828-the others still waiting for [the carriage]2151-the carriage , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ( always obliging ) just setting off for [Union Street]75-union street on a commission of [[Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ’s]3185-mrs clay ’s . [She]89-anne now felt a great inclination to go to the outer door ; [she]89-anne wanted to see if it rained . Why was [she]89-anne to suspect [herself]89-anne of another motive ? [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth must be out of sight . [She]89-anne left [her]89-anne seat , [she]89-anne would go ; one half of [her]89-anne should not be always so much wiser than the other half , or always suspecting the other of being worse than it was . [She]89-anne would see if it rained . [She]89-anne was sent back , however , in a moment by the entrance of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth [himself]112-captain wentworth , among [a party of [gentlemen]3187-gentlemen and [ladies]1206-ladies]3186-a party of gentlemen and ladies , evidently [his]112-captain wentworth acquaintance , and whom [he]112-captain wentworth must have joined a little below [Milsom Street]71-milsom street . [He]112-captain wentworth was more obviously struck and confused by the sight of [her]89-anne than [she]89-anne had ever observed before ; [he]112-captain wentworth looked quite red . For the first time , since [their]3189-they renewed acquaintance , [she]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne was betraying the least sensibility of [the two]2980-the two . [She]89-anne had the advantage of [him]112-captain wentworth in the preparation of the last few moments . All the overpowering , blinding , bewildering , first effects of strong surprise were over with [her]89-anne . Still , however , [she]89-anne had enough to feel ! It was agitation , pain , pleasure , a something between delight and misery . [He]112-captain wentworth spoke to [her]89-anne , and then turned away . The character of [his]112-captain wentworth manner was embarrassment . [She]89-anne could not have called it either cold or friendly , or anything so certainly as embarrassed . After a short interval , however , [he]112-captain wentworth came towards [her]89-anne , and spoke again . Mutual enquiries on [common subjects]3191-common subjects passed : neither of [them]3189-they , probably , much the wiser for what [they]3189-they heard , and [Anne]89-anne continuing fully sensible of [his]112-captain wentworth being less at ease than formerly . [They]3189-they had by dint of being so very much together , got to speak to [each other]1959-each other with a considerable portion of apparent indifference and calmness ; but [he]112-captain wentworth could not do it now . Time had changed [him]112-captain wentworth , or [Louisa]118-louisa had changed [him]112-captain wentworth . There was consciousness of some sort or other . [He]112-captain wentworth looked very well , not as if [he]112-captain wentworth had been suffering in health or spirits , and [he]112-captain wentworth talked of [Uppercross]139-uppercross , of [the Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves , nay , even of [Louisa]118-louisa , and had even a momentary look of [his]112-captain wentworth own arch significance as [he]112-captain wentworth named [her]118-louisa ; but yet it was [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth not comfortable , not easy , not able to feign that [he]112-captain wentworth was . It did not surprise , but it grieved [Anne]89-anne to observe that [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth would not know [him]112-captain wentworth . [She]89-anne saw that [he]112-captain wentworth saw [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , that [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth saw [him]112-captain wentworth , that there was complete internal recognition on each side ; [she]89-anne was convinced that [he]112-captain wentworth was ready to be acknowledged as [an acquaintance]2998-an acquaintance , expecting it , and [she]89-anne had the pain of seeing [[her]89-anne sister]1946-her sister turn away with unalterable coldness . [[Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple ’s carriage]3195-lady dalrymple ’s carriage , for which [Miss Elliot]89-anne was growing very impatient , now drew up ; [the servant]818-the servant came in to announce it . It was beginning to rain again , and altogether there was a delay , and a bustle , and a talking , which must make [all the little crowd]3197-all the little crowd in [the shop]3198-the shop understand that [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple was calling to convey [Miss Elliot]89-anne . At last [Miss Elliot]89-anne and [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend , unattended but by [the servant]818-the servant , ( for there was [no cousin returned )]3201-no cousin returned ) , were walking off ; and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , watching [them]1228-them , turned again to [Anne]89-anne , and by manner , rather than words , was offering [his]112-captain wentworth services to [her]89-anne . “[89-anne] [I]0-i am much obliged to [you]1227-you , ” was [her]89-anne answer , “[1227-you] but [I]0-i am not going with [them]1228-them . [The carriage]2151-the carriage would not accommodate so many . [I]0-i walk : [I]0-i prefer walking . ” “[0-i] But it rains . ” “[0-i] Oh ! very little . Nothing that [I]0-i regard . ” After a moment ’s pause [he]0-i said : “[0-i] Though [I]0-i came only yesterday , [I]0-i have equipped [myself]0-i properly for Bath already , [you]1230-her see , ” ( pointing to a new umbrella ) ; “[1230-her] [I]0-i wish [you]1230-her would make use of it , if [you]1230-her are determined to walk ; though [I]0-i think it would be more prudent to let [me]0-i get [you]1230-her a chair . ” [She]1230-her was very much obliged to [him]0-i , but declined it all , repeating [her]1230-her conviction , that the rain would come to nothing at present , and adding , “[0-i] [I]0-i am only waiting for [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot will be here in a moment , [I]0-i am sure . ” [She]1230-her had hardly spoken the words when [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot walked in . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth recollected [him]98-mr elliot perfectly . There was no difference between [him]98-mr elliot and [the man who had stood on the steps at [Lyme]43-lyme]3202-the man who had stood on the steps at lyme , admiring [Anne]89-anne as [she]89-anne passed , except in the air and look and manner of [the privileged relation]3203-the privileged relation and [friend]1742-friend . [He]98-mr elliot came in with eagerness , appeared to see and think only of [her]1230-her , apologised for [his]98-mr elliot stay , was grieved to have kept [her]1230-her waiting , and anxious to get [her]1230-her away without further loss of time and before the rain increased ; and in another moment [they]3205-they walked off together , [her]1230-her arm under [his]98-mr elliot , a gentle and embarrassed glance , and a “[98-mr elliot] Good morning to [you]1231-you ! ” being all that [she]1230-her had time for , as [she]1230-her passed away . As soon as [they]3205-they were out of sight , [the ladies of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s party]3206-the ladies of captain wentworth ’s party began talking of [them]3205-they . “[98-mr elliot] [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot does not dislike [[his]98-mr elliot cousin]2369-his cousin , [I]0-i fancy ? ” “[0-i] Oh ! no , that is clear enough . [One]1726-one can guess what will happen there . [He]98-mr elliot is always with [them]1234-them ; half lives in [the family]1782-the family , [I]0-i believe . What [a very good - looking man]1236-a very good - looking man ! ” “[1236-a very good - looking man] Yes , and [Miss Atkinson]196-miss atkinson , who dined with [him]98-mr elliot once at [the Wallises]76-the wallises , says [he]98-mr elliot is [the most agreeable man [she]196-miss atkinson ever was in company with]1237-the most agreeable man she ever was in company with . ” “[98-mr elliot] [She]2369-his cousin is pretty , [I]0-i think ; [Anne Elliot]89-anne ; very pretty , when one comes to look at [her]2369-his cousin . It is not the fashion to say so , but [I]0-i confess [I]0-i admire [her]2369-his cousin more than [[her]2369-his cousin sister]1946-her sister . ” “[0-i] Oh ! so do [I.]0-i ” “[0-i] And so do [I.]0-i No comparison . But [the men]959-the men are all wild after [Miss Elliot]89-anne . [Anne]89-anne is too delicate for [them]959-the men . ” [Anne]89-anne would have been particularly obliged to [[her]89-anne cousin]620-her cousin , if [he]620-her cousin would have walked by [her]89-anne side all the way to [Camden Place]53-camden place , without saying a word . [She]89-anne had never found it so difficult to listen to [him]620-her cousin , though nothing could exceed [his]620-her cousin solicitude and care , and though [[his]620-her cousin subjects]3208-his subjects were principally such as were wo nt to be always interesting : praise , warm , just , and discriminating , of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , and insinuations highly rational against [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . But just now [she]89-anne could think only of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . [She]89-anne could not understand [his]112-captain wentworth present feelings , whether [he]112-captain wentworth were really suffering much from disappointment or not ; and till that point were settled , [she]89-anne could not be quite [herself]89-anne . [She]89-anne hoped to be wise and reasonable in time ; but alas ! alas ! [she]89-anne must confess to [herself]89-anne that [she]89-anne was not wise yet . Another circumstance very essential for [her]89-anne to know , was how long [he]112-captain wentworth meant to be in [Bath]9-bath ; [he]112-captain wentworth had not mentioned it , or [she]89-anne could not recollect it . [He]112-captain wentworth might be only passing through . But it was more probable that [he]112-captain wentworth should be come to stay . In that case , so liable as every body was to meet every body in [Bath]9-bath , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would in all likelihood see [him]112-captain wentworth somewhere . Would [she]89-anne recollect [him]112-captain wentworth ? How would it all be ? [She]89-anne had already been obliged to tell [Lady Russell]97-lady russell that [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa was to marry [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . It had cost [her]89-anne something to encounter [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s surprise ; and now , if [she]89-anne were by any chance to be thrown into company with [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , [her]89-anne imperfect knowledge of the matter might add another shade of prejudice against [him]112-captain wentworth . The following morning [Anne]89-anne was out with [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend , and for the first hour , in an incessant and fearful sort of watch for [him]112-captain wentworth in vain ; but at last , in returning down [Pulteney Street]77-pulteney street , [she]89-anne distinguished [him]112-captain wentworth on the right hand pavement at such a distance as to have [him]112-captain wentworth in view the greater part of [the street]2708-the street . There were [many other men about [him]112-captain wentworth]3211-many other men about him , [many groups walking the same way]3212-many groups walking the same way , but there was no mistaking [him]112-captain wentworth . [She]89-anne looked instinctively at [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ; but not from any mad idea of [her]89-anne recognising [him]112-captain wentworth so soon as [she]89-anne did [herself]89-anne . No , it was not to be supposed that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would perceive [him]112-captain wentworth till [they]3213-they were nearly opposite . [She]89-anne looked at [her]89-anne however , from time to time , anxiously ; and when the moment approached which must point [him]112-captain wentworth out , though not daring to look again ( for [her]89-anne own countenance [she]89-anne knew was unfit to be seen ) , [she]89-anne was yet perfectly conscious of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s eyes being turned exactly in the direction for [him]112-captain wentworth — of [her]89-anne being , in short , intently observing [him]112-captain wentworth . [She]89-anne could thoroughly comprehend the sort of fascination [he]112-captain wentworth must possess over [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s mind , the difficulty it must be for [her]89-anne to withdraw [her]89-anne eyes , the astonishment [she]89-anne must be feeling that eight or nine years should have passed over [him]112-captain wentworth , and in foreign climes and in active service too , without robbing [him]112-captain wentworth of one personal grace ! At last , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell drew back [her]97-lady russell head . “[89-anne] Now , how would [she]1240-she speak of [him]1241-him ? ” “[1240-she] [You]1242-you will wonder , ” said [she]97-lady russell , “[1240-she] what has been fixing [my]0-i eye so long ; but [I]0-i was looking after some window - curtains , which [Lady Alicia]197-lady alicia and [Mrs Frankland]198-mrs frankland were telling [me]0-i of last night . [They]1243-they described the drawing - room window - curtains of [one of [the houses]915-the houses on this side of the way]1244-one of the houses on this side of the way , and [this part of [the street]2708-the street]1246-this part of the street , as being the handsomest and best hung of any in [Bath]9-bath , but could not recollect the exact number , and [I]0-i have been trying to find out which it could be ; but [I]0-i confess [I]0-i can see no curtains hereabouts that answer [their]1243-they description . ” [Anne]89-anne sighed and blushed and smiled , in pity and disdain , either at [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend or [herself]89-anne . The part which provoked [her]89-anne most , was that in all this waste of foresight and caution , [she]89-anne should have lost the right moment for seeing whether [he]2014-her friend saw [them]1243-they . A day or two passed without producing anything . [The theatre]3215-the theatre or [the rooms]2541-the rooms , where [he]2014-her friend was most likely to be , were not fashionable enough for [the Elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties]3217-the elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties , in which [they]3217-the elliots , whose evening amusements were solely in the elegant stupidity of private parties were getting more and more engaged ; and [Anne]89-anne , wearied of such a state of stagnation , sick of knowing nothing , and fancying [herself]89-anne stronger because [her]89-anne strength was not tried , was quite impatient for the concert evening . It was a concert for the benefit of [a person patronised by [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple]3218-a person patronised by lady dalrymple . Of course [they]1243-they must attend . It was really expected to be a good one , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was very fond of music . If [she]89-anne could only have a few minutes conversation with [him]2014-her friend again , [she]89-anne fancied [she]89-anne should be satisfied ; and as to the power of addressing [him]2014-her friend , [she]89-anne felt all over courage if the opportunity occurred . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth had turned from [him]2014-her friend , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell overlooked [him]2014-her friend ; [her]97-lady russell nerves were strengthened by these circumstances ; [she]97-lady russell felt that [she]97-lady russell owed [him]2014-her friend attention . [She]97-lady russell had once partly promised [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith to spend the evening with [her]97-lady russell ; but in a short hurried call [she]97-lady russell excused [herself]97-lady russell and put it off , with the more decided promise of a longer visit on the morrow . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith gave a most good - humoured acquiescence . “[0-i] By all means , ” said [she]181-mrs smith ; “[0-i] only tell [me]0-i all about it , when [you]1248-you do come . Who is [[your]1248-you party]1249-your party ? ” [Anne]89-anne named [them]1249-your party all . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith made no reply ; but when [she]181-mrs smith was leaving [her]181-mrs smith said , and with an expression half serious , half arch , “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i heartily wish [your]1248-you concert may answer ; and do not fail [me]0-i to - morrow if [you]1248-you can come ; for [I]0-i begin to have a foreboding that [I]0-i may not have many more visits from [you]1248-you . ” [Anne]89-anne was startled and confused ; but after standing in a moment ’s suspense , was obliged , and not sorry to be obliged , to hurry away . [CHAPTER XX]199-chapter xx . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter , [[his]86-sir walter two daughters]3219-his two daughters , and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , were the earliest of all [their]1249-your party party at [the rooms]2541-the rooms in the evening ; and as [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple must be waited for , [they]1249-your party took [their]1249-your party station by one of the fires in [the Octagon Room]3221-the octagon room . But hardly were [they]1249-your party so settled , when the door opened again , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth walked in alone . [Anne]89-anne was the nearest to [him]112-captain wentworth , and making yet a little advance , [she]89-anne instantly spoke . [He]112-captain wentworth was preparing only to bow and pass on , but [her]89-anne gentle “[1248-you] How do [you]1248-you do ? ” brought [him]112-captain wentworth out of the straight line to stand near [her]89-anne , and make enquiries in return , in spite of [the formidable father]3222-the formidable father and [sister in the back ground]3223-sister in the back ground . [Their]1249-your party being in [the back ground]3224-the back ground was a support to [Anne]89-anne ; [she]89-anne knew nothing of [their]1249-your party looks , and felt equal to everything which [she]89-anne believed right to be done . While [they]1249-your party were speaking , a whispering between [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth caught [her]89-anne ear . [She]89-anne could not distinguish , but [she]89-anne must guess the subject ; and on [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s making a distant bow , [she]89-anne comprehended that [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father had judged so well as to give [him]112-captain wentworth that simple acknowledgement of acquaintance , and [she]89-anne was just in time by a side glance to see a slight curtsey from [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth [herself]87-elizabeth . This , though late , and reluctant , and ungracious , was yet better than nothing , and [her]89-anne spirits improved . After talking , however , of the weather , and Bath , and the concert , [their]1249-your party conversation began to flag , and so little was said at last , that [she]89-anne was expecting [him]112-captain wentworth to go every moment , but [he]112-captain wentworth did not ; [he]112-captain wentworth seemed in no hurry to leave [her]89-anne ; and presently with renewed spirit , with a little smile , a little glow , [he]112-captain wentworth said — “[1248-you] [I]0-i have hardly seen [you]1250-you since [our]1251-our day at [Lyme]43-lyme . [I]0-i am afraid [you]1250-you must have suffered from the shock , and the more from its not overpowering [you]1250-you at the time . ” [She]89-anne assured [him]112-captain wentworth that [she]89-anne had not . “[0-i] It was a frightful hour , ” said [he]112-captain wentworth , “[0-i] a frightful day ! ” and [he]112-captain wentworth passed [his]112-captain wentworth hand across [his]112-captain wentworth eyes , as if the remembrance were still too painful , but in a moment , half smiling again , added , “[0-i] The day has produced some effects however ; has had some consequences which must be considered as the very reverse of frightful . When [you]1250-you had the presence of mind to suggest that [Benwick]153-captain benwick would be [the properest person to fetch [a surgeon]844-a surgeon]1252-the properest person to fetch a surgeon , [you]1250-you could have little idea of [his]153-captain benwick being eventually [one of those most concerned in [her]1255-her recovery]1254-one of those most concerned in her recovery . ” “[0-i] Certainly [I]0-i could have none . But it appears — [I]0-i should hope it would be a very happy match . There are on both sides good principles and good temper . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [he]0-i , looking not exactly forward ; “[0-i] but there , [I]0-i think , ends the resemblance . With all [my]0-i soul [I]0-i wish [them]1256-them happy , and rejoice over every circumstance in favour of it . [They]1256-them have no difficulties to contend with at [home]1756-home , no opposition , no caprice , no delays . [The Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves are behaving like [themselves]115-the miss musgroves , most honourably and kindly , only anxious with true parental hearts to promote [[their]115-the miss musgroves daughter]1258-their daughter ’s comfort . All this is much , very much in favour of [their]1256-them happiness ; more than perhaps — ” [He]0-i stopped . A sudden recollection seemed to occur , and to give [him]0-i some taste of that emotion which was reddening [Anne]89-anne ’s cheeks and fixing [her]89-anne eyes on the ground . After clearing [his]0-i throat , however , [he]0-i proceeded thus — “[0-i] [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i do think there is a disparity , too great a disparity , and in a point no less essential than mind . [I]0-i regard [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa as [a very amiable , sweet - tempered girl]1259-a very amiable , sweet - tempered girl , and not deficient in understanding , but [Benwick]153-captain benwick is something more . [He]153-captain benwick is [a clever man]1260-a clever man , [a reading man]1261-a reading man ; and [I]0-i confess , that [I]0-i do consider [his]153-captain benwick attaching [himself]153-captain benwick to [her]118-louisa with some surprise . Had it been the effect of gratitude , had [he]153-captain benwick learnt to love [her]118-louisa , because [he]153-captain benwick believed [her]118-louisa to be preferring [him]153-captain benwick , it would have been another thing . But [I]0-i have no reason to suppose it so . It seems , on the contrary , to have been a perfectly spontaneous , untaught feeling on [his]153-captain benwick side , and this surprises [me]0-i . [A man like [him]153-captain benwick]1262-a man like him , in [his]153-captain benwick situation ! with a heart pierced , wounded , almost broken ! [Fanny Harville]155-fanny harville was [a very superior creature]1263-a very superior creature , and [his]153-captain benwick attachment to [her]155-fanny harville was indeed attachment . [A man]307-a man does not recover from such a devotion of the heart to [such a woman]1265-such a woman . [He]307-a man ought not ; [he]307-a man does not . ” Either from the consciousness , however , that [[his]153-captain benwick friend]2516-his friend had recovered , or from other consciousness , [he]153-captain benwick went no farther ; and [Anne]89-anne who , in spite of the agitated voice in which the latter part had been uttered , and in spite of all the various noises of [the room]1874-the room , the almost ceaseless slam of the door , and ceaseless buzz of [persons walking through]3229-persons walking through , had distinguished every word , was struck , gratified , confused , and beginning to breathe very quick , and feel an hundred things in a moment . It was impossible for [her]89-anne to enter on such a subject ; and yet , after a pause , feeling the necessity of speaking , and having not the smallest wish for a total change , [she]89-anne only deviated so far as to say — “[307-a man] [You]153-captain benwick were a good while at [Lyme]43-lyme , [I]0-i think ? ” “[153-captain benwick] About a fortnight . [I]0-i could not leave it till [Louisa]118-louisa ’s doing well was quite ascertained . [I]0-i had been too deeply concerned in the mischief to be soon at peace . It had been [my]0-i doing , solely [mine]0-i . [She]118-louisa would not have been obstinate if [I]0-i had not been weak . [The country round [Lyme]43-lyme]1266-the country round lyme is very fine . [I]0-i walked and rode a great deal ; and the more [I]0-i saw , the more [I]0-i found to admire . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should very much like to see [Lyme]43-lyme again , ” said [Anne]89-anne . “[0-i] Indeed ! [I]0-i should not have supposed that [you]153-captain benwick could have found anything in [Lyme]43-lyme to inspire such a feeling . The horror and distress [you]153-captain benwick were involved in , the stretch of mind , the wear of spirits ! [I]0-i should have thought [your]153-captain benwick last impressions of [Lyme]43-lyme must have been strong disgust . ” “[153-captain benwick] The last hours were certainly very painful , ” replied [Anne]89-anne ; “[153-captain benwick] but when pain is over , the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure . [One]1726-one does not love a place the less for having suffered in it , unless it has been all suffering , nothing but suffering , which was by no means the case at [Lyme]43-lyme . [We]1268-we were only in anxiety and distress during the last two hours , and previously there had been a great deal of enjoyment . So much novelty and beauty ! [I]0-i have travelled so little , that [every fresh place]1269-every fresh place would be interesting to [me]0-i ; but there is real beauty at [Lyme]43-lyme ; and in short ” ( with a faint blush at some recollections ) , “[1272-he] altogether [my]0-i impressions of [the place]913-the place are very agreeable . ” As [she]89-anne ceased , the entrance door opened again , and [the very party]3230-the very party appeared for whom [they]1268-we were waiting . “[179-lady dalrymple] [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple , [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple , ” was the rejoicing sound ; and with all the eagerness compatible with anxious elegance , [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [[his]86-sir walter two ladies]3231-his two ladies stepped forward to meet [her]89-anne . [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , escorted by [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot and [Colonel Wallis , who had happened to arrive nearly at the same instant]3232-colonel wallis , who had happened to arrive nearly at the same instant , advanced into [the room]1874-the room . [The others]1828-the others joined [them]1268-we , and it was a group in which [Anne]89-anne found [herself]89-anne also necessarily included . [She]89-anne was divided from [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . [Their]1268-we interesting , almost too interesting conversation must be broken up for a time , but slight was the penance compared with the happiness which brought it on ! [She]89-anne had learnt , in the last ten minutes , more of [his]112-captain wentworth feelings towards [Louisa]118-louisa , more of all [his]112-captain wentworth feelings than [she]89-anne dared to think of ; and [she]89-anne gave [herself]89-anne up to the demands of the party , to the needful civilities of the moment , with exquisite , though agitated sensations . [She]89-anne was in good humour with all . [She]89-anne had received ideas which disposed [her]89-anne to be courteous and kind to [all]2570-all , and to pity [every one]3236-every one , as being less happy than [herself]89-anne . The delightful emotions were a little subdued , when on stepping back from [the group]3237-the group , to be joined again by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , [she]89-anne saw that [he]112-captain wentworth was gone . [She]89-anne was just in time to see [him]112-captain wentworth turn into [the Concert Room]3238-the concert room . [He]112-captain wentworth was gone ; [he]112-captain wentworth had disappeared , [she]89-anne felt a moment ’s regret . But “[179-lady dalrymple] [they]1271-they should meet again . [He]1272-he would look for [her]1273-her , [he]1272-he would find [her]1273-her out before the evening were over , and at present , perhaps , it was as well to be asunder . [She]1273-her was in need of a little interval for recollection . ” Upon [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s appearance soon afterwards , [the whole party]3239-the whole party was collected , and all that remained was to marshal [themselves]3239-the whole party , and proceed into [the Concert Room]3238-the concert room ; and be of all the consequence in [their]3239-the whole party power , draw as many eyes , excite as many whispers , and disturb as many people as [they]3239-the whole party could . Very , very happy were both [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [Anne Elliot]89-anne as [they]1271-they walked in . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth arm in arm with [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , and looking on the broad back of [the dowager Viscountess Dalrymple before [her]87-elizabeth]175-the dowager viscountess dalrymple , had nothing to wish for which did not seem within [her]87-elizabeth reach ; and [Anne]89-anne — but it would be an insult to the nature of [Anne]89-anne ’s felicity , to draw any comparison between it and [[her]89-anne sister]1946-her sister ’s ; the origin of one all selfish vanity , of the other all generous attachment . [Anne]89-anne saw nothing , thought nothing of the brilliancy of [the room]1874-the room . [Her]89-anne happiness was from within . [Her]89-anne eyes were bright and [her]89-anne cheeks glowed ; but [she]89-anne knew nothing about it . [She]89-anne was thinking only of the last half hour , and as [they]1271-they passed to [their]1271-they seats , [her]89-anne mind took a hasty range over it . [His]3243-his choice of subjects , [his]3243-his expressions , and still more [his]3243-his manner and look , had been such as [she]89-anne could see in only one light . [His]3243-his opinion of [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa ’s inferiority , an opinion which [he]3243-his had seemed solicitous to give , [his]3243-his wonder at [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , [his]3243-his feelings as to a first , strong attachment ; sentences begun which [he]3243-his could not finish , [his]3243-his half averted eyes and more than half expressive glance , all , all declared that [he]3243-his had a heart returning to [her]89-anne at least ; that anger , resentment , avoidance , were no more ; and that [they]1271-they were succeeded , not merely by friendship and regard , but by the tenderness of the past . Yes , some share of the tenderness of the past . [She]89-anne could not contemplate the change as implying less . [He]3243-his must love [her]89-anne . These were thoughts , with [their]1271-they attendant visions , which occupied and flurried [her]89-anne too much to leave [her]89-anne any power of observation ; and [she]89-anne passed along [the room]1874-the room without having a glimpse of [him]3243-his , without even trying to discern [him]3243-his . When [their]1271-they places were determined on , and they were all properly arranged , [she]89-anne looked round to see if [he]3243-his should happen to be in the same part of [the room]1874-the room , but [he]3243-his was not ; [her]89-anne eye could not reach [him]3243-his ; and the concert being just opening , [she]89-anne must consent for a time to be happy in a humbler way . [The party]2010-the party was divided and disposed of on two contiguous benches : [Anne]89-anne was among those on the foremost , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had manœuvred so well , with the assistance of [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis , as to have a seat by [her]89-anne . [Miss Elliot]89-anne , surrounded by [[her]89-anne cousins]3248-her cousins , and the principal object of [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis ’s gallantry , was quite contented . [Anne]89-anne ’s mind was in a most favourable state for the entertainment of the evening ; it was just occupation enough : [she]89-anne had feelings for [the tender]3249-the tender , spirits for [the gay]3250-the gay , attention for the scientific , and patience for the wearisome ; and had never liked a concert better , at least during the first act . Towards the close of it , in the interval succeeding an Italian song , [she]89-anne explained the words of the song to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [They]3251-they had a concert bill between [them]3251-they . “[1273-her] This , ” said [she]89-anne , “[1273-her] is nearly the sense , or rather the meaning of the words , for certainly the sense of an Italian love - song must not be talked of , but it is as nearly the meaning as [I]0-i can give ; for [I]0-i do not pretend to understand the language . [I]0-i am [a very poor Italian scholar]1274-a very poor italian scholar . ” “[1274-a very poor italian scholar] Yes , yes , [I]0-i see [you]0-i are . [I]0-i see [you]0-i know nothing of the matter . [You]0-i have only knowledge enough of the language to translate at sight these inverted , transposed , curtailed Italian lines , into clear , comprehensible , elegant English . [You]0-i need not say anything more of [your]0-i ignorance . Here is complete proof . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will not oppose such kind politeness ; but [I]0-i should be sorry to be examined by [a real proficient]1275-a real proficient . ” “[1275-a real proficient] [I]0-i have not had the pleasure of visiting in [Camden Place]53-camden place so long , ” replied [he]0-i , “[0-i] without knowing something of [Miss Anne Elliot]89-anne ; and [I]0-i do regard [her]89-anne as one who is too modest for [the world]1711-the world in general to be aware of half [her]89-anne accomplishments , and too highly accomplished for modesty to be natural in [any other woman]1277-any other woman . ” “[89-anne] For shame ! for shame ! this is too much flattery . [I]0-i forget what [we]1278-we are to have next , ” turning to the bill . “[0-i] Perhaps , ” said [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , speaking low , “[0-i] [I]0-i have had a longer acquaintance with [your]0-i character than [you]0-i are aware of . ” “[0-i] Indeed ! How so ? [You]0-i can have been acquainted with it only since [I]0-i came to [Bath]9-bath , excepting as [you]0-i might hear [me]0-i previously spoken of in [[my]0-i own family]1279-my own family . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i knew [you]0-i by report long before [you]0-i came to [Bath]9-bath . [I]0-i had heard [you]0-i described by [those who knew [you]0-i intimately]1280-those who knew you intimately . [I]0-i have been acquainted with [you]0-i by character many years . [Your]0-i person , [your]0-i disposition , accomplishments , manner ; they were all present to [me]0-i . ” [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was not disappointed in the interest [he]98-mr elliot hoped to raise . [No one]1949-no one can withstand the charm of such a mystery . To have been described long ago to a recent acquaintance , by [nameless people]3253-nameless people , is irresistible ; and [Anne]89-anne was all curiosity . [She]1282-she wondered , and questioned [him]1281-he eagerly ; but in vain . [He]1281-he delighted in being asked , but [he]1281-he would not tell . “[1282-she] No , no , some time or other , perhaps , but not now . [He]1281-he would mention no names now ; but such , [he]1281-he could assure [her]1282-she , had been the fact . [He]1281-he had many years ago received such a description of [Miss Anne Elliot]89-anne as had inspired [him]1281-he with the highest idea of [her]89-anne merit , and excited the warmest curiosity to know [her]89-anne . ” [Anne]89-anne could think of [no one]1949-no one so likely to have spoken with partiality of [her]89-anne many years ago as [the Mr Wentworth of [Monkford]13-monkford , [[Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s brother]3256-captain wentworth ’s brother]3255-the mr wentworth of monkford , captain wentworth ’s brother . [He]3255-the mr wentworth of monkford , captain wentworth ’s brother might have been in [[Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s company]3257-mr elliot ’s company , but [she]89-anne had not courage to ask the question . “[89-anne] The name of [Anne Elliot]89-anne , ” said [he]0-i , “[89-anne] has long had an interesting sound to [me]0-i . Very long has it possessed a charm over [my]0-i fancy ; and , if [I]0-i dared , [I]0-i would breathe [my]0-i wishes that the name might never change . ” Such , [she]89-anne believed , were [his]0-i words ; but scarcely had [she]89-anne received their sound , than [her]89-anne attention was caught by other sounds immediately behind [her]89-anne , which rendered every thing else trivial . [[Her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple were speaking . “[1283-a well - looking man] [A well - looking man]1283-a well - looking man , ” said [Sir Walter]86-sir walter , “[1284-a very well - looking man] [a very well - looking man]1284-a very well - looking man . ” “[1284-a very well - looking man] [A very fine young man]2172-a very fine young man indeed ! ” said [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple . “[2172-a very fine young man] More air than one often sees in [Bath]9-bath . [Irish]200-irish , [I]0-i dare say . ” “[200-irish] No , [I]0-i just know [his]1283-a well - looking man name . [A bowing acquaintance]1286-a bowing acquaintance . [Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ; [Captain Wentworth of the navy]1287-captain wentworth of the navy . [[His]1283-a well - looking man sister]2264-his sister married [[my]0-i tenant in [Somersetshire]2-somersetshire]1289-my tenant in somersetshire , [the Croft]1290-the croft , who rents [Kellynch]5-kellynch . ” Before [Sir Walter]86-sir walter had reached this point , [Anne]89-anne ’s eyes had caught the right direction , and distinguished [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth standing among a cluster of men at a little distance . As [her]89-anne eyes fell on [him]112-captain wentworth , [his]112-captain wentworth seemed to be withdrawn from [her]89-anne . It had that appearance . It seemed as if [she]89-anne had been one moment too late ; and as long as [she]89-anne dared observe , [he]112-captain wentworth did not look again : but the performance was recommencing , and [she]89-anne was forced to seem to restore [her]89-anne attention to the orchestra and look straight forward . When [she]89-anne could give another glance , [he]112-captain wentworth had moved away . [He]112-captain wentworth could not have come nearer to [her]89-anne if [he]112-captain wentworth would ; [she]89-anne was so surrounded and shut in : but [she]89-anne would rather have caught [his]112-captain wentworth eye . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s speech , too , distressed [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne had no longer any inclination to talk to [him]112-captain wentworth . [She]89-anne wished [him]112-captain wentworth not so near [her]89-anne . The first act was over . Now [she]89-anne hoped for some beneficial change ; and , after a period of nothing - saying amongst [the party]2010-the party , [some of [them]2010-the party]3260-some of them did decide on going in quest of tea . [Anne]89-anne was one of the few who did not choose to move . [She]89-anne remained in [her]89-anne seat , and so did [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ; but [she]89-anne had the pleasure of getting rid of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; and [she]89-anne did not mean , whatever [she]89-anne might feel on [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s account , to shrink from conversation with [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , if [he]112-captain wentworth gave [her]89-anne the opportunity . [She]89-anne was persuaded by [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s countenance that [she]89-anne had seen [him]112-captain wentworth . [He]112-captain wentworth did not come however . [Anne]89-anne sometimes fancied [she]89-anne discerned [him]112-captain wentworth at a distance , but [he]112-captain wentworth never came . The anxious interval wore away unproductively . [The others]1828-the others returned , [the room]1874-the room filled again , benches were reclaimed and repossessed , and another hour of pleasure or of penance was to be sat out , another hour of music was to give delight or the gapes , as real or affected taste for it prevailed . To [Anne]89-anne , it chiefly wore the prospect of an hour of agitation . [She]89-anne could not quit [that room]3263-that room in peace without seeing [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth once more , without the interchange of one friendly look . In re - settling [themselves]3264-themselves there were now many changes , the result of which was favourable for [her]89-anne . [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis declined sitting down again , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was invited by [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , in a manner not to be refused , to sit between [them]3264-themselves ; and by some other removals , and a little scheming of [her]89-anne own , [Anne]89-anne was enabled to place [herself]89-anne much nearer the end of the bench than [she]89-anne had been before , much more within reach of [a passer - by]3265-a passer - by . [She]89-anne could not do so , without comparing [herself]89-anne with [Miss Larolles]201-miss larolles , [the inimitable Miss Larolles]201-miss larolles ; but still [she]89-anne did it , and not with much happier effect ; though by what seemed prosperity in the shape of an early abdication in [[her]89-anne next neighbours]3266-her next neighbours , [she]89-anne found [herself]89-anne at the very end of the bench before the concert closed . Such was [her]89-anne situation , with a vacant space at hand , when [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was again in sight . [She]89-anne saw [him]112-captain wentworth not far off . [He]112-captain wentworth saw [her]89-anne too ; yet [he]112-captain wentworth looked grave , and seemed irresolute , and only by very slow degrees came at last near enough to speak to [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne felt that something must be the matter . The change was indubitable . The difference between [his]112-captain wentworth present air and what it had been in [the Octagon Room]3221-the octagon room was strikingly great . Why was it ? [She]89-anne thought of [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father , of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . Could there have been any unpleasant glances ? [He]112-captain wentworth began by speaking of the concert gravely , more like [the Captain Wentworth of [Uppercross]3-uppercross]112-captain wentworth ; owned [himself]112-captain wentworth disappointed , had expected singing ; and in short , must confess that [he]112-captain wentworth should not be sorry when it was over . [Anne]89-anne replied , and spoke in defence of the performance so well , and yet in allowance for [his]112-captain wentworth feelings so pleasantly , that [his]112-captain wentworth countenance improved , and [he]112-captain wentworth replied again with almost a smile . [They]3269-they talked for a few minutes more ; the improvement held ; [he]112-captain wentworth even looked down towards the bench , as if [he]112-captain wentworth saw a place on [it]3270-it well worth occupying ; when at that moment a touch on [her]89-anne shoulder obliged [Anne]89-anne to turn round . It came from [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [He]98-mr elliot begged [her]89-anne pardon , but [she]89-anne must be applied to , to explain [Italian]203-italian again . [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret was very anxious to have a general idea of what was next to be sung . [Anne]89-anne could not refuse ; but never had [she]89-anne sacrificed to politeness with a more suffering spirit . A few minutes , though as few as possible , were inevitably consumed ; and when [[her]89-anne own mistress]3271-her own mistress again , when able to turn and look as [she]89-anne had done before , [she]89-anne found [herself]89-anne accosted by [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , in a reserved yet hurried sort of farewell . “[1290-the croft] [He]1291-he must wish [her]1291-he good night ; [he]1291-he was going ; [he]1291-he should get [home]1756-home as fast as [he]1291-he could . ” “[1290-the croft] Is not this song worth staying for ? ” said [Anne]89-anne , suddenly struck by an idea which made [her]89-anne yet more anxious to be encouraging . “[1290-the croft] No ! ” [he]0-i replied impressively , “[1290-the croft] there is nothing worth [my]0-i staying for ; ” and [he]0-i was gone directly . Jealousy of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ! It was the only intelligible motive . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth jealous of [her]1291-he affection ! Could [she]89-anne have believed it a week ago ; three hours ago ! For a moment the gratification was exquisite . But , alas ! there were very different thoughts to succeed . How was such jealousy to be quieted ? How was the truth to reach [him]0-i ? How , in all the peculiar disadvantages of [their]3272-their respective situations , would [he]0-i ever learn of [her]89-anne real sentiments ? It was misery to think of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s attentions . [Their]3272-their evil was incalculable . CHAPTER XXI . [Anne]89-anne recollected with pleasure the next morning [her]89-anne promise of going to [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , meaning that it should engage [her]89-anne from [home]1756-home at the time when [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot would be most likely to call ; for to avoid [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was almost a first object . [She]89-anne felt a great deal of good - will towards [him]98-mr elliot . In spite of the mischief of [his]98-mr elliot attentions , [she]89-anne owed [him]98-mr elliot gratitude and regard , perhaps compassion . [She]89-anne could not help thinking much of the extraordinary circumstances attending [their]3272-their acquaintance , of the right which [he]98-mr elliot seemed to have to interest [her]89-anne , by everything in situation , by [his]98-mr elliot own sentiments , by [his]98-mr elliot early prepossession . It was altogether very extraordinary ; flattering , but painful . There was much to regret . How [she]89-anne might have felt had there been no [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth in the case , was not worth enquiry ; for there was a [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ; and be the conclusion of the present suspense good or bad , [her]89-anne affection would be [his]98-mr elliot for ever . [Their]3272-their union , [she]89-anne believed , could not divide [her]89-anne more from [other men]3274-other men , than [their]3272-their final separation . Prettier musings of high - wrought love and eternal constancy , could never have passed along [the streets of [Bath]9-bath]3275-the streets of bath , than [Anne]89-anne was sporting with from [Camden Place]53-camden place to [Westgate Buildings]67-westgate buildings . It was almost enough to spread purification and perfume all the way . [She]89-anne was sure of a pleasant reception ; and [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend seemed this morning particularly obliged to [her]89-anne for coming , seemed hardly to have expected [her]89-anne , though it had been an appointment . An account of the concert was immediately claimed ; and [Anne]89-anne ’s recollections of the concert were quite happy enough to animate [her]89-anne features and make [her]89-anne rejoice to talk of it . All that [she]89-anne could tell [she]89-anne told most gladly , but the all was little for [one who had been [there]1845-there , and unsatisfactory for [such an enquirer]3279-such an enquirer as [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , who had already heard , through the short cut of [a laundress]3280-a laundress and [a waiter]2697-a waiter , rather more of the general success and produce of the evening than [Anne]89-anne could relate , and who now asked in vain for several particulars of [the company]3282-the company]3277-one who had been there , and unsatisfactory for such an enquirer as mrs smith , who had already heard , through the short cut of a laundress and a waiter , rather more of the general success and produce of the evening than anne could relate , and who now asked in vain for several particulars of the company . [Everybody of any consequence or notoriety in Bath]3283-everybody of any consequence or notoriety in bath was well know by name to [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith . “[1290-the croft] [The little Durands]204-the little durands were [there]1845-there , [I]0-i conclude , ” said [she]181-mrs smith , “[0-i] with [their]204-the little durands mouths open to catch the music , like unfledged sparrows ready to be fed . [They]204-the little durands never miss a concert . ” “[204-the little durands] Yes ; [I]0-i did not see [them]204-the little durands [myself]0-i , but [I]0-i heard [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot say [they]204-the little durands were in [the room]1874-the room . ” “[98-mr elliot] [The Ibbotsons]205-the ibbotsons , were [they]204-the little durands [there]1845-there ? and [the two new beauties]1296-the two new beauties , with [the tall Irish officer , who is talked of for one of [them]204-the little durands]1297-the tall irish officer , who is talked of for one of them . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not know . [I]0-i do not think [they]1296-the two new beauties were . ” “[1296-the two new beauties] [Old Lady Mary Maclean]90-mary ? [I]0-i need not ask after [her]90-mary . [She]90-mary never misses , [I]0-i know ; and [you]0-i must have seen [her]90-mary . [She]90-mary must have been in [[your]0-i own circle]1298-your own circle ; for as [you]0-i went with [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple , [you]0-i were in the seats of grandeur , round the orchestra , of course . ” “[0-i] No , that was what [I]0-i dreaded . It would have been very unpleasant to [me]0-i in every respect . But happily [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple always chooses to be farther off ; and [we]1299-we were exceedingly well placed , that is , for hearing ; [I]0-i must not say for seeing , because [I]0-i appear to have seen very little . ” “[0-i] Oh ! [you]0-i saw enough for [your]0-i own amusement . [I]0-i can understand . There is a sort of domestic enjoyment to be known even in [a crowd]1300-a crowd , and this [you]0-i had . [You]0-i were a large party in [yourselves]0-i , and [you]0-i wanted nothing beyond . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i ought to have looked about [me]0-i more , ” said [Anne]89-anne , conscious while [she]89-anne spoke that there had in fact been no want of looking about , that the object only had been deficient . “[0-i] No , no ; [you]0-i were better employed . [You]0-i need not tell [me]0-i that [you]0-i had a pleasant evening . [I]0-i see it in [your]0-i eye . [I]0-i perfectly see how the hours passed : that [you]0-i had always something agreeable to listen to . In the intervals of the concert it was conversation . ” [Anne]89-anne half smiled and said , “[0-i] Do [you]0-i see that in [my]0-i eye ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i do . [Your]0-i countenance perfectly informs [me]0-i that [you]0-i were in company last night with [the person whom [you]0-i think the most agreeable in [the world]1711-the world]1301-the person whom you think the most agreeable in the world , [the person who interests [you]0-i at this present time more than all the rest of [the world]1711-the world put together]1303-the person who interests you at this present time more than all the rest of the world put together . ” A blush overspread [Anne]89-anne ’s cheeks . [She]89-anne could say nothing . “[1303-the person who interests you at this present time more than all the rest of the world put together] And such being the case , ” continued [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , after a short pause , “[0-i] [I]0-i hope [you]0-i believe that [I]0-i do know how to value [your]0-i kindness in coming to [me]0-i this morning . It is really very good of [you]0-i to come and sit with [me]0-i , when [you]0-i must have so many pleasanter demands upon [your]0-i time . ” [Anne]89-anne heard nothing of this . [She]89-anne was still in the astonishment and confusion excited by [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend ’s penetration , unable to imagine how any report of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth could have reached [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne caught it instantaneously ; and recovering [her]89-anne courage with the feeling of safety , soon added , more composedly , “[98-mr elliot] Are [you]98-mr elliot acquainted with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ? ” “[98-mr elliot] [I]0-i have been a good deal acquainted with [him]98-mr elliot , ” replied [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , gravely , “[0-i] but it seems worn out now . Till it does come , [you]0-i know , [we]1311-we [women]542-women never mean to have [anybody]462-anybody . [Ninety - nine out of a hundred]1322-ninety - nine out of a hundred would do the same . Of course , [he]98-mr elliot can not be aware of the importance to [me]0-i . [He]98-mr elliot seems to have a calm decided temper , not at all open to dangerous impressions . [I]0-i consider [him]98-mr elliot with great respect . But [I]0-i have not known [him]98-mr elliot long ; and [he]98-mr elliot is [not a man]1327-not a man , [I]0-i think , to be known intimately soon . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith would hardly have believed so soon in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s failure , but from the perception of there being [a somebody else]3286-a somebody else . As it was , [she]181-mrs smith instantly submitted , and with all the semblance of seeing nothing beyond ; and [Anne]89-anne , eager to escape farther notice , was impatient to know why [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith should have fancied [she]181-mrs smith was to marry [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; where [she]181-mrs smith could have received the idea , or from whom [she]181-mrs smith could have heard it . “[98-mr elliot] Do tell [me]0-i how it first came into [your]181-mrs smith head . ” “[98-mr elliot] It first came into [my]0-i head , ” replied [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , “[98-mr elliot] upon finding how much [you]181-mrs smith were together , and feeling it to be the most probable thing in [the world]1711-the world to be wished for by [everybody belonging to either of [you]181-mrs smith]1329-everybody belonging to either of you ; and [you]181-mrs smith may depend upon it that all [your]181-mrs smith acquaintance have disposed of [you]181-mrs smith in the same way . [She]1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday had had it from [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis [herself]172-mrs wallis , which did not seem bad authority . [She]1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday sat an hour with [me]0-i on Monday evening , and gave [me]0-i the whole history . ” “[1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday] The whole history , ” repeated [Anne]89-anne , laughing . “[1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday] [She]1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday could not make a very long history , [I]0-i think , of one such little article of unfounded news . ” [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith said nothing . “[1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday] But , ” continued [Anne]89-anne , presently , “[1330-the woman who opened the door to you when you called yesterday] though there is no truth in [my]0-i having this claim on [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , [I]0-i should be extremely happy to be of use to [you]181-mrs smith in any way that [I]0-i could . Shall [I]0-i mention to [him]98-mr elliot [your]181-mrs smith being in [Bath]9-bath ? Shall [I]0-i take any message ? ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i thank [you]181-mrs smith : no , certainly not . No , [I]0-i thank [you]181-mrs smith , [I]0-i have nothing to trouble [you]181-mrs smith with . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]181-mrs smith spoke of having known [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot many years ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did . ” “[0-i] Not before [he]98-mr elliot was married , [I]0-i suppose ? ” “[98-mr elliot] Yes ; [he]98-mr elliot was not married when [I]0-i knew [him]98-mr elliot first . ” “[0-i] And — were [you]181-mrs smith much acquainted ? ” “[181-mrs smith] Intimately . ” “[181-mrs smith] Indeed ! Then do tell [me]0-i what [he]98-mr elliot was at that time of life . [I]0-i have a great curiosity to know what [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was as [a very young man]1775-a very young man . Was [he]98-mr elliot at all such as [he]98-mr elliot appears now ? ” “[98-mr elliot] [I]0-i have not seen [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot these three years , ” was [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s answer , given so gravely that it was impossible to pursue the subject farther ; and [Anne]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne had gained nothing but an increase of curiosity . [They]3287-they were both silent : [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith very thoughtful . At last — “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]98-mr elliot pardon , [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear [Miss Elliot]89-anne , ” [she]181-mrs smith cried , in [her]181-mrs smith natural tone of cordiality , “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]98-mr elliot pardon for the short answers [I]0-i have been giving [you]98-mr elliot , but [I]0-i have been uncertain what [I]0-i ought to do . [I]0-i have been doubting and considering as to what [I]0-i ought to tell [you]98-mr elliot . There were many things to be taken into the account . [One]1726-one hates to be officious , to be giving bad impressions , making mischief . Even the smooth surface of [family - union]1337-family - union seems worth preserving , though there may be nothing durable beneath . However , [I]0-i have determined ; [I]0-i think [I]0-i am right ; [I]0-i think [you]98-mr elliot ought to be made acquainted with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s real character . Though [I]0-i fully believe that , at present , [you]98-mr elliot have not the smallest intention of accepting [him]98-mr elliot , there is no saying what may happen . [You]98-mr elliot might , some time or other , be differently affected towards [him]98-mr elliot . Hear the truth , therefore , now , while [you]98-mr elliot are unprejudiced . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot is [a man without heart or conscience]1338-a man without heart or conscience ; [a designing , wary , cold - blooded being , who thinks only of [himself]98-mr elliot ; whom for [his]98-mr elliot own interest or ease , would be guilty of any cruelty , or any treachery , that could be perpetrated without risk of [his]98-mr elliot general character]1339-a designing , wary , cold - blooded being , who thinks only of himself ; whom for his own interest or ease , would be guilty of any cruelty , or any treachery , that could be perpetrated without risk of his general character . [He]98-mr elliot has no feeling for [others]1859-others . [He]98-mr elliot is totally beyond the reach of any sentiment of justice or compassion . Oh ! [he]98-mr elliot is black at heart , hollow and black ! ” [Anne]89-anne ’s astonished air , and exclamation of wonder , made [her]89-anne pause , and in a calmer manner , [she]89-anne added , “[0-i] [My]0-i expressions startle [you]98-mr elliot . [I]0-i will only tell [you]98-mr elliot what [I]0-i have found [him]98-mr elliot . Facts shall speak . [He]98-mr elliot was [the intimate friend of [[my]0-i dear husband]1344-my dear husband , who trusted and loved [him]98-mr elliot , and thought [him]98-mr elliot as good as [himself]98-mr elliot . [I]0-i found [[them]1346-them most intimate friends]1347-them most intimate friends ; and [I]0-i , too , became excessively pleased with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , and entertained the highest opinion of [him]98-mr elliot . At nineteen , [you]98-mr elliot know , [one]1726-one does not think very seriously ; but [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot appeared to [me]0-i quite as good as [others]1859-others , and much more agreeable than [most others]1350-most others , and [we]1345-we were almost always together . [We]1345-we were principally in [town]1776-town , living in very good style . [He]98-mr elliot was then [the inferior in circumstances]1352-the inferior in circumstances ; [he]98-mr elliot was then [the poor one]1353-the poor one ; [he]98-mr elliot had chambers in [the Temple]1354-the temple , and it was as much as [he]98-mr elliot could do to support the appearance of [a gentleman]1842-a gentleman . [[My]0-i father]275-my father was certainly disposed to take very kind and proper notice of [him]98-mr elliot . Why did [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot draw back ? ” “[98-mr elliot] [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , ” replied [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , “[98-mr elliot] at that period of [his]98-mr elliot life , had one object in view : to make [his]98-mr elliot fortune , and by a rather quicker process than the law . [He]98-mr elliot was determined to make it by marriage . [He]98-mr elliot was determined , at least , not to mar it by an imprudent marriage ; and [I]0-i know it was [his]98-mr elliot belief ( whether justly or not , of course [I]0-i can not decide ) , that [[your]1374-your father]240-your father and [sister]1740-sister , in [their]1377-their civilities and invitations , were designing a match between [the heir]1378-the heir and [the young lady]1190-the young lady , and it was impossible that such a match should have answered [his]98-mr elliot ideas of wealth and independence . That was [his]98-mr elliot motive for drawing back , [I]0-i can assure [you]1374-your . [He]98-mr elliot told [me]0-i the whole story . [He]98-mr elliot had no concealments with [me]0-i . [He]98-mr elliot described one [Miss Elliot]89-anne , and [I]0-i thought very affectionately of the other . ” “[98-mr elliot] Perhaps , ” cried [Anne]89-anne , struck by a sudden idea , “[98-mr elliot] [you]98-mr elliot sometimes spoke of [me]0-i to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ? ” “[98-mr elliot] To be sure [I]0-i did ; very often . How sure to be mistaken ! But [I]0-i beg [your]89-anne pardon ; [I]0-i have interrupted [you]89-anne . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot married then completely for money ? When [one]1726-one lives in [the world]1711-the world , [a man]307-a man or [woman]2587-woman ’s marrying for money is too common to strike one as it ought . [I]0-i was very young , and associated only with [the young]2328-the young , and [we]1390-we were [a thoughtless , gay set , without any strict rules of conduct]1391-a thoughtless , gay set , without any strict rules of conduct . [We]1390-we lived for enjoyment . [[Her]1392-her father]1745-her father was [a grazier]1395-a grazier , [[her]1392-her grandfather]1396-her grandfather had been [a butcher]1397-a butcher , but that was all nothing . [She]1392-her was [a fine woman]1398-a fine woman , had had a decent education , was brought forward by [some cousins]1399-some cousins , thrown by chance into [[Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s company]3257-mr elliot ’s company , and fell in love with [him]98-mr elliot ; and not a difficulty or a scruple was there on [his]98-mr elliot side , with respect to [her]1392-her birth . All [his]98-mr elliot caution was spent in being secured of the real amount of [her]1392-her fortune , before [he]98-mr elliot committed [himself]98-mr elliot . Depend upon it , whatever esteem [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot may have for [his]98-mr elliot own situation in life now , as [a young man]1938-a young man [he]98-mr elliot had not the smallest value for it . [I]0-i have often heard [him]98-mr elliot declare , that if baronetcies were saleable , [anybody]462-anybody should have [his]462-anybody for fifty pounds , arms and motto , name and livery included ; but [I]0-i will not pretend to repeat half that [I]0-i used to hear [him]98-mr elliot say on that subject .
