But [he]98-mr elliot was careless and immethodical , like [other men]3274-other men , about those things ; and when [I]0-i came to examine [his]98-mr elliot papers , [I]0-i found it with others still more trivial , from [different people scattered here and there]1414-different people scattered here and there , while many letters and memorandums of real importance had been destroyed . Here it is ; [I]0-i would not burn it , because being even then very little satisfied with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , [I]0-i was determined to preserve every document of former intimacy . [I]0-i have now another motive for being glad that [I]0-i can produce it . ” This was the letter , directed to “[209-charles smith] [Charles Smith]209-charles smith , Esq . [Tunbridge Wells]78-tunbridge wells , ” and dated from [London]6-london , as far back as July , 1803 : — “[209-charles smith] [Dear Smith]210-dear smith , “ [I]210-dear smith have received [yours]210-dear smith . [Your]210-dear smith kindness almost overpowers [me]210-dear smith . [I]210-dear smith wish nature had made such hearts as [yours]210-dear smith more common , but [I]210-dear smith have lived three - and - twenty years in [the world]1711-the world , and have seen none like it . At present , believe [me]210-dear smith , [I]210-dear smith have no need of [your]210-dear smith services , being in cash again . Give [me]210-dear smith joy : [I]210-dear smith have got rid of [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Miss.]211-miss. [They]3290-they are gone back to [Kellynch]5-kellynch , and almost made [me]210-dear smith swear to visit [them]3290-they this summer ; but [my]210-dear smith first visit to [Kellynch]5-kellynch will be with [a surveyor]3291-a surveyor , to tell [me]210-dear smith how to bring it with best advantage to the hammer . [The baronet]380-the baronet , nevertheless , is not unlikely to marry again ; [he]380-the baronet is quite fool enough . If [he]380-the baronet does , however , [they]3290-they will leave [me]210-dear smith in peace , which may be a decent equivalent for the reversion . [He]380-the baronet is worse than last year . “[210-dear smith] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had any name but [Elliot]98-mr elliot . [I]0-i am sick of it . [ELLIOT]98-mr elliot . ”[1415-you] Such a letter could not be read without putting [Anne]89-anne in a glow ; and [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , observing the high colour in [her]89-anne face , said — “ The language , [I]181-mrs smith know , is highly disrespectful . Though [I]181-mrs smith have forgot the exact terms , [I]181-mrs smith have a perfect impression of the general meaning . But it shows [you]89-anne [the man]1783-the man . Mark [his]1783-the man professions to [[my]181-mrs smith poor husband]3294-my poor husband . Can any thing be stronger ? ”[181-mrs smith] [Anne]89-anne could not immediately get over the shock and mortification of finding such words applied to [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father . [She]89-anne was obliged to recollect that [her]89-anne seeing the letter was a violation of the laws of honour , that [no one]1949-no one ought to be judged or to be known by such testimonies , that no private correspondence could bear the eye of [others]1859-others , before [she]89-anne could recover calmness enough to return the letter which [she]89-anne had been meditating over , and say — “ Thank [you]181-mrs smith . This is full proof undoubtedly ; proof of every thing [you]181-mrs smith were saying . But why be acquainted with [us]3295-us now ? ”[89-anne] “ [I]181-mrs smith can explain this too , ”[181-mrs smith] cried [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , smiling . “ Can [you]181-mrs smith really ? ”[181-mrs smith] “ Yes . [I]89-anne have shewn [you]89-anne [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot as [he]98-mr elliot was a dozen years ago , and [I]89-anne will shew [him]98-mr elliot as [he]98-mr elliot is now . [I]89-anne can not produce written proof again , but [I]89-anne can give as authentic oral testimony as [you]89-anne can desire , of what [he]98-mr elliot is now wanting , and what [he]98-mr elliot is now doing . [He]98-mr elliot is [no hypocrite]3296-no hypocrite now . [He]98-mr elliot truly wants to marry [you]89-anne . [His]98-mr elliot present attentions to [[your]89-anne family]3065-your family are very sincere : quite from the heart . [I]89-anne will give [you]89-anne [my]89-anne authority : [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis . ”[89-anne] “ [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis ! [you]89-anne are acquainted with [him]98-mr elliot ? ”[89-anne] “ No . It does not come to [me]181-mrs smith in quite so direct a line as that ; it takes a bend or two , but nothing of consequence . [The stream]3299-the stream is as good as at first ; the little rubbish it collects in the turnings is easily moved away . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot talks unreservedly to [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis of [his]98-mr elliot views on [you]89-anne , which said [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis , [I]181-mrs smith imagine to be , in [himself]98-mr elliot , a sensible , careful , discerning sort of character ; but [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis has [a very pretty silly wife]3300-a very pretty silly wife , to whom [he]171-colonel wallis tells things which [he]171-colonel wallis had better not , and [he]171-colonel wallis repeats it all to [her]3300-a very pretty silly wife . When [I]181-mrs smith talked of a whole history , therefore , [you]89-anne see [I]181-mrs smith was not romancing so much as [you]89-anne supposed . ”[181-mrs smith] “ [[My]89-anne dear]351-my dear [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , [your]89-anne authority is deficient . This will not do . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s having any views on [me]89-anne will not in the least account for the efforts [he]98-mr elliot made towards a reconciliation with [[my]89-anne father]275-my father . That was all prior to [my]89-anne coming to [Bath]9-bath . [I]89-anne found [them]3306-them on the most friendly terms when [I]89-anne arrived . ”[89-anne] “ [I]89-anne know [you]89-anne did ; [I]89-anne know it all perfectly , but — ”[89-anne] “ Indeed , [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , [we]3307-we must not expect to get real information in such a line . Facts or opinions which are to pass through the hands of so many , to be misconceived by folly in one , and ignorance in another , can hardly have much truth left . ”[181-mrs smith] “ Only give [me]89-anne a hearing . [You]89-anne will soon be able to judge of the general credit due , by listening to some particulars which [you]89-anne can [yourself]89-anne immediately contradict or confirm . [Nobody]271-nobody supposes that [you]89-anne were [his]98-mr elliot first inducement . [He]98-mr elliot had seen [you]89-anne indeed , before [he]98-mr elliot came to [Bath]9-bath , and admired [you]89-anne , but without knowing it to be [you]89-anne . So says [[my]89-anne historian]3309-my historian , at least . Is this true ? So far it is very true . At [Lyme]43-lyme . [I]89-anne happened to be at [Lyme]43-lyme . ”[89-anne] “ Well , ”[181-mrs smith] continued [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , triumphantly , “ grant [[my]181-mrs smith friend]3096-my friend the credit due to the establishment of the first point asserted . [He]98-mr elliot saw [you]89-anne then at [Lyme]43-lyme , and liked [you]89-anne so well as to be exceedingly pleased to meet with [you]89-anne again in [Camden Place]53-camden place , as [Miss Anne Elliot]89-anne , and from that moment , [I]181-mrs smith have no doubt , had a double motive in [his]98-mr elliot visits [there]1845-there . But there was another , and an earlier , which [I]181-mrs smith will now explain . If there is anything in [my]181-mrs smith story which [you]89-anne know to be either false or improbable , stop [me]181-mrs smith . [My]181-mrs smith account states , that [[[your]89-anne sister]426-your sister ’s friend]3314-your sister ’s friend , [the lady now staying with [you]89-anne , whom [I]181-mrs smith have heard [you]89-anne mention]3315-the lady now staying with you , whom i have heard you mention , came to [Bath]9-bath with [Miss Elliot]89-anne and [Sir Walter]86-sir walter as long ago as [September]212-september ( in short when [they]3316-they first came [themselves]3316-they ) , and has been staying [there]1845-there ever since ; that [she]3314-your sister ’s friend is [a clever , insinuating , handsome woman]3318-a clever , insinuating , handsome woman , poor and plausible , and altogether such in situation and manner , as to give a general idea , among [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ’s acquaintance , of [her]3314-your sister ’s friend meaning to be [Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot , and as general a surprise that [Miss Elliot]89-anne should be apparently , blind to the danger . ”[181-mrs smith] Here [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith paused a moment ; but [Anne]89-anne had not a word to say , and [she]181-mrs smith continued — “ This was the light in which it appeared to [those who knew [the family]1782-the family , long before [you]89-anne returned to it]3319-those who knew the family , long before you returned to it ; and [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis had [his]171-colonel wallis eye upon [[your]89-anne father]240-your father enough to be sensible of it , though [he]171-colonel wallis did not then visit in [Camden Place]53-camden place ; but [his]171-colonel wallis regard for [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot gave [him]171-colonel wallis an interest in watching all that was going on [there]1845-there , and when [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot came to [Bath]9-bath for a day or two , as [he]98-mr elliot happened to do a little before Christmas , [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis made [him]98-mr elliot acquainted with the appearance of things , and the reports beginning to prevail . Now [you]89-anne are to understand , that time had worked a very material change in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s opinions as to the value of a baronetcy . Upon all points of blood and connexion [he]98-mr elliot is [a completely altered man]3323-a completely altered man . Having long had as much money as [he]98-mr elliot could spend , nothing to wish for on the side of avarice or indulgence , [he]98-mr elliot has been gradually learning to pin [his]98-mr elliot happiness upon the consequence [he]98-mr elliot is heir to . [I]181-mrs smith thought it coming on before [our]3324-our acquaintance ceased , but it is now a confirmed feeling . [He]98-mr elliot can not bear the idea of not being [Sir William]213-sir william . [You]89-anne may guess , therefore , that the news [he]98-mr elliot heard from [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend could not be very agreeable , and [you]89-anne may guess what it produced ; the resolution of coming back to [Bath]9-bath as soon as possible , and of fixing [himself]98-mr elliot [here]376-here for a time , with the view of renewing [his]98-mr elliot former acquaintance , and recovering such a footing in [the family]1782-the family as might give [him]98-mr elliot the means of ascertaining the degree of [his]98-mr elliot danger , and of circumventing [the lady]2454-the lady if [he]98-mr elliot found it material . This was agreed upon between [the two friends]1209-the two friends as the only thing to be done ; and [Colonel Wallis]171-colonel wallis was to assist in every way that [he]171-colonel wallis could . [He]98-mr elliot was to be introduced , and [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis was to be introduced , and [everybody]2119-everybody was to be introduced . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot came back accordingly ; and on application was forgiven , as [you]89-anne know , and re - admitted into [the family]1782-the family ; and there it was [his]98-mr elliot constant object , and [his]98-mr elliot only object ( till [your]89-anne arrival added another motive ) , to watch [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . [He]98-mr elliot omitted no opportunity of being with [them]1209-the two friends , threw [himself]98-mr elliot in [their]1209-the two friends way , called at all hours ; but [I]181-mrs smith need not be particular on this subject . [You]89-anne can imagine what [an artful man]3332-an artful man would do ; and with this guide , perhaps , may recollect what [you]89-anne have seen [him]98-mr elliot do . ”[181-mrs smith] “ Yes , ”[89-anne] said [Anne]89-anne , “ [you]89-anne tell [me]89-anne nothing which does not accord with what [I]89-anne have known , or could imagine . There is always something offensive in the details of cunning . The manœuvres of selfishness and duplicity must ever be revolting , but [I]89-anne have heard nothing which really surprises [me]89-anne . [I]89-anne know those who would be shocked by such a representation of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , who would have difficulty in believing it ; but [I]89-anne have never been satisfied . [I]89-anne have always wanted some other motive for [his]98-mr elliot conduct than appeared . [I]89-anne should like to know [his]98-mr elliot present opinion , as to the probability of the event [he]98-mr elliot has been in dread of ; whether [he]98-mr elliot considers the danger to be lessening or not . ”[89-anne] “ Lessening , [I]181-mrs smith understand , ”[181-mrs smith] replied [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith . “ [He]98-mr elliot thinks [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay afraid of [him]98-mr elliot , aware that [he]98-mr elliot sees through [her]101-mrs clay , and not daring to proceed as [she]101-mrs clay might do in [his]98-mr elliot absence . But since [he]98-mr elliot must be absent some time or other , [I]181-mrs smith do not perceive how [he]98-mr elliot can ever be secure while [she]101-mrs clay holds [her]101-mrs clay present influence . [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis has an amusing idea , as [nurse]3333-nurse tells [me]181-mrs smith , that it is to be put into the marriage articles when [you]3334-you and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot marry , that [[your]3334-you father]240-your father is not to marry [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay . A scheme , worthy of [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis ’s understanding , by all accounts ; but [my]181-mrs smith sensible nurse [Rooke]183-mrs rooke sees the absurdity of it . ‘ Why , to be sure , [ma’am]648-ma’am , ’ said [she]183-mrs rooke , ‘ it would not prevent [his]98-mr elliot marrying [anybody else]1811-anybody else . ’ And , indeed , to own the truth , [I]181-mrs smith do not think [nurse]3333-nurse , in [her]3333-nurse heart , is a very strenuous opposer of [Sir Walter]86-sir walter ’s making a second match . [She]3333-nurse must be allowed to be [a favourer of matrimony]3339-a favourer of matrimony , [you]3334-you know ; and ( since [self]3340-self will intrude ) who can say that [she]3333-nurse may not have some flying visions of attending the next [Lady Elliot]96-lady elliot , through [Mrs Wallis]172-mrs wallis ’s recommendation ? ”[181-mrs smith] “ [I]89-anne am very glad to know all this , ”[89-anne] said [Anne]89-anne , after a little thoughtfulness . “ It will be more painful to [me]89-anne in some respects to be in company with [him]98-mr elliot , but [I]89-anne shall know better what to do . [My]89-anne line of conduct will be more direct . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot is evidently [a disingenuous , artificial , worldly man , who has never had any better principle to guide [him]98-mr elliot than selfishness]3341-a disingenuous , artificial , worldly man , who has never had any better principle to guide him than selfishness . ”[89-anne] But [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was not done with . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith had been carried away from [her]181-mrs smith first direction , and [Anne]89-anne had forgotten , in the interest of [her]89-anne own family concerns , how much had been originally implied against [him]98-mr elliot ; but [her]89-anne attention was now called to the explanation of those first hints , and [she]89-anne listened to a recital which , if it did not perfectly justify the unqualified bitterness of [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , proved [him]98-mr elliot to have been very unfeeling in [his]98-mr elliot conduct towards [her]181-mrs smith ; very deficient both in justice and compassion . [She]89-anne learned that ( the intimacy between [them]1419-their continuing unimpaired by [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s marriage ) [they]1419-their had been as before always together , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had led [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend into expenses much beyond [his]98-mr elliot fortune . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith did not want to take blame to [herself]181-mrs smith , and was most tender of throwing any on [[her]181-mrs smith husband]347-her husband ; but [Anne]89-anne could collect that [their]1419-their income had never been equal to [their]1419-their style of living , and that from the first there had been a great deal of general and joint extravagance . From [[his]98-mr elliot wife]1699-his wife ’s account of [him]98-mr elliot [she]89-anne could discern [Mr Smith]214-mr smith to have been [a man of warm feelings , easy temper , careless habits , and not strong understanding]1423-a man of warm feelings , easy temper , careless habits , and not strong understanding , much more amiable than [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend , and very unlike [him]214-mr smith , led by [him]214-mr smith , and probably despised by [him]214-mr smith . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , raised by [his]98-mr elliot marriage to great affluence , and disposed to every gratification of pleasure and vanity which could be commanded without involving [himself]98-mr elliot , ( for with all [his]98-mr elliot self - indulgence [he]98-mr elliot had become [a prudent man]1425-a prudent man ) , and beginning to be rich , just as [[his]98-mr elliot friend]2516-his friend ought to have found [himself]98-mr elliot to be poor , seemed to have had no concern at all for [that friend]1427-that friend ’s probable finances , but , on the contrary , had been prompting and encouraging expenses which could end only in ruin ; and [the Smiths]215-the smiths accordingly had been ruined . [The husband]1055-the husband had died just in time to be spared the full knowledge of it . [They]215-the smiths had previously known embarrassments enough to try the friendship of [[their]215-the smiths friends]1429-their friends , and to prove that [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s had better not be tried ; but it was not till [his]98-mr elliot death that the wretched state of [his]98-mr elliot affairs was fully known . With a confidence in [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s regard , more creditable to [his]98-mr elliot feelings than [his]98-mr elliot judgement , [Mr Smith]214-mr smith had appointed [him]98-mr elliot the executor of [his]98-mr elliot will ; but [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot would not act , and the difficulties and distress which this refusal had heaped on [her]1430-her , in addition to the inevitable sufferings of [her]1430-her situation , had been such as could not be related without anguish of spirit , or listened to without corresponding indignation . [Anne]89-anne was shewn some letters of [his]98-mr elliot on the occasion , answers to urgent applications from [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , which all breathed the same stern resolution of not engaging in a fruitless trouble , and , under a cold civility , the same hard - hearted indifference to any of the evils it might bring on [her]1430-her . It was a dreadful picture of ingratitude and inhumanity ; and [Anne]89-anne felt , at some moments , that no flagrant open crime could have been worse . [She]89-anne had a great deal to listen to ; all the particulars of past sad scenes , all the minutiae of distress upon distress , which in former conversations had been merely hinted at , were dwelt on now with a natural indulgence . [Anne]89-anne could perfectly comprehend the exquisite relief , and was only the more inclined to wonder at the composure of [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend ’s usual state of mind . There was one circumstance in the history of [her]89-anne grievances of particular irritation . [She]89-anne had good reason to believe that some property of [[her]89-anne husband]347-her husband in [the West Indies]1433-the west indies , which had been for many years under a sort of sequestration for the payment of [its]1434-its own incumbrances , might be recoverable by proper measures ; and this property , though not large , would be enough to make [her]89-anne comparatively rich . But there was [nobody to stir in]1435-nobody to stir in [it]1434-its . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot would do nothing , and [she]89-anne could do nothing [herself]89-anne , equally disabled from personal exertion by [her]89-anne state of bodily weakness , and from employing [others]1859-others by [her]89-anne want of money . [She]89-anne had no natural connexions to assist [her]89-anne even with [their]1437-their counsel , and [she]89-anne could not afford to purchase the assistance of the law . This was a cruel aggravation of actually straitened means . To feel that [she]89-anne ought to be in better circumstances , that a little trouble in [the right place]1438-the right place might do it , and to fear that delay might be even weakening [her]89-anne claims , was hard to bear . It was on this point that [she]89-anne had hoped to engage [Anne]89-anne ’s good offices with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . [She]89-anne had previously , in the anticipation of [their]1439-their marriage , been very apprehensive of losing [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend by it ; but on being assured that [he]98-mr elliot could have made no attempt of that nature , since [he]98-mr elliot did not even know [her]89-anne to be in [Bath]9-bath , it immediately occurred , that something might be done in [her]89-anne favour by the influence of [the woman [he]98-mr elliot loved]1441-the woman he loved , and [she]89-anne had been hastily preparing to interest [Anne]89-anne ’s feelings , as far as the observances due to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s character would allow , when [Anne]89-anne ’s refutation of the supposed engagement changed the face of everything ; and while it took from [her]89-anne the new - formed hope of succeeding in the object of [her]89-anne first anxiety , left [her]89-anne at least the comfort of telling the whole story [her]89-anne own way . After listening to this full description of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , [Anne]89-anne could not but express some surprise at [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s having spoken of [him]98-mr elliot so favourably in the beginning of [their]1442-their conversation . “ [She]181-mrs smith had seemed to recommend and praise [him]98-mr elliot ! ”[181-mrs smith] “ [[My]181-mrs smith dear]351-my dear , ”[181-mrs smith] was [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s reply , “ there was nothing else to be done . [I]181-mrs smith considered [your]351-my dear marrying [him]98-mr elliot as certain , though [he]98-mr elliot might not yet have made the offer , and [I]181-mrs smith could no more speak the truth of [him]98-mr elliot , than if [he]98-mr elliot had been [[your]351-my dear husband]506-your husband . [My]181-mrs smith heart bled for [you]351-my dear , as [I]181-mrs smith talked of happiness ; and yet [he]98-mr elliot is sensible , [he]98-mr elliot is agreeable , and with [such a woman as [you]351-my dear]3344-such a woman as you , it was not absolutely hopeless . [He]98-mr elliot was very unkind to [[his]98-mr elliot first wife]3345-his first wife . [They]3346-they were wretched together . But [she]3345-his first wife was too ignorant and giddy for respect , and [he]98-mr elliot had never loved [her]3345-his first wife . [I]181-mrs smith was willing to hope that [you]351-my dear must fare better . ”[181-mrs smith] [Anne]89-anne could just acknowledge within [herself]89-anne such a possibility of having been induced to marry [him]1443-him , as made [her]89-anne shudder at the idea of the misery which must have followed . It was just possible that [she]89-anne might have been persuaded by [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ! And under such a supposition , which would have been most miserable , when time had disclosed all , too late ? It was very desirable that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell should be no longer deceived ; and one of the concluding arrangements of this important conference , which carried [them]1444-them through the greater part of the morning , was , that [Anne]89-anne had full liberty to communicate to [[her]89-anne friend]2014-her friend everything relative to [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , in which [his]1443-him conduct was involved . CHAPTER XXII . [Anne]89-anne went [home]1756-home to think over all that [she]89-anne had heard . In one point , [her]89-anne feelings were relieved by this knowledge of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . There was no longer anything of tenderness due to [him]1443-him . [He]1443-him stood as opposed to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , in all [his]1443-him own unwelcome obtrusiveness ; and the evil of [his]1443-him attentions last night , the irremediable mischief [he]1443-him might have done , was considered with sensations unqualified , unperplexed . Pity for [him]1443-him was all over . But this was the only point of relief . In every other respect , in looking around [her]89-anne , or penetrating forward , [she]89-anne saw more to distrust and to apprehend . [She]89-anne was concerned for the disappointment and pain [Lady Russell]97-lady russell would be feeling ; for the mortifications which must be hanging over [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister , and had all the distress of foreseeing many evils , without knowing how to avert any one of them . [She]89-anne was most thankful for [her]89-anne own knowledge of [him]1443-him . [She]89-anne had never considered [herself]89-anne as entitled to reward for not slighting [an old friend]2145-an old friend like [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , but here was a reward indeed springing from it ! [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith had been able to tell [her]89-anne what [no one else]968-no one else could have done . Could the knowledge have been extended through [[her]89-anne family]636-her family ? But this was a vain idea . [She]89-anne must talk to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , tell [her]97-lady russell , consult with [her]97-lady russell , and having done [her]89-anne best , wait the event with as much composure as possible ; and after all , [her]89-anne greatest want of composure would be in that quarter of the mind which could not be opened to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ; in that flow of anxieties and fears which must be all to [herself]89-anne . [She]89-anne found , on reaching [home]1756-home , that [she]89-anne had , as [she]89-anne intended , escaped seeing [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; that [he]98-mr elliot had called and paid [them]1453-them a long morning visit ; but hardly had [she]89-anne congratulated [herself]89-anne , and felt safe , when [she]89-anne heard that [he]98-mr elliot was coming again in the evening . “ [I]87-elizabeth had not the smallest intention of asking [him]98-mr elliot , ”[87-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , with affected carelessness , “ but [he]98-mr elliot gave so many hints ; so [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay says , at least . ”[87-elizabeth] “ Indeed , [I]87-elizabeth do say it . [I]87-elizabeth never saw [anybody]462-anybody in [my]87-elizabeth life spell harder for an invitation . [Poor man]3348-poor man ! [I]87-elizabeth was really in pain for [him]98-mr elliot ; for [[your]101-mrs clay hard - hearted sister]3349-your hard - hearted sister , [Miss Anne]89-anne , seems bent on cruelty . ”[87-elizabeth] “ Oh ! ”[87-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , “ [I]87-elizabeth have been rather too much used to the game to be soon overcome by [a gentleman]1842-a gentleman ’s hints . However , when [I]87-elizabeth found how excessively [he]98-mr elliot was regretting that [he]98-mr elliot should miss [[my]87-elizabeth father]275-my father this morning , [I]87-elizabeth gave way immediately , for [I]87-elizabeth would never really omit an opportunity of bringing [him]98-mr elliot and [Sir Walter]86-sir walter together . [They]3352-they appear to so much advantage in company with [each other]1959-each other . [Each]3354-each behaving so pleasantly . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot looking up with so much respect . ”[87-elizabeth] “ Quite delightful ! ”[101-mrs clay] cried [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , not daring , however , to turn [her]101-mrs clay eyes towards [Anne]89-anne . “ Exactly like [father]1739-father and [son]3356-son ! [Dear Miss Elliot]89-anne , may [I]101-mrs clay not say [father]1739-father and [son]3356-son ? ”[101-mrs clay] “ Oh ! [I]87-elizabeth lay no embargo on any body ’s words . If [you]89-anne will have such ideas ! But , upon [my]87-elizabeth word , [I]87-elizabeth am scarcely sensible of [his]98-mr elliot attentions being beyond those of [other men]3274-other men . ”[87-elizabeth] “ [[My]101-mrs clay dear]351-my dear [Miss Elliot]89-anne ! ”[101-mrs clay] exclaimed [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , lifting [her]101-mrs clay hands and eyes , and sinking all the rest of [her]101-mrs clay astonishment in a convenient silence . “ Well , [[my]101-mrs clay dear]351-my dear [Penelope]108-penelope , [you]108-penelope need not be so alarmed about [him]98-mr elliot . [I]101-mrs clay did invite [him]98-mr elliot , [you]108-penelope know . [I]101-mrs clay sent [him]98-mr elliot away with smiles . When [I]101-mrs clay found [he]98-mr elliot was really going to [[his]98-mr elliot friends]1830-his friends at [Thornberry Park]79-thornberry park for the whole day to - morrow , [I]101-mrs clay had compassion on [him]98-mr elliot . ”[101-mrs clay] [Anne]89-anne admired the good acting of [the friend]1454-the friend , in being able to shew such pleasure as [she]89-anne did , in the expectation and in the actual arrival of [the very person whose presence must really be interfering with [her]89-anne prime object]1455-the very person whose presence must really be interfering with her prime object . It was impossible but that [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay must hate the sight of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ; and yet [she]101-mrs clay could assume a most obliging , placid look , and appear quite satisfied with the curtailed license of devoting [herself]101-mrs clay only half as much to [Sir Walter]86-sir walter as [she]101-mrs clay would have done otherwise . To [Anne]89-anne [herself]89-anne it was most distressing to see [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot enter [the room]1874-the room ; and quite painful to have [him]98-mr elliot approach and speak to [her]89-anne . [She]89-anne had been used before to feel that [he]98-mr elliot could not be always quite sincere , but now [she]89-anne saw insincerity in everything . [His]98-mr elliot attentive deference to [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father , contrasted with [his]98-mr elliot former language , was odious ; and when [she]89-anne thought of [his]98-mr elliot cruel conduct towards [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , [she]89-anne could hardly bear the sight of [his]98-mr elliot present smiles and mildness , or the sound of [his]98-mr elliot artificial good sentiments . [She]89-anne meant to avoid any such alteration of manners as might provoke a remonstrance on [his]98-mr elliot side . It was a great object to [her]89-anne to escape all enquiry or eclat ; but it was [her]89-anne intention to be as decidedly cool to [him]98-mr elliot as might be compatible with [their]1458-their relationship ; and to retrace , as quietly as [she]89-anne could , the few steps of unnecessary intimacy [she]89-anne had been gradually led along . [She]89-anne was accordingly more guarded , and more cool , than [she]89-anne had been the night before . [He]98-mr elliot wanted to animate [her]89-anne curiosity again as to how and where [he]98-mr elliot could have heard [her]89-anne formerly praised ; wanted very much to be gratified by more solicitation ; but the charm was broken : [he]98-mr elliot found that the heat and animation of [a public room]1459-a public room was necessary to kindle [[his]98-mr elliot modest cousin]1460-his modest cousin ’s vanity ; [he]98-mr elliot found , at least , that it was not to be done now , by any of those attempts which [he]98-mr elliot could hazard among the too - commanding claims of [the others]1828-the others . [He]98-mr elliot little surmised that it was a subject acting now exactly against [his]98-mr elliot interest , bringing immediately to [her]89-anne thoughts all those parts of [his]98-mr elliot conduct which were least excusable . [She]89-anne had some satisfaction in finding that [he]98-mr elliot was really going out of [Bath]9-bath the next morning , going early , and that [he]98-mr elliot would be gone the greater part of two days . [He]98-mr elliot was invited again to [Camden Place]53-camden place the very evening of [his]98-mr elliot return ; but from Thursday to Saturday evening [his]98-mr elliot absence was certain . It was bad enough that [a Mrs Clay]1462-a mrs clay should be always before [her]89-anne ; but that [a deeper hypocrite]1463-a deeper hypocrite should be added to [[their]1464-their party]2710-their party , seemed the destruction of everything like peace and comfort . It was so humiliating to reflect on the constant deception practised on [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ; to consider the various sources of mortification preparing for [them]1464-their ! [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ’s selfishness was not so complicate nor so revolting as [his]98-mr elliot ; and [Anne]89-anne would have compounded for the marriage at once , with all its evils , to be clear of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s subtleties in endeavouring to prevent it . On Friday morning [she]101-mrs clay meant to go very early to [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , and accomplish the necessary communication ; and [she]101-mrs clay would have gone directly after breakfast , but that [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay was also going out on some obliging purpose of saving [[her]101-mrs clay sister]1946-her sister trouble , which determined [her]101-mrs clay to wait till [she]101-mrs clay might be safe from [such a companion]1468-such a companion . [She]87-elizabeth saw [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay fairly off , therefore , before [she]101-mrs clay began to talk of spending the morning in [Rivers Street]56-rivers street . “ Very well , ”[87-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth , “ [I]87-elizabeth have nothing to send but [[my]87-elizabeth love]496-my love . Oh ! [you]3364-you may as well take back that tiresome book [she]97-lady russell would lend [me]87-elizabeth , and pretend [I]87-elizabeth have read it through . [I]87-elizabeth really can not be plaguing [myself]87-elizabeth for ever with all the new poems and states of [the nation]1921-the nation that come out . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell quite bores one with [her]97-lady russell new publications . [You]3364-you need not tell [her]97-lady russell so , but [I]87-elizabeth thought [her]97-lady russell dress hideous the other night . [I]87-elizabeth used to think [she]97-lady russell had some taste in dress , but [I]87-elizabeth was ashamed of [her]97-lady russell at the concert . Something so formal and arrangé in [her]97-lady russell air ! and [she]97-lady russell sits so upright ! [[My]87-elizabeth best love]3366-my best love , of course . ”[87-elizabeth] “ And [mine]86-sir walter , ”[86-sir walter] added [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . “ Kindest regards . And [you]3364-you may say , that [I]86-sir walter mean to call upon [her]97-lady russell soon . Make a civil message ; but [I]86-sir walter shall only leave [my]86-sir walter card . Morning visits are never fair by [women]542-women at [her]97-lady russell time of life , who make [themselves]542-women up so little . If [she]97-lady russell would only wear rouge [she]97-lady russell would not be afraid of being seen ; but last time [I]86-sir walter called , [I]86-sir walter observed the blinds were let down immediately . ”[86-sir walter] While [[her]1469-her father]1745-her father spoke , there was a knock at the door . Who could it be ? [Anne]89-anne , remembering the preconcerted visits , at all hours , of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , would have expected [him]98-mr elliot , but for [his]98-mr elliot known engagement seven miles off . After the usual period of suspense , the usual sounds of approach were heard , and “ [Mr]3368-mr and [Mrs Charles Musgrove]92-charles ”[89-anne] were ushered into [the room]1874-the room . Surprise was the strongest emotion raised by [their]1472-their appearance ; but [Anne]89-anne was really glad to see [them]1472-their ; and [the others]1828-the others were not so sorry but that [they]1828-the others could put on a decent air of welcome ; and as soon as it became clear that these , [[their]1472-their nearest relations]1474-their nearest relations , were not arrived with any views of accommodation in [that house]1913-that house , [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were able to rise in cordiality , and do the honours of it very well . [They]1472-their were come to [Bath]9-bath for a few days with [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles , and were at [the White Hart]80-the white hart . So much was pretty soon understood ; but till [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were walking [Mary]90-mary into [the other drawing - room]1476-the other drawing - room , and regaling [themselves]1472-their with [her]90-mary admiration , [Anne]89-anne could not draw upon [Charles]92-charles ’s brain for a regular history of [their]1472-their coming , or an explanation of some smiling hints of particular business , which had been ostentatiously dropped by [Mary]90-mary , as well as of some apparent confusion as to whom [their]1472-their party consisted of . [She]89-anne then found that it consisted of [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles , [Henrietta]117-henrietta , and [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , beside [[their]1472-their two selves]1477-their two selves . [He]151-captain harville gave [her]89-anne a very plain , intelligible account of the whole ; a narration in which [she]89-anne saw a great deal of most characteristic proceeding . The scheme had received its first impulse by [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ’s wanting to come to [Bath]9-bath on business . [He]151-captain harville had begun to talk of it a week ago ; and by way of doing something , as shooting was over , [Charles]92-charles had proposed coming with [him]151-captain harville , and [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville had seemed to like the idea of it very much , as an advantage to [[her]134-mrs harville husband]347-her husband ; but [Mary]90-mary could not bear to be left , and had made [herself]90-mary so unhappy about it , that for a day or two everything seemed to be in suspense , or at an end . But then , it had been taken up by [[his]151-captain harville father]312-his father and [mother]1943-mother . [[His]151-captain harville mother]1481-his mother had [some old friends in [Bath]9-bath whom [she]1481-his mother wanted to see]1482-some old friends in bath whom she wanted to see ; it was thought a good opportunity for [Henrietta]117-henrietta to come and buy wedding - clothes for [herself]1481-his mother and [[her]1481-his mother sister]1946-her sister ; and , in short , it ended in being [[his]151-captain harville mother]1481-his mother ’s party , that everything might be comfortable and easy to [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ; and [he]151-captain harville and [Mary]90-mary were included in it by way of general convenience . [They]1485-they had arrived late the night before . [Mrs Harville]134-mrs harville , [[her]134-mrs harville children]1713-her children , and [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , remained with [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove and [Louisa]118-louisa at [Uppercross]3-uppercross . [Anne]89-anne ’s only surprise was , that affairs should be in forwardness enough for [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s wedding - clothes to be talked of . [She]89-anne had imagined such difficulties of fortune to exist there as must prevent the marriage from being near at hand ; but [she]89-anne learned from [Charles]92-charles that , very recently , ( since [Mary]90-mary ’s last letter to [herself]90-mary ) , [Charles Hayter]91-charles had been applied to by [a friend]2797-a friend to hold a living for [a youth who could not possibly claim it under many years]1488-a youth who could not possibly claim it under many years ; and that on the strength of [his]91-charles present income , with almost a certainty of something more permanent long before the term in question , [the two families]2033-the two families had consented to [the young people]2052-the young people ’s wishes , and that [their]2033-the two families marriage was likely to take place in a few months , quite as soon as [Louisa]118-louisa ’s . “ And a very good living it was , ”[91-charles] [Charles]91-charles added : “ only five - and - twenty miles from [Uppercross]3-uppercross , and in [a very fine country]3369-a very fine country : [fine part of [Dorsetshire]81-dorsetshire]3370-fine part of dorsetshire . In the centre of [some of the best preserves in [the kingdom]3372-the kingdom]3371-some of the best preserves in the kingdom , surrounded by [three great proprietors]3373-three great proprietors , [each more careful and jealous than the other]3374-each more careful and jealous than the other ; and to two of the three at least , [Charles Hayter]91-charles might get a special recommendation . Not that [he]91-charles will value it as [he]91-charles ought , ”[91-charles] [he]91-charles observed , “ [Charles]91-charles is too cool about sporting . That ’s the worst of [him]91-charles . ”[91-charles] “ [I]89-anne am extremely glad , indeed , ”[89-anne] cried [Anne]89-anne , “ particularly glad that this should happen ; and that of [two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends]3375-two sisters , who both deserve equally well , and who have always been such good friends , the pleasant prospect of one should not be dimming those of the other — that [they]2033-the two families should be so equal in [their]2033-the two families prosperity and comfort . [I]89-anne hope [[your]89-anne father]240-your father and [mother]1943-mother are quite happy with regard to both . ”[89-anne] “ Oh ! yes . [[My]91-charles father]275-my father would be well pleased if [the gentlemen]1985-the gentlemen were richer , but [he]275-my father has no other fault to find . Money , [you]89-anne know , coming down with money — [two daughters]3380-two daughters at once — it can not be a very agreeable operation , and it streightens [him]275-my father as to many things . However , [I]91-charles do not mean to say [they]2033-the two families have not a right to it . It is very fit [they]2033-the two families should have [daughters]3381-daughters ’ shares ; and [I]91-charles am sure [he]275-my father has always been [a very kind , liberal father to [me]91-charles]3382-a very kind , liberal father to me . [Mary]90-mary does not above half like [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s match . [She]90-mary never did , [you]89-anne know . But [she]90-mary does not do [him]275-my father justice , nor think enough about [Winthrop]40-winthrop . [I]91-charles can not make [her]90-mary attend to the value of [the property]3383-the property . It is a very fair match , as times go ; and [I]91-charles have liked [Charles Hayter]91-charles all [my]91-charles life , and [I]91-charles shall not leave off now . ”[91-charles] “ [Such excellent parents as [Mr]3385-mr and [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles]3384-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove , ”[89-anne] exclaimed [Anne]89-anne , “ should be happy in [[their]3384-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove children]2055-their children ’s marriages . [They]3384-such excellent parents as mr and mrs musgrove do everything to confer happiness , [I]1491-i am sure . What a blessing to [young people]3387-young people to be in such hands ! [[Your]89-anne father]240-your father and [mother]1943-mother seem so totally free from all those ambitious feelings which have led to so much misconduct and misery , both in young and old . [I]1491-i hope [you]89-anne think [Louisa]118-louisa perfectly recovered now ? ”[1491-i] [He]1491-i answered rather hesitatingly , “ Yes , [I]1491-i believe [I]1491-i do ; very much recovered ; but [she]118-louisa is altered ; there is no running or jumping about , no laughing or dancing ; it is quite different . If [one]1726-one happens only to shut the door a little hard , [she]118-louisa starts and wriggles like a young dab - chick in the water ; and [Benwick]153-captain benwick sits at [her]118-louisa elbow , reading verses , or whispering to [her]118-louisa , all day long . ”[1491-i] [Anne]89-anne could not help laughing . “ That can not be much to [your]1491-i taste , [I]89-anne know , ”[89-anne] said [she]89-anne ; “ but [I]89-anne do believe [him]153-captain benwick to be [an excellent young man]2579-an excellent young man . ”[89-anne] “ To be sure [he]153-captain benwick is . [Nobody]271-nobody doubts it ; and [I]1491-i hope [you]1491-i do not think [I]1491-i am so illiberal as to want [every man]1314-every man to have the same objects and pleasures as [myself]1491-i . [I]1491-i have a great value for [Benwick]153-captain benwick ; and when one can but get [him]153-captain benwick to talk , [he]153-captain benwick has plenty to say . [His]153-captain benwick reading has done [him]153-captain benwick no harm , for [he]153-captain benwick has fought as well as read . [He]153-captain benwick is [a brave fellow]3394-a brave fellow . [I]1491-i got more acquainted with [him]153-captain benwick last Monday than ever [I]1491-i did before . [We]1492-they had a famous set - to at rat - hunting all the morning in [[[my]1491-i father]275-my father ’s great barns]3396-my father ’s great barns ; and [he]153-captain benwick played [his]153-captain benwick part so well that [I]1491-i have liked [him]153-captain benwick the better ever since . ”[1491-i] Here [they]1492-they were interrupted by the absolute necessity of [Charles]91-charles ’s following [the others]1828-the others to admire mirrors and china ; but [Anne]89-anne had heard enough to understand the present state of [Uppercross]3-uppercross , and rejoice in its happiness ; and though [she]89-anne sighed as [she]89-anne rejoiced , [her]89-anne sigh had none of the ill - will of envy in it . [She]89-anne would certainly have risen to [their]1492-they blessings if [she]89-anne could , but [she]89-anne did not want to lessen [theirs]1492-they . The visit passed off altogether in high good humour . [Mary]90-mary was in excellent spirits , enjoying the gaiety and the change , and so well satisfied with the journey in [[her]90-mary mother - in - law]1494-her mother - in - law ’s carriage with four horses , and with [her]90-mary own complete independence of [Camden Place]53-camden place , that [she]90-mary was exactly in a temper to admire everything as [she]90-mary ought , and enter most readily into all the superiorities of [the house]1780-the house , as [they]1492-they were detailed to [her]90-mary . [She]90-mary had no demands on [[her]90-mary father]1745-her father or [sister]1740-sister , and [her]90-mary consequence was just enough increased by [[their]1492-they handsome drawing - rooms]1498-their handsome drawing - rooms . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was , for a short time , suffering a good deal . [She]87-elizabeth felt that [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles and [all [her]87-elizabeth party]1499-all her party ought to be asked to dine with [them]1492-they ; but [she]87-elizabeth could not bear to have the difference of style , the reduction of [servants]253-servants , which a dinner must betray , witnessed by [those who had been always so inferior to [the Elliots of [Kellynch]5-kellynch]1502-the elliots of kellynch]1501-those who had been always so inferior to the elliots of kellynch . It was a struggle between propriety and vanity ; but vanity got the better , and then [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was happy again . These were [her]87-elizabeth internal persuasions : “ Old fashioned notions ; country hospitality ; [we]3397-we do not profess to give dinners ; [few people in Bath]3398-few people in bath do ; [Lady Alicia]197-lady alicia never does ; did not even ask [[[her]197-lady alicia own sister]1978-her own sister ’s family]3400-her own sister ’s family , though [they]1492-they were here a month : and [I]87-elizabeth dare say it would be very inconvenient to [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles ; put [her]92-charles quite out of [her]92-charles way . [I]87-elizabeth am sure [she]92-charles would rather not come ; [she]92-charles can not feel easy with [us]3397-we . [I]87-elizabeth will ask [them]1492-they all for an evening ; that will be much better ; that will be a novelty and a treat . [They]1492-they have not seen [two such drawing rooms]3401-two such drawing rooms before . [They]1492-they will be delighted to come to - morrow evening . It shall be a regular party , small , but most elegant . ”[87-elizabeth] And this satisfied [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth : and when the invitation was given to [the two present]1503-the two present , and promised for the absent , [Mary]90-mary was as completely satisfied . [She]90-mary was particularly asked to meet [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , and be introduced to [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret , who were fortunately already engaged to come ; and [she]90-mary could not have received a more gratifying attention . [Miss Elliot]89-anne was to have the honour of calling on [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles in the course of the morning ; and [Anne]89-anne walked off with [Charles]92-charles and [Mary]90-mary , to go and see [her]90-mary and [Henrietta]117-henrietta directly . [Her]89-anne plan of sitting with [Lady Russell]97-lady russell must give way for the present . [They]1504-they all three called in [Rivers Street]56-rivers street for a couple of minutes ; but [Anne]89-anne convinced [herself]89-anne that a day ’s delay of the intended communication could be of no consequence , and hastened forward to [the White Hart]80-the white hart , to see again [the friends]1505-the friends and [companions of the last autumn]1506-companions of the last autumn , with an eagerness of good - will which many associations contributed to form . [They]1504-they found [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles and [[her]92-charles daughter]3044-her daughter within , and by [themselves]1504-they , and [Anne]89-anne had the kindest welcome from each . [Henrietta]117-henrietta was exactly in that state of recently - improved views , of fresh - formed happiness , which made [her]117-henrietta full of regard and interest for [[everybody]2119-everybody [she]117-henrietta had ever liked before at all]1509-everybody she had ever liked before at all ; and [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles ’s real affection had been won by [her]117-henrietta usefulness when [they]1504-they were in distress . It was a heartiness , and a warmth , and a sincerity which [Anne]89-anne delighted in the more , from the sad want of such blessings at [home]1756-home . [She]117-henrietta was entreated to give [them]1504-they as much of [her]117-henrietta time as possible , invited for every day and all day long , or rather claimed as part of [the family]1782-the family ; and , in return , [she]117-henrietta naturally fell into all [her]117-henrietta wonted ways of attention and assistance , and on [Charles]92-charles ’s leaving [them]1504-they together , was listening to [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles ’s history of [Louisa]118-louisa , and to [Henrietta]117-henrietta ’s of [herself]117-henrietta , giving opinions on business , and recommendations to [shops]1512-shops ; with intervals of every help which [Mary]90-mary required , from altering [her]90-mary ribbon to settling [her]90-mary accounts ; from finding [her]90-mary keys , and assorting [her]90-mary trinkets , to trying to convince [her]90-mary that [she]90-mary was not ill - used by [anybody]462-anybody ; which [Mary]90-mary , well amused as [she]90-mary generally was , in [her]90-mary station at a window overlooking the entrance to [the Pump Room]1514-the pump room , could not but have [her]90-mary moments of imagining . A morning of thorough confusion was to be expected . A large party in [an hotel]1515-an hotel ensured a quick - changing , unsettled scene . One five minutes brought a note , the next a parcel ; and [Anne]89-anne had not been [there]1845-there half an hour , when [[their]1517-their dining - room]2667-their dining - room , spacious as [it]2667-their dining - room was , seemed more than half filled : [a party of [steady old friends]1520-steady old friends]1519-a party of steady old friends were seated around [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles , and [Charles]92-charles came back with [Captains Harville]216-captains harville and [Wentworth]110-mr wentworth . The appearance of [the latter]2295-the latter could not be more than the surprise of the moment . It was impossible for [her]89-anne to have forgotten to feel that this arrival of [[their]1517-their common friends]1522-their common friends must be soon bringing [them]1517-their together again . [Their]1517-their last meeting had been most important in opening [his]1523-his feelings ; [she]89-anne had derived from it a delightful conviction ; but [she]89-anne feared from [his]1523-his looks , that the same unfortunate persuasion , which had hastened [him]1523-his away from [the Concert Room]3238-the concert room , still governed . [He]1523-his did not seem to want to be near enough for conversation . [She]89-anne tried to be calm , and leave things to take their course , and tried to dwell much on this argument of rational dependence:—“Surely , if there be constant attachment on each side , [our]1517-their hearts must understand each other ere long . [We]1517-their are not [boy]3402-boy and [girl]3403-girl , to be captiously irritable , misled by every moment ’s inadvertence , and wantonly playing with [our]1517-their own happiness . ”[89-anne] And yet , a few minutes afterwards , [she]89-anne felt as if [their]1517-their being in company with [each other]1959-each other , under [their]1517-their present circumstances , could only be exposing [them]1517-their to inadvertencies and misconstructions of the most mischievous kind . “ [Anne]89-anne , ”[90-mary] cried [Mary]90-mary , still at [her]90-mary window , “ there is [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , [I]90-mary am sure , standing under the colonnade , and [a gentleman with [her]101-mrs clay]3404-a gentleman with her . [I]90-mary saw [them]1517-their turn the corner from [Bath Street]83-bath street just now . [They]1517-their seemed deep in talk . Who is it ? Come , and tell [me]90-mary . Good heavens ! [I]90-mary recollect . It is [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot [himself]98-mr elliot . ”[90-mary] “ No , ”[89-anne] cried [Anne]89-anne , quickly , “ it can not be [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , [I]89-anne assure [you]89-anne . [He]98-mr elliot was to leave [Bath]9-bath at nine this morning , and does not come back till to - morrow . ”[89-anne] As [she]89-anne spoke , [she]89-anne felt that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was looking at [her]89-anne , the consciousness of which vexed and embarrassed [her]89-anne , and made [her]89-anne regret that [she]89-anne had said so much , simple as it was . [Mary]90-mary , resenting that [she]90-mary should be supposed not to know [[her]90-mary own cousin]1526-her own cousin , began talking very warmly about [the family features]1527-the family features , and protesting still more positively that it was [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , calling again upon [Anne]89-anne to come and look for [herself]89-anne , but [Anne]89-anne did not mean to stir , and tried to be cool and unconcerned . [Her]89-anne distress returned , however , on perceiving smiles and intelligent glances pass between [two or three of [the lady visitors]1529-the lady visitors]1528-two or three of the lady visitors , as if [they]1528-two or three of the lady visitors believed [themselves]1528-two or three of the lady visitors quite in the secret . It was evident that the report concerning [her]89-anne had spread , and a short pause succeeded , which seemed to ensure that it would now spread farther . “ Do come , [Anne]89-anne , ”[90-mary] cried [Mary]90-mary , “ come and look [yourself]89-anne . [You]89-anne seem to have forgot all about [Lyme]43-lyme . ”[90-mary] To pacify [Mary]90-mary , and perhaps screen [her]89-anne own embarrassment , [Anne]89-anne did move quietly to the window . [She]89-anne was just in time to ascertain that it really was [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , which [she]89-anne had never believed , before [he]98-mr elliot disappeared on one side , as [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay walked quickly off on the other ; and checking the surprise which [she]89-anne could not but feel at such an appearance of friendly conference between [two persons of totally opposite interest]1530-two persons of totally opposite interest , [she]89-anne calmly said , “ Yes , it is [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , certainly . [The visitors]1531-the visitors took [their]1531-the visitors leave ; and [Charles]92-charles , having civilly seen [them]1531-the visitors off , and then made a face at [them]1531-the visitors , and abused [them]1531-the visitors for coming , began with — “ Well , [mother]1943-mother , [I]92-charles have done something for [you]1943-mother that [you]1943-mother will like . [Anne]89-anne will not be sorry to join [us]3408-we , [I]92-charles am sure . [We]3408-we all like a play . Have not [I]92-charles done well , [mother]1943-mother ? ”[92-charles] [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles was good humouredly beginning to express [her]92-charles perfect readiness for the play , if [Henrietta]117-henrietta and all [the others]1828-the others liked it , when [Mary]90-mary eagerly interrupted [her]92-charles by exclaiming — “ Good heavens , [Charles]92-charles ! how can [you]92-charles think of such a thing ? Have [you]92-charles forgot that [we]3408-we are engaged to [Camden Place]53-camden place to - morrow night ? and that [we]3408-we were most particularly asked to meet [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [[her]179-lady dalrymple daughter]3044-her daughter , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , and [all the principal family connexions]3411-all the principal family connexions , on purpose to be introduced to [them]3411-all the principal family connexions ? [You]92-charles may do as [you]92-charles like , but [I]92-charles shall go to the play . ”[92-charles] “ Oh ! [I]90-mary only smirked and bowed , and said the word ‘ happy . ’ There was no promise . ”[90-mary] “ But [you]92-charles must go , [Charles]92-charles . It would be unpardonable to fail . [We]3408-we were asked on purpose to be introduced . There was always such a great connexion between [the Dalrymples]177-the dalrymples and [ourselves]3408-we . Nothing ever happened on either side that was not announced immediately . [We]3408-we are quite near relations , [you]92-charles know ; and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot too , whom [you]92-charles ought so particularly to be acquainted with ! Every attention is due to [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot . Consider , [[[my]90-mary father]275-my father ’s heir]3414-my father ’s heir : [the future representative of [the family]1782-the family]3415-the future representative of the family . ”[90-mary] “ Do n’t talk to [me]92-charles about [heirs]3417-heirs and [representatives]3418-representatives , ”[92-charles] cried [Charles]92-charles . “ [I]92-charles am [not one of those who neglect the reigning power to bow to the rising sun . If [I]92-charles would not go for the sake of [[your]92-charles father]240-your father , [I]92-charles should think it scandalous to go for the sake of [[his]240-your father heir]2207-his heir]3419-not one of those who neglect the reigning power to bow to the rising sun . if i would not go for the sake of your father , i should think it scandalous to go for the sake of his heir . What is [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot to [me]92-charles ? ”[92-charles] The careless expression was life to [Anne]89-anne , who saw that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was all attention , looking and listening with [his]112-captain wentworth whole soul ; and that the last words brought [his]112-captain wentworth enquiring eyes from [Charles]92-charles to [herself]92-charles . [Charles]92-charles and [Mary]90-mary still talked on in the same style ; [he]112-captain wentworth , half serious and half jesting , maintaining the scheme for the play , and [she]92-charles , invariably serious , most warmly opposing it , and not omitting to make it known that , however determined to go to [Camden Place]53-camden place [herself]92-charles , [she]92-charles should not think [herself]92-charles very well used , if [they]1533-we went to the play without [her]92-charles . [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles interposed . “ [We]1533-we had better put it off . [Charles]92-charles , [you]92-charles had much better go back and change the box for Tuesday . It would be a pity to be divided , and [we]1533-we should be losing [Miss Anne]89-anne , too , if there is a party at [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s ; and [I]92-charles am sure neither [Henrietta]117-henrietta nor [I]92-charles should care at all for the play , if [Miss Anne]89-anne could not be with [us]1533-we . ”[92-charles] [Anne]89-anne felt truly obliged to [her]89-anne for such kindness ; and quite as much so for the opportunity it gave [her]89-anne of decidedly saying — “ If it depended only on [my]89-anne inclination , [ma’am]648-ma’am , the party at [home]1756-home ( excepting on [Mary]90-mary ’s account ) would not be the smallest impediment . [I]89-anne have no pleasure in the sort of meeting , and should be too happy to change it for a play , and with [you]89-anne . But , it had better not be attempted , perhaps . ”[89-anne] [She]89-anne had spoken it ; but [she]89-anne trembled when it was done , conscious that [her]89-anne words were listened to , and daring not even to try to observe their effect . It was soon generally agreed that [Tuesday]218-tuesday should be the day ; [Charles]92-charles only reserving the advantage of still teasing [[his]1534-his wife]1699-his wife , by persisting that [he]1534-his would go to the play to - morrow if [nobody else]1827-nobody else would . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth left [his]112-captain wentworth seat , and walked to [the fire - place]1537-the fire - place ; probably for the sake of walking away from [it]1537-the fire - place soon afterwards , and taking [a station]1538-a station , with less bare - faced design , by [Anne]89-anne . “ [You]89-anne have not been long enough in [Bath]9-bath , ”[112-captain wentworth] said [he]112-captain wentworth , “ to enjoy the evening parties of [the place]913-the place . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ Oh ! no . The usual character of [them]3426-them has nothing for [me]112-captain wentworth . [I]112-captain wentworth am [no card - player]3427-no card - player . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ [You]89-anne were not formerly , [I]112-captain wentworth know . [You]89-anne did not use to like cards ; but time makes many changes . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ [I]89-anne am not yet so much changed , ”[89-anne] cried [Anne]89-anne , and stopped , fearing [she]89-anne hardly knew what misconstruction . After waiting a few moments [he]112-captain wentworth said , and as if it were the result of immediate feeling , “ It is a period , indeed ! Eight years and a half is a period . ”[112-captain wentworth] Whether [he]112-captain wentworth would have proceeded farther was left to [Anne]89-anne ’s imagination to ponder over in a calmer hour ; for while still hearing the sounds [he]112-captain wentworth had uttered , [she]89-anne was startled to other subjects by [Henrietta]117-henrietta , eager to make use of the present leisure for getting out , and calling on [[her]117-henrietta companions]2502-her companions to lose no time , lest [somebody else]1221-somebody else should come in . [They]2502-her companions were obliged to move . [Anne]89-anne talked of being perfectly ready , and tried to look it ; but [she]89-anne felt that could [Henrietta]117-henrietta have known the regret and reluctance of [her]117-henrietta heart in quitting that chair , in preparing to quit [the room]1874-the room , [she]89-anne would have found , in all [her]89-anne own sensations for [[her]89-anne cousin]620-her cousin , in the very security of [his]112-captain wentworth affection , wherewith to pity [her]89-anne . [Their]2502-her companions preparations , however , were stopped short . Alarming sounds were heard ; [other visitors]1543-other visitors approached , and the door was thrown open for [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Miss Elliot]89-anne , whose entrance seemed to give a general chill . [Anne]89-anne felt an instant oppression , and wherever [she]89-anne looked saw symptoms of the same . The comfort , the freedom , the gaiety of [the room]1874-the room was over , hushed into cold composure , determined silence , or insipid talk , to meet the heartless elegance of [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister . How mortifying to feel that it was so ! [Her]89-anne jealous eye was satisfied in one particular . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was acknowledged again by [each]3354-each , by [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth more graciously than before . [She]87-elizabeth even addressed [him]112-captain wentworth once , and looked at [him]112-captain wentworth more than once . [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth was , in fact , revolving a great measure . [The sequel]1548-the sequel explained it . After the waste of a few minutes in saying the proper nothings , [she]87-elizabeth began to give the invitation which was to comprise all the remaining dues of [the Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves . “ To - morrow evening , to meet [a few friends]3428-a few friends : no formal party . ”[87-elizabeth] It was all said very gracefully , and the cards with which [she]87-elizabeth had provided [herself]87-elizabeth , the “ [Miss Elliot]89-anne at [home]1756-home , ”[87-elizabeth] were laid on the table , with a courteous , comprehensive smile to all , and one smile and one card more decidedly for [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . The truth was , that [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth had been long enough in [Bath]9-bath to understand the importance of [a man of such an air and appearance]1549-a man of such an air and appearance as [his]112-captain wentworth . The past was nothing . The present was that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth would move about well in [[her]87-elizabeth drawing - room]1550-her drawing - room . The card was pointedly given , and [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth arose and disappeared . The interruption had been short , though severe , and ease and animation returned to most of those [they]1551-they left as the door shut [them]1551-they out , but not to [Anne]89-anne . [She]89-anne could think only of the invitation [she]89-anne had with such astonishment witnessed , and of the manner in which it had been received ; a manner of doubtful meaning , of surprise rather than gratification , of polite acknowledgement rather than acceptance . [She]89-anne knew [him]112-captain wentworth ; [she]89-anne saw disdain in [his]112-captain wentworth eye , and could not venture to believe that [he]112-captain wentworth had determined to accept such an offering , as an atonement for all the insolence of the past . [Her]89-anne spirits sank . [He]112-captain wentworth held the card in [his]112-captain wentworth hand after [they]1551-they were gone , as if deeply considering it . “ Only think of [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth ’s including [everybody]2119-everybody ! ”[90-mary] whispered [Mary]90-mary very audibly . “ [I]90-mary do not wonder [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth is delighted ! [You]89-anne see [he]112-captain wentworth can not put the card out of [his]112-captain wentworth hand . ”[90-mary] [Anne]89-anne caught [his]112-captain wentworth eye , saw [his]112-captain wentworth cheeks glow , and [his]112-captain wentworth mouth form itself into a momentary expression of contempt , and turned away , that [she]89-anne might neither see nor hear more to vex [her]89-anne . [The party]2010-the party separated . [The gentlemen]1985-the gentlemen had [their]1985-the gentlemen own pursuits , [the ladies]2623-the ladies proceeded on [their]2623-the ladies own business , and [they]2623-the ladies met no more while [Anne]89-anne belonged to [them]2623-the ladies . [She]89-anne was earnestly begged to return and dine , and give [them]2623-the ladies all the rest of the day , but [her]89-anne spirits had been so long exerted that at present [she]89-anne felt unequal to more , and fit only for [home]1756-home , where [she]89-anne might be sure of being as silent as [she]89-anne chose . Promising to be with [them]2623-the ladies the whole of the following morning , therefore , [she]89-anne closed the fatigues of the present by a toilsome walk to [Camden Place]53-camden place , there to spend the evening chiefly in listening to the busy arrangements of [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth and [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay for the morrow ’s party , the frequent enumeration of [the persons invited]1556-the persons invited , and the continually improving detail of all the embellishments which were to make it the most completely elegant of [its]1557-its kind in [Bath]9-bath , while harassing [herself]89-anne with the never - ending question , of whether [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth would come or not ? [They]2623-the ladies were reckoning [him]112-captain wentworth as certain , but with [her]89-anne it was a gnawing solicitude never appeased for five minutes together . [She]89-anne generally thought [he]112-captain wentworth would come , because [she]89-anne generally thought [he]112-captain wentworth ought ; but it was a case which [she]89-anne could not so shape into any positive act of duty or discretion , as inevitably to defy the suggestions of very opposite feelings . [She]89-anne only roused [herself]89-anne from the broodings of this restless agitation , to let [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay know that [she]89-anne had been seen with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot three hours after [his]112-captain wentworth being supposed to be out of [Bath]9-bath , for having watched in vain for some intimation of the interview from [the lady]2454-the lady [herself]2454-the lady , [she]89-anne determined to mention it , and it seemed to [her]89-anne there was guilt in [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ’s face as [she]89-anne listened . It was transient : cleared away in an instant ; but [Anne]89-anne could imagine [she]89-anne read there the consciousness of having , by some complication of mutual trick , or some overbearing authority of [his]112-captain wentworth , been obliged to attend ( perhaps for half an hour ) to [his]112-captain wentworth lectures and restrictions on [her]89-anne designs on [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . [She]89-anne exclaimed , however , with a very tolerable imitation of nature : — “ Oh ! dear ! very true . Only think , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , to [my]89-anne great surprise [I]89-anne met with [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot in [Bath Street]83-bath street . [I]89-anne was never more astonished . [He]98-mr elliot turned back and walked with [me]89-anne to [the Pump Yard]3431-the pump yard . [He]98-mr elliot had been prevented setting off for [Thornberry]219-thornberry , but [I]89-anne really forget by what ; for [I]89-anne was in a hurry , and could not much attend , and [I]89-anne can only answer for [his]98-mr elliot being determined not to be delayed in [his]98-mr elliot return . [He]98-mr elliot wanted to know how early [he]98-mr elliot might be admitted to - morrow . [He]98-mr elliot was full of ‘ to - morrow , ’ and it is very evident that [I]89-anne have been full of it too , ever since [I]89-anne entered [the house]1780-the house , and learnt the extension of [your]3433-your plan and all that had happened , or [my]89-anne seeing [him]98-mr elliot could never have gone so entirely out of [my]89-anne head . ”[89-anne] CHAPTER XXIII . One day only had passed since [Anne]89-anne ’s conversation with [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ; but a keener interest had succeeded , and [she]89-anne was now so little touched by [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s conduct , except by its effects in one quarter , that it became a matter of course the next morning , still to defer [her]89-anne explanatory visit in [Rivers Street]56-rivers street . [She]89-anne had promised to be with [the Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves from breakfast to dinner . [Her]89-anne faith was plighted , and [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s character , like [the Sultaness Scheherazade]220-the sultaness scheherazade ’s head , must live another day . [She]89-anne could not keep [her]89-anne appointment punctually , however ; the weather was unfavourable , and [she]89-anne had grieved over the rain on [[her]89-anne friends]1712-her friends ’ account , and felt it very much on [her]89-anne own , before [she]89-anne was able to attempt the walk . When [she]89-anne reached [the White Hart]80-the white hart , and made [her]89-anne way to [the proper apartment]1560-the proper apartment , [she]89-anne found [herself]89-anne neither arriving quite in time , nor [the first to arrive]1561-the first to arrive . The party before [her]89-anne were , [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles , talking to [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , and [Captain Harville]151-captain harville to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ; and [she]89-anne immediately heard that [Mary]90-mary and [Henrietta]117-henrietta , too impatient to wait , had gone out the moment it had cleared , but would be back again soon , and that the strictest injunctions had been left with [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles to keep [her]89-anne [there]1845-there till [they]1563-they returned . [She]89-anne had only to submit , sit down , be outwardly composed , and feel [herself]89-anne plunged at once in all the agitations which [she]89-anne had merely laid [her]89-anne account of tasting a little before the morning closed . There was no delay , no waste of time . [She]89-anne was deep in the happiness of such misery , or the misery of such happiness , instantly . Two minutes after [her]89-anne entering [the room]1874-the room , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth said — “ [We]3434-we will write the letter [we]3434-we were talking of , [Harville]151-captain harville , now , if [you]151-captain harville will give [me]112-captain wentworth materials . ”[112-captain wentworth] Materials were at hand , on a separate table ; [he]112-captain wentworth went to it , and nearly turning [his]112-captain wentworth back to [them]1565-them all , was engrossed by writing . [Mrs Musgrove]92-charles was giving [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft the history of [[her]92-charles eldest daughter]1566-her eldest daughter ’s engagement , and just in that inconvenient tone of voice which was perfectly audible while it pretended to be a whisper . [Anne]89-anne felt that [she]89-anne did not belong to the conversation , and yet , as [Captain Harville]151-captain harville seemed thoughtful and not disposed to talk , [she]89-anne could not avoid hearing many undesirable particulars ; such as , “ how [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove and [[my]107-mrs croft brother]472-my brother [Hayter]91-charles had met again and again to talk it over ; what [[my]107-mrs croft brother]472-my brother [Hayter]91-charles had said one day , and what [Mr Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove had proposed the next , and what had occurred to [[my]107-mrs croft sister]424-my sister [Hayter]91-charles , and what [the young people]2052-the young people had wished , and what [I]107-mrs croft said at first [I]107-mrs croft never could consent to , but was afterwards persuaded to think might do very well , ”[107-mrs croft] and a great deal in the same style of open - hearted communication : minutiae which , even with every advantage of taste and delicacy , which [good Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove could not give , could be properly interesting only to [the principals]1567-the principals . [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft was attending with great good - humour , and whenever [she]107-mrs croft spoke at all , it was very sensibly . [Anne]89-anne hoped [the gentlemen]1985-the gentlemen might each be too much self - occupied to hear . “ And so , [ma’am]648-ma’am , all these thing considered , ”[114-mrs musgrove] said [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , in [her]107-mrs croft powerful whisper , “ though [we]3440-we could have wished it different , yet , altogether , [we]3440-we did not think it fair to stand out any longer , for [Charles Hayter]91-charles was quite wild about it , and [Henrietta]117-henrietta was pretty near as bad ; and so [we]3440-we thought [they]3440-we had better marry at once , and make the best of it , as [many others]3441-many others have done before [them]3440-we . At any rate , said [I]114-mrs musgrove , it will be better than a long engagement . ”[114-mrs musgrove] “ That is precisely what [I]107-mrs croft was going to observe , ”[107-mrs croft] cried [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft . “ [I]107-mrs croft would rather have [young people]3387-young people settle on a small income at once , and have to struggle with a few difficulties together , than be involved in a long engagement . [I]107-mrs croft always think that no mutual — ”[107-mrs croft] “ Oh ! dear [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , ”[114-mrs musgrove] cried [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , unable to let [her]107-mrs croft finish [her]107-mrs croft speech , “ there is nothing [I]114-mrs musgrove so abominate for [young people]3387-young people as a long engagement . It is what [I]114-mrs musgrove always protested against for [[my]114-mrs musgrove children]1124-my children . It is all very well , [I]114-mrs musgrove used to say , for [young people]3387-young people to be engaged , if there is a certainty of [their]3387-young people being able to marry in six months , or even in twelve ; but a long engagement — ”[114-mrs musgrove] “ Yes , [dear ma’am]3446-dear ma’am , ”[107-mrs croft] said [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , “ or an uncertain engagement , an engagement which may be long . To begin without knowing that at such a time there will be the means of marrying , [I]107-mrs croft hold to be very unsafe and unwise , and what [I]107-mrs croft think [all parents]3447-all parents should prevent as far as [they]3447-all parents can . ”[107-mrs croft] [Anne]89-anne found an unexpected interest here . [She]89-anne felt its application to [herself]89-anne , felt it in a nervous thrill all over [her]89-anne ; and at the same moment that [her]89-anne eyes instinctively glanced towards the distant table , [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s pen ceased to move , [his]112-captain wentworth head was raised , pausing , listening , and [he]112-captain wentworth turned round the next instant to give a look , one quick , conscious look at [her]89-anne . [The two ladies]2777-the two ladies continued to talk , to re - urge the same admitted truths , and enforce [them]1570-them with such examples of the ill effect of a contrary practice as had fallen within [their]2777-the two ladies observation , but [Anne]89-anne heard nothing distinctly ; it was only a buzz of words in [her]89-anne ear , [her]89-anne mind was in confusion . [Captain Harville , who had in truth been hearing none of it , now left [his]151-captain harville seat]151-captain harville , and moved to a window , and [Anne]89-anne seeming to watch [him]151-captain harville , though it was from thorough absence of mind , became gradually sensible that [he]151-captain harville was inviting [her]89-anne to join [him]151-captain harville where [he]151-captain harville stood .
