[He]151-captain harville looked at [her]89-anne with a smile , and a little motion of the head , which expressed , “ Come to [me]151-captain harville , [I]151-captain harville have something to say ; ”[151-captain harville] and the unaffected , easy kindness of manner which denoted the feelings of [an older acquaintance]1571-an older acquaintance than [he]151-captain harville really was , strongly enforced the invitation . [She]89-anne roused [herself]89-anne and went to [him]151-captain harville . The window at which [he]151-captain harville stood was at the other end of [the room]1874-the room from where [the two ladies]2777-the two ladies were sitting , and though nearer to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s table , not very near . As [she]89-anne joined [him]151-captain harville , [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ’s countenance re - assumed the serious , thoughtful expression which seemed its natural character . “ Look here , ”[151-captain harville] said [he]151-captain harville , unfolding a parcel in [his]151-captain harville hand , and displaying a small miniature painting , “ do [you]89-anne know who that is ? ”[151-captain harville] “ Certainly : [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ Yes , and [you]89-anne may guess who it is for . But , ”[151-captain harville] ( in a deep tone ) , “ it was not done for [her]89-anne . [Miss Elliot]89-anne , do [you]89-anne remember [our]3448-our walking together at [Lyme]43-lyme , and grieving for [him]151-captain harville ? [I]151-captain harville little thought then — but no matter . This was drawn at [the Cape]50-the cape . [He]151-captain harville met with [a clever young German artist]3449-a clever young german artist at [the Cape]3450-the cape , and in compliance with a promise to [[my]151-captain harville poor sister]3451-my poor sister , sat to [him]151-captain harville , and was bringing it [home]1756-home for [her]89-anne ; and [I]151-captain harville have now the charge of getting it properly set for another ! It was a commission to [me]151-captain harville ! But who else was there to employ ? [I]151-captain harville hope [I]151-captain harville can allow for [him]151-captain harville . [I]151-captain harville am not sorry , indeed , to make it over to another . [He]151-captain harville undertakes it ; ”[151-captain harville] ( looking towards [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , ) “ [he]112-captain wentworth is writing about it now . ”[112-captain wentworth] And with a quivering lip [he]112-captain wentworth wound up the whole by adding , “ [Poor Fanny]155-fanny harville ! [she]155-fanny harville would not have forgotten [him]151-captain harville so soon ! ”[112-captain wentworth] “ No , ”[89-anne] replied [Anne]89-anne , in a low , feeling voice . “ That [I]89-anne can easily believe . ”[89-anne] “ It was not in [her]155-fanny harville nature . [She]155-fanny harville doted on [him]151-captain harville . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ It would not be the nature of [any woman who truly loved]3453-any woman who truly loved . ”[151-captain harville] [Captain Harville]151-captain harville smiled , as much as to say , “ Do [you]89-anne claim that for [your]89-anne sex ? ”[151-captain harville] and [she]89-anne answered the question , smiling also , “ Yes . [We]3454-our certainly do not forget [you]112-captain wentworth as soon as [you]112-captain wentworth forget [us]3454-our . It is , perhaps , [our]3454-our fate rather than [our]3454-our merit . [We]3454-our can not help [ourselves]3454-our . [We]3454-our live at [home]1756-home , quiet , confined , and [our]3454-our feelings prey upon [us]3454-our . [You]112-captain wentworth are forced on exertion . [You]112-captain wentworth have always a profession , pursuits , business of some sort or other , to take [you]112-captain wentworth back into [the world]1711-the world immediately , and continual occupation and change soon weaken impressions . ”[89-anne] “ Granting [your]112-captain wentworth assertion that [the world]1711-the world does all this so soon for [men]304-men ( which , however , [I]112-captain wentworth do not think [I]112-captain wentworth shall grant ) , it does not apply to [Benwick]153-captain benwick . [He]153-captain benwick has not been forced upon any exertion . The peace turned [him]153-captain benwick on [shore]2154-shore at the very moment , and [he]153-captain benwick has been living with [us]3454-our , in [[our]3454-our little family circle]3460-our little family circle , ever since . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ True , ”[89-anne] said [Anne]89-anne , “ very true ; [I]89-anne did not recollect ; but what shall [we]3454-our say now , [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ? If the change be not from outward circumstances , it must be from within ; it must be nature , [man]2586-man ’s nature , which has done the business for [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick . ”[89-anne] “ No , no , it is not [man]2586-man ’s nature . [I]112-captain wentworth will not allow it to be more [man]2586-man ’s nature than [woman]2587-woman ’s to be inconstant and forget those [they]3465-they do love , or have loved . [I]112-captain wentworth believe the reverse . [I]112-captain wentworth believe in a true analogy between [our]3454-our bodily frames and [our]3454-our mental ; and that as [our]3454-our bodies are the strongest , so are [our]3454-our feelings ; capable of bearing most rough usage , and riding out the heaviest weather . ”[112-captain wentworth] “ [Your]151-captain harville feelings may be the strongest , ”[89-anne] replied [Anne]89-anne , “ but the same spirit of analogy will authorise [me]89-anne to assert that [ours]3454-our are the most tender . [Man]2586-man is more robust than [woman]2587-woman , but [he]2586-man is not longer lived ; which exactly explains [my]89-anne view of the nature of [their]3465-they attachments . Nay , it would be too hard upon [you]151-captain harville , if it were otherwise . [You]151-captain harville have difficulties , and privations , and dangers enough to struggle with . [You]151-captain harville are always labouring and toiling , exposed to every risk and hardship . [[Your]151-captain harville home]3468-your home , [country]3469-country , [friends]2598-friends , all quitted . Neither time , nor health , nor life , to be called [your]151-captain harville own . It would be hard , indeed ”[89-anne] ( with a faltering voice ) , “ if [woman]2587-woman ’s feelings were to be added to all this . ”[89-anne] “ [We]1574-we shall never agree upon this question , ”[151-captain harville] [Captain Harville]151-captain harville was beginning to say , when a slight noise called [their]1574-we attention to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s hitherto perfectly quiet division of [the room]1874-the room . It was nothing more than that [his]151-captain harville pen had fallen down ; but [Anne]89-anne was startled at finding [him]151-captain harville nearer than [she]89-anne had supposed , and half inclined to suspect that the pen had only fallen because [he]151-captain harville had been occupied by them , striving to catch sounds , which yet [she]89-anne did not think [he]151-captain harville could have caught . “ Have [you]89-anne finished [your]89-anne letter ? ”[151-captain harville] said [Captain Harville]151-captain harville . “ Not quite , a few lines more . [I]151-captain harville shall have done in five minutes . ”[151-captain harville] “ There is no hurry on [my]151-captain harville side . [I]151-captain harville am only ready whenever [you]89-anne are . [I]151-captain harville am in very good anchorage here , ”[151-captain harville] ( smiling at [Anne]89-anne ) , “ well supplied , and want for nothing . No hurry for a signal at all . Well , [Miss Elliot]89-anne , ”[151-captain harville] ( lowering [his]151-captain harville voice ) , “ as [I]151-captain harville was saying , [we]3472-we shall never agree , [I]151-captain harville suppose , upon this point . [No man]3473-no man and [woman]2587-woman would , probably . But let [me]151-captain harville observe that all histories are against [you]89-anne — all stories , prose and verse . If [I]151-captain harville had such a memory as [Benwick]153-captain benwick , [I]151-captain harville could bring [you]89-anne fifty quotations in a moment on [my]151-captain harville side the argument , and [I]151-captain harville do not think [I]151-captain harville ever opened a book in [my]151-captain harville life which had not something to say upon [woman]2587-woman ’s inconstancy . Songs and proverbs , all talk of [woman]2587-woman ’s fickleness . But perhaps [you]89-anne will say , these were all written by [men]304-men . ”[151-captain harville] “ Perhaps [I]151-captain harville shall . Yes , yes , if [you]89-anne please , no reference to examples in books . [Men]304-men have had every advantage of [us]3479-we in telling [their]304-men own story . Education has been [theirs]304-men in so much higher a degree ; the pen has been in [their]304-men hands . [I]151-captain harville will not allow books to prove anything . ”[151-captain harville] “ But how shall [we]3479-we prove anything ? ”[151-captain harville] “ [We]3479-we never shall . [We]3479-we never can expect to prove any thing upon such a point . It is a difference of opinion which does not admit of proof . [We]3479-we each begin , probably , with a little bias towards [our]3479-we own sex ; and upon that bias build every circumstance in favour of it which has occurred within [our]3479-we own circle ; many of which circumstances ( perhaps those very cases which strike [us]3479-we the most ) may be precisely such as can not be brought forward without betraying a confidence , or in some respect saying what should not be said . ”[151-captain harville] “ Ah ! ”[151-captain harville] cried [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , in a tone of strong feeling , “ if [I]1576-i could but make [you]89-anne comprehend what [a man]307-a man suffers when [he]307-a man takes a last look at [[his]307-a man wife]1699-his wife and [children]1901-children , and watches [the boat that [he]307-a man has sent [them]304-men off in]3483-the boat that he has sent them off in , as long as it is in sight , and then turns away and says , ‘ [God]135-god knows whether [we]3479-we ever meet again ! ’ And then , if [I]1576-i could convey to [you]89-anne the glow of [his]307-a man soul when [he]307-a man does see [them]304-men again ; when , coming back after [a twelvemonth]3484-a twelvemonth ’s absence , perhaps , and obliged to put into another port , [he]307-a man calculates how soon it be possible to get [them]304-men there , pretending to deceive [himself]307-a man , and saying , ‘ [They]304-men can not be here till such a day , ’ but all the while hoping for [them]304-men twelve hours sooner , and seeing [them]304-men arrive at last , as if [Heaven]130-heaven had given [them]304-men wings , by many hours sooner still ! If [I]1576-i could explain to [you]89-anne all this , and all that [a man]307-a man can bear and do , and glories to do , for the sake of these treasures of [his]307-a man existence ! [I]1576-i speak , [you]89-anne know , only of [such men as have hearts]3486-such men as have hearts ! ”[1576-i] pressing [his]1576-i own with emotion . “ Oh ! ”[89-anne] cried [Anne]89-anne eagerly , “ [I]89-anne hope [I]89-anne do justice to all that is felt by [you]89-anne , and by those who resemble [you]89-anne . God forbid that [I]89-anne should undervalue the warm and faithful feelings of any of [[my]89-anne fellow - creatures]3487-my fellow - creatures ! [I]89-anne should deserve utter contempt if [I]89-anne dared to suppose that true attachment and constancy were known only by [woman]2587-woman . No , [I]89-anne believe [you]89-anne capable of everything great and good in [your]89-anne married lives . [I]89-anne believe [you]89-anne equal to every important exertion , and to every domestic forbearance , so long as — if [I]89-anne may be allowed the expression — so long as [you]89-anne have an object . [I]89-anne mean while [the woman [you]89-anne love]3489-the woman you love lives , and lives for [you]89-anne . All the privilege [I]89-anne claim for [my]89-anne own sex ( it is not a very enviable one ; [you]89-anne need not covet it ) , is that of loving longest , when existence or when hope is gone . ”[89-anne] [She]1577-her could not immediately have uttered another sentence ; [her]1577-her heart was too full , [her]1577-her breath too much oppressed . “ [You]1577-her are [a good soul]3490-a good soul , ”[151-captain harville] cried [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , putting [his]151-captain harville hand on [her]1577-her arm , quite affectionately . “ There is no quarrelling with [you]1577-her . And when [I]151-captain harville think of [Benwick]153-captain benwick , [my]151-captain harville tongue is tied . ”[151-captain harville] [Their]1578-we attention was called towards [the others]1828-the others . [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft was taking leave . “ Here , [Frederick]112-captain wentworth , [you]112-captain wentworth and [I]107-mrs croft part [company]3491-company , [I]107-mrs croft believe , ”[107-mrs croft] said [she]107-mrs croft . “ [I]107-mrs croft am going [home]1756-home , and [you]112-captain wentworth have an engagement with [[your]112-captain wentworth friend]826-your friend . To - night [we]1578-we may have the pleasure of all meeting again at [your]112-captain wentworth party , ”[107-mrs croft] ( turning to [Anne]89-anne ) . “ [We]1578-we had [[your]112-captain wentworth sister]426-your sister ’s card yesterday , and [I]107-mrs croft understood [Frederick]112-captain wentworth had a card too , though [I]107-mrs croft did not see it ; and [you]112-captain wentworth are disengaged , [Frederick]112-captain wentworth , are [you]112-captain wentworth not , as well as [ourselves]1578-we ? ”[107-mrs croft] [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth was folding up a letter in great haste , and either could not or would not answer fully . “ Yes , ”[112-captain wentworth] said [he]112-captain wentworth , “ very true ; here [we]1578-we separate , but [Harville]151-captain harville and [I]112-captain wentworth shall soon be after [you]112-captain wentworth ; that is , [Harville]151-captain harville , if [you]112-captain wentworth are ready , [I]112-captain wentworth am in half a minute . [I]112-captain wentworth know [you]112-captain wentworth will not be sorry to be off . [I]112-captain wentworth shall be at [your]112-captain wentworth service in half a minute . ”[112-captain wentworth] [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft left [them]1580-them , and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , having sealed [his]112-captain wentworth letter with great rapidity , was indeed ready , and had even a hurried , agitated air , which [shewed]1581-shewed impatience to be gone . [Anne]89-anne knew not how to understand it . [She]89-anne had the kindest “ Good morning , God bless [you]112-captain wentworth ! ”[89-anne] from [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , but from [him]151-captain harville not a word , nor a look ! [He]151-captain harville had passed out of [the room]1874-the room without a look ! [She]89-anne had only time , however , to move closer to the table where [he]151-captain harville had been writing , when footsteps were heard returning ; the door opened , it was [himself]151-captain harville . [He]151-captain harville begged [their]1580-them pardon , but [he]151-captain harville had forgotten [his]151-captain harville gloves , and instantly crossing [the room]1874-the room to the writing table , [he]151-captain harville drew out a letter from under the scattered paper , placed it before [Anne]89-anne with eyes of glowing entreaty fixed on [her]89-anne for a time , and hastily collecting [his]151-captain harville gloves , was again out of [the room]1874-the room , almost before [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove was aware of [his]151-captain harville being in it : the work of an instant ! The revolution which one instant had made in [Anne]89-anne , was almost beyond expression . The letter , with a direction hardly legible , to “ [Miss A. E.]221-miss a. e. — , ”[151-captain harville] was evidently the one which [he]151-captain harville had been folding so hastily . While supposed to be writing only to [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick , [he]151-captain harville had been also addressing [her]89-anne ! On the contents of that letter depended all which [this world]1585-this world could do for [her]89-anne . Anything was possible , anything might be defied rather than suspense . [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove had little arrangements of [her]89-anne own at [her]89-anne own table ; to [their]1586-their protection [she]89-anne must trust , and sinking into the chair which [he]151-captain harville had occupied , succeeding to the very spot where [he]151-captain harville had leaned and written , [her]89-anne eyes devoured the following words : “ [I]89-anne can listen no longer in silence . [I]89-anne must speak to [you]3495-you by such means as are within [my]89-anne reach . [You]3495-you pierce [my]89-anne soul . [I]89-anne am half agony , half hope . Tell [me]89-anne not that [I]89-anne am too late , that such precious feelings are gone for ever . [I]89-anne offer [myself]89-anne to [you]3495-you again with a heart even more [your]3495-you own than when [you]3495-you almost broke it , eight years and a half ago . Dare not say [that man]790-that man forgets sooner than [woman]2587-woman , that [his]790-that man love has an earlier death . [I]89-anne have loved none but [you]3495-you . Unjust [I]89-anne may have been , weak and resentful [I]89-anne have been , but never inconstant . [You]3495-you alone have brought [me]89-anne to [Bath]9-bath . For [you]3495-you alone , [I]89-anne think and plan . Have [you]3495-you not seen this ? Can [you]3495-you fail to have understood [my]89-anne wishes ? [I]89-anne had not waited even these ten days , could [I]89-anne have read [your]3495-you feelings , as [I]89-anne think [you]3495-you must have penetrated [mine]89-anne . [I]89-anne can hardly write . [I]89-anne am every instant hearing something which overpowers [me]89-anne . [You]3495-you sink [your]3495-you voice , but [I]89-anne can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on [others]1859-others . Too good , [too excellent creature]3499-too excellent creature ! [You]3495-you do [us]3500-us justice , indeed . [You]3495-you do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among [men]304-men . Believe it to be most fervent , most undeviating , in F. W. “[89-anne] [I]0-i must go , uncertain of [my]0-i fate ; but [I]0-i shall return hither , or follow [[your]1587-your party]1249-your party , as soon as possible . A word , a look , will be enough to decide whether [I]0-i enter [[[your]1587-your father]240-your father ’s house]1590-your father ’s house this evening or never . ” Such a letter was not to be soon recovered from . Half an hour ’s solitude and reflection might have tranquillized [her]89-anne ; but the ten minutes only which now passed before [she]89-anne was interrupted , with all the restraints of [her]89-anne situation , could do nothing towards tranquillity . Every moment rather brought fresh agitation . It was overpowering happiness . And before [she]89-anne was beyond the first stage of full sensation , [Charles]91-charles , [Mary]90-mary , and [Henrietta]117-henrietta all came in . The absolute necessity of seeming like [herself]89-anne produced then an immediate struggle ; but after a while [she]89-anne could do no more . [She]89-anne began not to understand a word [they]3502-they said , and was obliged to plead indisposition and excuse [herself]89-anne . [They]3502-they could then see that [she]89-anne looked very ill , were shocked and concerned , and would not stir without [her]89-anne for [the world]1711-the world . This was dreadful . Would [they]3502-they only have gone away , and left [her]89-anne in [the quiet possession of [that room]3263-that room]3504-the quiet possession of that room it would have been [her]89-anne cure ; but to have [them]3502-they all standing or waiting around [her]89-anne was distracting , and in desperation , [she]89-anne said [she]89-anne would go [home]1756-home . “[1587-your] By all means , [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear , ” cried [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , “[1587-your] go [home]1756-home directly , and take care of [yourself]351-my dear , that [you]351-my dear may be fit for the evening . [I]0-i wish [Sarah]168-sarah thither was here to doctor [you]351-my dear , but [I]0-i am [no doctor]1593-no doctor [myself]0-i . [Charles]91-charles , ring and order a chair . [She]168-sarah thither must not walk . ” But the chair would never do . Worse than all ! To lose the possibility of speaking two words to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth in the course of [her]89-anne quiet , solitary progress up [the town]2536-the town ( and [she]89-anne felt almost certain of meeting [him]112-captain wentworth ) could not be borne . The chair was earnestly protested against , and [Mrs Musgrove]114-mrs musgrove , who thought only of one sort of illness , having assured [herself]114-mrs musgrove with some anxiety , that there had been no fall in the case ; that [Anne]89-anne had not at any time lately slipped down , and got a blow on [her]89-anne head ; that [she]89-anne was perfectly convinced of having had no fall ; could part with [her]89-anne cheerfully , and depend on finding [her]89-anne better at night . Anxious to omit no possible precaution , [Anne]89-anne struggled , and said — “[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid , [ma’am]648-ma’am , that it is not perfectly understood . Pray be so good as to mention to [the other gentlemen]1595-the other gentlemen that [we]1596-we hope to see [your]648-ma’am whole party this evening . [I]0-i am afraid there had been some mistake ; and [I]0-i wish [you]648-ma’am particularly to assure [Captain Harville]151-captain harville and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , that [we]1596-we hope to see [them]1597-them both . ” “[0-i] Oh ! [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear , it is quite understood , [I]0-i give [you]351-my dear [my]0-i word . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville has no thought but of going . ” “[648-ma’am] Do [you]648-ma’am think so ? But [I]0-i am afraid ; and [I]0-i should be so very sorry . Will [you]648-ma’am promise [me]0-i to mention it , when [you]648-ma’am see [them]1597-them again ? [You]648-ma’am will see [them]1597-them both this morning , [I]0-i dare say . Do promise [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] To be sure [I]0-i will , if [you]648-ma’am wish it . [Charles]91-charles , if [you]648-ma’am see [Captain Harville]151-captain harville anywhere , remember to give [Miss Anne]89-anne ’s message . But indeed , [[my]0-i dear]351-my dear , [you]648-ma’am need not be uneasy . [Captain Harville]151-captain harville holds [himself]151-captain harville quite engaged , [I]0-i ’ll answer for it ; and [Captain Wentworth]151-captain harville the same , [I]0-i dare say . ” [Anne]89-anne could do no more ; but [her]89-anne heart prophesied some mischance to damp the perfection of [her]89-anne felicity . It could not be very lasting , however . Even if [he]91-charles did not come to [Camden Place]53-camden place [himself]91-charles , it would be in [her]89-anne power to send an intelligible sentence by [Captain Harville]151-captain harville . Another momentary vexation occurred . [Charles]91-charles , in [his]91-charles real concern and good nature , would go [home]1756-home with [her]89-anne ; there was no preventing [him]91-charles . This was almost cruel . But [she]89-anne could not be long ungrateful ; [he]91-charles was sacrificing an engagement at [a gunsmith]3509-a gunsmith ’s , to be of use to [her]89-anne ; and [she]89-anne set off with [him]91-charles , with no feeling but gratitude apparent . [They]3510-they were on [Union Street]75-union street , when a quicker step behind , a something of familiar sound , gave [her]89-anne two moments ’ preparation for the sight of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . [He]91-charles joined [them]3510-they ; but , as if irresolute whether to join or to pass on , said nothing , only looked . [Anne]89-anne could command [herself]89-anne enough to receive that look , and not repulsively . The cheeks which had been pale now glowed , and the movements which had hesitated were decided . [He]91-charles walked by [her]89-anne side . [Presently]222-presently , struck by a sudden thought , [Charles]91-charles said — “[0-i] [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , which way are [you]112-captain wentworth going ? Only to [Gay Street]69-gay street , or farther up [the town]2536-the town ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hardly know , ” replied [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , surprised . “[0-i] Are [you]112-captain wentworth going as high as [Belmont]72-belmont ? Are [you]112-captain wentworth going near [Camden Place]53-camden place ? Because , if [you]112-captain wentworth are , [I]0-i shall have no scruple in asking [you]112-captain wentworth to take [my]0-i place , and give [Anne]89-anne [your]112-captain wentworth arm to [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father ’s door . [She]89-anne is rather done for this morning , and must not go so far without help , and [I]0-i ought to be at [[that fellow]1602-that fellow ’s in [the Market Place]1604-the market place]1603-that fellow ’s in the market place . [He]1745-her father promised [me]0-i the sight of a capital gun [he]1745-her father is just going to send off ; said [he]1745-her father would keep it unpacked to the last possible moment , that [I]0-i might see it ; and if [I]0-i do not turn back now , [I]0-i have no chance . By [his]1745-her father description , a good deal like the second size double - barrel of [mine]0-i , which [you]112-captain wentworth shot with one day round [Winthrop]40-winthrop . ” There could not be an objection . There could be only the most proper alacrity , a most obliging compliance for public view ; and smiles reined in and spirits dancing in private rapture . In half a minute [Charles]91-charles was at the bottom of [Union Street]75-union street again , and the other two proceeding together : and soon words enough had passed between [them]3511-they to decide [their]3511-they direction towards [the comparatively quiet and retired gravel walk]3512-the comparatively quiet and retired gravel walk , where the power of conversation would make the present hour a blessing indeed , and prepare it for all the immortality which the happiest recollections of [their]3511-they own future lives could bestow . There [they]3511-they exchanged again those feelings and those promises which had once before seemed to secure everything , but which had been followed by so many , many years of division and estrangement . There [they]3511-they returned again into the past , more exquisitely happy , perhaps , in [their]3511-they re - union , than when it had been first projected ; more tender , more tried , more fixed in a knowledge of each other ’s character , truth , and attachment ; more equal to act , more justified in acting . And there , as [they]3511-they slowly paced the gradual ascent , heedless of [every group around [them]3511-they]3513-every group around them , seeing [neither sauntering politicians]3514-neither sauntering politicians , [bustling housekeepers]3515-bustling housekeepers , [flirting girls]3516-flirting girls , nor [nursery - maids]3517-nursery - maids and [children]1901-children , [they]3511-they could indulge in those retrospections and acknowledgements , and especially in those explanations of what had directly preceded the present moment , which were so poignant and so ceaseless in interest . All the little variations of the last week were gone through ; and of yesterday and to - day there could scarcely be an end . [She]3519-her had not mistaken [him]91-charles . Jealousy of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had been the retarding weight , the doubt , the torment . That had begun to operate in the very hour of first meeting [her]3519-her in [Bath]9-bath ; that had returned , after a short suspension , to ruin the concert ; and that had influenced [him]91-charles in everything [he]91-charles had said and done , or omitted to say and do , in the last four - and - twenty hours . It had been gradually yielding to the better hopes which [her]3519-her looks , or words , or actions occasionally encouraged ; it had been vanquished at last by those sentiments and those tones which had reached [him]91-charles while [she]3519-her talked with [Captain Harville]151-captain harville ; and under the irresistible governance of which [he]91-charles had seized a sheet of paper , and poured out [his]91-charles feelings . Of what [he]91-charles had then written , nothing was to be retracted or qualified . [He]91-charles persisted in having loved none but [her]3519-her . [She]3519-her had never been supplanted . [He]91-charles never even believed [himself]91-charles to see [her]3519-her equal . Thus much indeed [he]91-charles was obliged to acknowledge : that [he]91-charles had been constant unconsciously , nay unintentionally ; that [he]91-charles had meant to forget [her]3519-her , and believed it to be done . [He]91-charles had imagined [himself]91-charles indifferent , when [he]91-charles had only been angry ; and [he]91-charles had been unjust to [her]3519-her merits , because [he]91-charles had been [a sufferer]3520-a sufferer from [them]3521-them . [Her]3519-her character was now fixed on [his]91-charles mind as perfection itself , maintaining the loveliest medium of fortitude and gentleness ; but [he]91-charles was obliged to acknowledge that only at [Uppercross]3-uppercross had [he]91-charles learnt to do [her]3519-her justice , and only at [Lyme]43-lyme had [he]91-charles begun to understand [himself]91-charles . At [Lyme]43-lyme , [he]91-charles had received lessons of more than one sort . The passing admiration of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot had at least roused [him]91-charles , and the scenes on [the Cobb]2603-the cobb and at [[Captain Harville]151-captain harville ’s]3523-captain harville ’s had fixed [her]3519-her superiority . In [his]91-charles preceding attempts to attach [himself]91-charles to [Louisa Musgrove]118-louisa ( the attempts of angry pride ) , [he]91-charles protested that [he]91-charles had for ever felt it to be impossible ; that [he]91-charles had not cared , could not care , for [Louisa]118-louisa ; though till that day , till the leisure for reflection which followed it , [he]91-charles had not understood the perfect excellence of the mind with which [Louisa]118-louisa ’s could so ill bear a comparison , or the perfect unrivalled hold it possessed over [his]91-charles own . There , [he]91-charles had learnt to distinguish between the steadiness of principle and the obstinacy of self - will , between the darings of heedlessness and the resolution of a collected mind . There [he]91-charles had seen everything to exalt in [his]91-charles estimation [the woman [he]91-charles had lost]3524-the woman he had lost ; and there begun to deplore the pride , the folly , the madness of resentment , which had kept [him]91-charles from trying to regain [her]118-louisa when thrown in [his]91-charles way . From that period [his]91-charles penance had become severe . [He]91-charles had no sooner been free from the horror and remorse attending the first few days of [Louisa]118-louisa ’s accident , no sooner begun to feel [himself]91-charles alive again , than [he]91-charles had begun to feel [himself]91-charles , though alive , not at liberty . “[0-i] [I]0-i found , ” said [he]91-charles , “[0-i] that [I]0-i was considered by [Harville]151-captain harville [an engaged man]1605-an engaged man ! That neither [Harville]151-captain harville nor [[his]151-captain harville wife]1699-his wife entertained a doubt of [our]1607-our mutual attachment . [I]0-i was startled and shocked . To a degree , [I]0-i could contradict this instantly ; but , when [I]0-i began to reflect that [others]1859-others might have felt the same — [[her]1699-his wife own family]1765-her own family , nay , perhaps [herself]1699-his wife — [I]0-i was no longer at [my]0-i own disposal . [I]0-i was [hers]1699-his wife in honour if [she]1699-his wife wished it . [I]0-i had been unguarded . [I]0-i had not thought seriously on this subject before . [I]0-i had not considered that [my]0-i excessive intimacy must have its danger of ill consequence in many ways ; and that [I]0-i had no right to be trying whether [I]0-i could attach [myself]0-i to [either of [the girls]2123-the girls]1610-either of the girls , at the risk of raising even an unpleasant report , were there no other ill effects . [I]0-i had been grossly wrong , and must abide the consequences . ” [He]0-i found too late , in short , that [he]0-i had entangled [himself]0-i ; and that precisely as [he]0-i became fully satisfied of [his]0-i not caring for [Louisa]118-louisa at all , [he]0-i must regard [himself]0-i as bound to [her]118-louisa , if [her]118-louisa sentiments for [him]0-i were what [the Harvilles]152-the harvilles supposed . It determined [him]0-i to leave [Lyme]43-lyme , and await [her]118-louisa complete recovery elsewhere . [He]0-i would gladly weaken , by any fair means , whatever feelings or speculations concerning [him]0-i might exist ; and [he]0-i went , therefore , to [[his]0-i brother]2921-his brother ’s , meaning after a while to return to [Kellynch]5-kellynch , and act as circumstances might require . “[0-i] [I]0-i was six weeks with [Edward]123-edward , ” said [he]0-i , “[0-i] and saw [him]123-edward happy . [I]0-i could have no other pleasure . [I]0-i deserved none . [He]123-edward enquired after [you]1612-you very particularly ; asked even if [you]1612-you were personally altered , little suspecting that to [my]0-i eye [you]1612-you could never alter . ” [Anne]89-anne smiled , and let it pass . It was too pleasing a blunder for a reproach . It is something for [a woman]1730-a woman to be assured , in [her]1730-a woman eight - and - twentieth year , that [she]1730-a woman has not lost one charm of earlier youth ; but the value of such homage was inexpressibly increased to [Anne]89-anne , by comparing it with former words , and feeling it to be the result , not the cause of a revival of [his]0-i warm attachment . [He]0-i had remained in [Shropshire]39-shropshire , lamenting the blindness of [his]0-i own pride , and the blunders of [his]0-i own calculations , till at once released from [Louisa]118-louisa by the astonishing and felicitous intelligence of [her]118-louisa engagement with [Benwick]153-captain benwick . “[123-edward] Here , ” said [he]0-i , “[123-edward] ended the worst of [my]0-i state ; for now [I]0-i could at least put [myself]0-i in the way of happiness ; [I]0-i could exert [myself]0-i ; [I]0-i could do something . But to be waiting so long in inaction , and waiting only for evil , had been dreadful . Within the first five minutes [I]0-i said , ‘ [I]0-i will be at [Bath]9-bath on Wednesday , ’ and [I]0-i was . Was it unpardonable to think it worth [my]0-i while to come ? and to arrive with some degree of hope ? [You]1613-you were single . It was possible that [you]1613-you might retain the feelings of the past , as [I]0-i did ; and [one encouragement]1614-one encouragement happened to be [mine]0-i . [I]0-i could never doubt that [you]1613-you would be loved and sought by [others]1859-others , but [I]0-i knew to a certainty that [you]1613-you had refused [one man]897-one man , at least , of better pretensions than [myself]0-i ; and [I]0-i could not help often saying , ‘ Was this for [me]0-i ? ’ ” [Their]3527-their first meeting in [Milsom Street]71-milsom street afforded much to be said , but the concert still more . That evening seemed to be made up of exquisite moments . The moment of [her]1613-you stepping forward in [the Octagon Room]3221-the octagon room to speak to [him]0-i : the moment of [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s appearing and tearing [her]1613-you away , and one or two subsequent moments , marked by returning hope or increasing despondency , were dwelt on with energy . “[0-i] To see [you]1613-you , ” cried [he]0-i , “[0-i] in the midst of [those who could not be [[my]0-i well - wishers]1618-my well - wishers ; to see [[your]1613-you cousin]820-your cousin close by [you]1613-you , conversing and smiling , and feel all the horrible eligibilities and proprieties of the match ! To consider it as the certain wish of [every being who could hope to influence [you]1613-you]1620-every being who could hope to influence you ! Even if [your]1613-you own feelings were reluctant or indifferent , to consider what powerful supports would be [his]0-i]1617-those who could not be my well - wishers ; to see your cousin close by you , conversing and smiling , and feel all the horrible eligibilities and proprieties of the match ! to consider it as the certain wish of every being who could hope to influence you ! even if your own feelings were reluctant or indifferent , to consider what powerful supports would be his ! Was it not enough to make the fool of [me]0-i which [I]0-i appeared ? How could [I]0-i look on without agony ? Was not the very sight of [the friend who sat behind [you]1613-you]1621-the friend who sat behind you , was not the recollection of what had been , the knowledge of [her]1621-the friend who sat behind you influence , the indelible , immoveable impression of what [persuasion]1622-persuasion had once done — was it not all against [me]0-i ? ” “[1613-you] [You]1613-you should have distinguished , ” replied [Anne]89-anne . “[1613-you] [You]1613-you should not have suspected [me]0-i now ; the case is so different , and [my]0-i age is so different . If [I]0-i was wrong in yielding to persuasion once , remember that it was to persuasion exerted on the side of safety , not of risk . When [I]0-i yielded , [I]0-i thought it was to duty , but no duty could be called in aid here . In marrying [a man indifferent to [me]0-i]1623-a man indifferent to me , all risk would have been incurred , and all duty violated . ” “[0-i] Perhaps [I]0-i ought to have reasoned thus , ” [he]0-i replied , “[0-i] but [I]0-i could not . [I]0-i could not derive benefit from the late knowledge [I]0-i had acquired of [your]1613-you character . [I]0-i could not bring it into play ; it was overwhelmed , buried , lost in those earlier feelings which [I]0-i had been smarting under year after year . [I]0-i could think of [you]1613-you only as [one who had yielded , who had given [me]0-i up , who had been influenced by [any one]2789-any one rather than by [me]0-i]1624-one who had yielded , who had given me up , who had been influenced by any one rather than by me . [I]0-i saw [you]1613-you with [the very person who had guided [you]1613-you in that year of misery]1626-the very person who had guided you in that year of misery . [I]0-i had no reason to believe [her]1626-the very person who had guided you in that year of misery of less authority now . The force of habit was to be added . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should have thought , ” said [Anne]89-anne , “[0-i] that [my]0-i manner to [yourself]1613-you might have spared [you]1613-you much or all of this . ” “[0-i] No , no ! [your]1613-you manner might be only the ease which [your]1613-you engagement to [another man]3148-another man would give . [I]0-i left [you]1613-you in this belief ; and yet , [I]0-i was determined to see [you]1613-you again . [My]0-i spirits rallied with the morning , and [I]0-i felt that [I]0-i had still a motive for remaining [here]376-here . ” At last [Anne]89-anne was at [home]1756-home again , and happier than [any one in [that house]1913-that house]3530-any one in that house could have conceived . All the surprise and suspense , and every other painful part of the morning dissipated by this conversation , [she]89-anne re - entered [the house]1780-the house so happy as to be obliged to find an alloy in some momentary apprehensions of its being impossible to last . An interval of meditation , serious and grateful , was the best corrective of everything dangerous in such high - wrought felicity ; and [she]89-anne went to [[her]89-anne room]3533-her room , and grew steadfast and fearless in the thankfulness of [her]89-anne enjoyment . The evening came , [the drawing - rooms]3534-the drawing - rooms were lighted up , [the company]3282-the company assembled . It was but a card party , it was but a mixture of [those who had never met before]3536-those who had never met before , and [those who met too often]3537-those who met too often ; a commonplace business , too numerous for intimacy , too small for variety ; but [Anne]89-anne had never found an evening shorter . Glowing and lovely in sensibility and happiness , and more generally admired than [she]89-anne thought about or cared for , [she]89-anne had cheerful or forbearing feelings for every creature around [her]89-anne . [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot was [there]1845-there ; [she]89-anne avoided , but [she]89-anne could pity [him]98-mr elliot . [The Wallises]76-the wallises , [she]89-anne had amusement in understanding [them]76-the wallises . [Lady Dalrymple]179-lady dalrymple and [Miss Carteret]176-miss carteret — [they]76-the wallises would soon be [innoxious cousins to [her]89-anne]3539-innoxious cousins to her . [She]89-anne cared not for [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay , and had nothing to blush for in the public manners of [[her]89-anne father]1745-her father and [sister]1740-sister . With [the Musgroves]115-the miss musgroves , there was the happy chat of perfect ease ; with [Captain Harville]151-captain harville , the kind - hearted intercourse of [brother]3542-brother and [sister]1740-sister ; with [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , attempts at conversation , which a delicious consciousness cut short ; with [Admiral]106-admiral croft and [Mrs Croft]107-mrs croft , everything of peculiar cordiality and fervent interest , which the same consciousness sought to conceal ; and with [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , some moments of communications continually occurring , and always the hope of more , and always the knowledge of [his]112-captain wentworth being there . It was in one of these short meetings , each apparently occupied in admiring a fine display of greenhouse plants , that [she]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now said — “[0-i] [I]0-i have been thinking over the past , and trying impartially to judge of the right and wrong , [I]0-i mean with regard to [myself]0-i ; and [I]0-i must believe that [I]0-i was right , much as [I]0-i suffered from it , that [I]0-i was perfectly right in being guided by [the friend whom [you]1630-you will love better than [you]1630-you do now]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now . To [me]0-i , [she]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now was in the place of [a parent]1631-a parent . Do not mistake [me]0-i , however . [I]0-i am not saying that [she]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now did not err in [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now advice . It was , perhaps , one of those cases in which advice is good or bad only as the event decides ; and for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i certainly never should , in any circumstance of tolerable similarity , give such advice . But [I]0-i mean , that [I]0-i was right in submitting to [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now , and that if [I]0-i had done otherwise , [I]0-i should have suffered more in continuing the engagement than [I]0-i did even in giving it up , because [I]0-i should have suffered in [my]0-i conscience . [I]0-i have now , as far as such a sentiment is allowable in human nature , nothing to reproach [myself]0-i with ; and if [I]0-i mistake not , a strong sense of duty is no bad part of [a woman]1730-a woman ’s portion . ” [He]0-i looked at [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now , looked at [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , and looking again at [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now , replied , as if in cool deliberation — “[0-i] Not yet . But there are hopes of [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now being forgiven in time . [I]0-i trust to being in charity with [her]1629-the friend whom you will love better than you do now soon . But [I]0-i too have been thinking over the past , and a question has suggested itself , whether there may not have been one person more [[my]0-i enemy]1633-my enemy even than [that lady]1634-that lady ? [[My]0-i own self]1635-my own self . Tell [me]0-i if , when [I]0-i returned to [England]16-england in the year eight , with a few thousand pounds , and was posted into [the Laconia]22-the laconia , if [I]0-i had then written to [you]1636-you , would [you]1636-you have answered [my]0-i letter ? Would [you]1636-you , in short , have renewed the engagement then ? ” “[1636-you] Would [I]0-i ! ” was all [her]1636-you answer ; but the accent was decisive enough . “[0-i] [Good God]135-god ! ” [he]0-i cried , “[1636-you] [you]1636-you would ! It is not that [I]0-i did not think of it , or desire it , as what could alone crown all [my]0-i other success ; but [I]0-i was proud , too proud to ask again . [I]0-i did not understand [you]1636-you . [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes , and would not understand [you]1636-you , or do [you]1636-you justice . This is a recollection which ought to make [me]0-i forgive every one sooner than [myself]0-i . Six years of separation and suffering might have been spared . It is a sort of pain , too , which is new to [me]0-i . [I]0-i have been used to the gratification of believing [myself]0-i to earn every blessing that [I]0-i enjoyed . [I]0-i have valued [myself]0-i on honourable toils and just rewards . Like [other great men under reverses]1637-other great men under reverses , ” [he]0-i added , with a smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i must endeavour to subdue [my]0-i mind to [my]0-i fortune . [I]0-i must learn to brook being happier than [I]0-i deserve . ” CHAPTER XXIV . Who can be in doubt of what followed ? When [any two young people]1638-any two young people take it into [their]1638-any two young people heads to marry , [they]1638-any two young people are pretty sure by perseverance to carry [their]1638-any two young people point , be [they]1638-any two young people ever so poor , or ever so imprudent , or ever so little likely to be necessary to [each other]1959-each other ’s ultimate comfort . This may be bad morality to conclude with , but [I]0-i believe it to be truth ; and if such parties succeed , how should [a Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth and [an Anne Elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right]1640-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right , and one independent fortune between [them]1640-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right , fail of bearing down every opposition ? [They]1640-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right might in fact , have borne down a great deal more than [they]1640-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right met with , for there was little to distress [them]1640-an anne elliot , with the advantage of maturity of mind , consciousness of right beyond the want of graciousness and warmth . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter made no objection , and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth did nothing worse than look cold and unconcerned . [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , with five - and - twenty thousand pounds , and as high in [his]112-captain wentworth profession as merit and activity could place [him]112-captain wentworth , was no longer [nobody]271-nobody . [He]112-captain wentworth was now esteemed quite worthy to address [the daughter of [a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain [himself]112-captain wentworth in the situation in which [Providence]113-providence had placed [him]112-captain wentworth]1643-a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain himself in the situation in which providence had placed him , and who could give [[his]112-captain wentworth daughter]1799-his daughter at present but a small part of the share of ten thousand pounds which must be [hers]1799-his daughter hereafter]1642-the daughter of a foolish , spendthrift baronet , who had not had principle or sense enough to maintain himself in the situation in which providence had placed him , and who could give his daughter at present but a small part of the share of ten thousand pounds which must be hers hereafter . [Sir Walter]86-sir walter , indeed , though [he]86-sir walter had no affection for [Anne]89-anne , and no vanity flattered , to make [him]86-sir walter really happy on the occasion , was very far from thinking it a bad match for [her]89-anne . On the contrary , when [he]86-sir walter saw more of [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , saw [him]112-captain wentworth repeatedly by daylight , and eyed [him]112-captain wentworth well , [he]86-sir walter was very much struck by [his]112-captain wentworth personal claims , and felt that [his]112-captain wentworth superiority of appearance might be not unfairly balanced against [her]89-anne superiority of rank ; and all this , assisted by [his]112-captain wentworth well - sounding name , enabled [Sir Walter]86-sir walter at last to prepare [his]86-sir walter pen , with a very good grace , for the insertion of the marriage in the volume of honour . [The only one among them , whose opposition of feeling could excite any serious anxiety]1645-the only one among them , whose opposition of feeling could excite any serious anxiety was [Lady Russell]97-lady russell . [Anne]89-anne knew that [Lady Russell]97-lady russell must be suffering some pain in understanding and relinquishing [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot , and be making some struggles to become truly acquainted with , and do justice to [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth . This however was what [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had now to do . [She]89-anne must learn to feel that [she]89-anne had been mistaken with regard to both ; that [she]89-anne had been unfairly influenced by appearances in each ; that because [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s manners had not suited [her]89-anne own ideas , [she]89-anne had been too quick in suspecting them to indicate a character of dangerous impetuosity ; and that because [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot ’s manners had precisely pleased [her]89-anne in [their]1646-their propriety and correctness , [their]1646-their general politeness and suavity , [she]89-anne had been too quick in receiving [them]1646-their as the certain result of the most correct opinions and well - regulated mind . There was nothing less for [Lady Russell]97-lady russell to do , than to admit that [she]97-lady russell had been pretty completely wrong , and to take up a new set of opinions and of hopes . There is a quickness of perception in some , a nicety in the discernment of character , a natural penetration , in short , which no experience in [others]1859-others can equal , and [Lady Russell]97-lady russell had been less gifted in this part of understanding than [[her]97-lady russell young friend]1853-her young friend . But [she]97-lady russell was [a very good woman]1649-a very good woman , and if [her]97-lady russell second object was to be sensible and well - judging , [her]97-lady russell first was to see [Anne]89-anne happy . [She]97-lady russell loved [Anne]89-anne better than [she]97-lady russell loved [her]97-lady russell own abilities ; and when the awkwardness of the beginning was over , found little hardship in attaching [herself]97-lady russell as [a mother to the man who was securing the happiness of [[her]97-lady russell other child]1651-her other child]1650-a mother to the man who was securing the happiness of her other child . Of all [the family]1782-the family , [Mary]90-mary was probably [the one most immediately gratified by the circumstance]1653-the one most immediately gratified by the circumstance . It was creditable to have [a sister]1871-a sister married , and [she]90-mary might flatter [herself]90-mary with having been greatly instrumental to the connexion , by keeping [Anne]89-anne with [her]90-mary in the autumn ; and as [[her]89-anne own sister]1978-her own sister must be better than [[[her]89-anne husband]347-her husband ’s sisters]1657-her husband ’s sisters , it was very agreeable that [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth should be [a richer man than either [Captain Benwick]153-captain benwick or [Charles Hayter]91-charles]1658-a richer man than either captain benwick or charles hayter . [She]89-anne had something to suffer , perhaps , when [they]1659-they came into contact again , in seeing [Anne]89-anne restored to the rights of seniority , and [the mistress of [a very pretty landaulette]1661-a very pretty landaulette]1660-the mistress of a very pretty landaulette ; but [she]89-anne had a future to look forward to , of powerful consolation . [Anne]89-anne had [no Uppercross Hall]85-no uppercross hall before [her]89-anne , [no landed estate]1662-no landed estate , no headship of [a family]1907-a family ; and if [they]1659-they could but keep [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth from being made [a baronet]1818-a baronet , [she]89-anne would not change situations with [Anne]89-anne . It would be well for [the eldest sister]1665-the eldest sister if [she]1665-the eldest sister were equally satisfied with [her]1665-the eldest sister situation , for a change is not very probable there . [She]89-anne had soon the mortification of seeing [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot withdraw , and [no one of proper condition]1666-no one of proper condition has since presented [himself]98-mr elliot to raise even the unfounded hopes which sunk with [him]98-mr elliot . The news of [[his]98-mr elliot cousin]2369-his cousin [Anne]89-anne ’s engagement burst on [Mr Elliot]98-mr elliot most unexpectedly . It deranged [his]98-mr elliot best plan of domestic happiness , [his]98-mr elliot best hope of keeping [Sir Walter]86-sir walter single by the watchfulness which [a son - in - law]1668-a son - in - law ’s rights would have given . But , though discomfited and disappointed , [he]98-mr elliot could still do something for [his]98-mr elliot own interest and [his]98-mr elliot own enjoyment . [He]98-mr elliot soon quitted [Bath]9-bath ; and on [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ’s quitting it soon afterwards , and being next heard of as established under [his]98-mr elliot protection in [London]6-london , it was evident how double a game [he]98-mr elliot had been playing , and how determined [he]98-mr elliot was to save [himself]98-mr elliot from being cut out by [one artful woman]1669-one artful woman , at least . [Mrs Clay]101-mrs clay ’s affections had overpowered [her]101-mrs clay interest , and [she]101-mrs clay had sacrificed , for [the young man]1781-the young man ’s sake , the possibility of scheming longer for [Sir Walter]86-sir walter . [She]101-mrs clay has abilities , however , as well as affections ; and it is now a doubtful point whether [his]86-sir walter cunning , or hers , may finally carry the day ; whether , after preventing [her]101-mrs clay from being [the wife of [Sir Walter]86-sir walter]1671-the wife of sir walter , [he]86-sir walter may not be wheedled and caressed at last into making [her]101-mrs clay [the wife of [Sir William]213-sir william]1672-the wife of sir william . It can not be doubted that [Sir Walter]86-sir walter and [Elizabeth]87-elizabeth were shocked and mortified by the loss of [[their]1673-their companion]1674-their companion , and the discovery of [their]1673-their deception in [her]101-mrs clay . [They]1673-their had [[their]1673-their great cousins]1675-their great cousins , to be sure , to resort to for comfort ; but [they]1673-their must long feel that to flatter and follow [others]1859-others , without being flattered and followed in turn , is but a state of half enjoyment . [Anne]89-anne , satisfied at a very early period of [Lady Russell]97-lady russell ’s meaning to love [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth as [she]89-anne ought , had no other alloy to the happiness of [her]89-anne prospects than what arose from the consciousness of having no relations to bestow on [him]112-captain wentworth which [a man of sense]1677-a man of sense could value . There [she]89-anne felt [her]89-anne own inferiority very keenly . The disproportion in [their]1673-their fortune was nothing ; it did not give [her]89-anne a moment ’s regret ; but to have [no family]1678-no family to receive and estimate [him]112-captain wentworth properly , nothing of respectability , of harmony , of good will to offer in return for all the worth and all the prompt welcome which met [her]89-anne in [[his]112-captain wentworth brothers]2822-his brothers and [sisters]2343-sisters , was a source of as lively pain as [her]89-anne mind could well be sensible of under circumstances of otherwise strong felicity . [She]89-anne had but [two friends in [the world]1711-the world]1681-two friends in the world to add to [his]112-captain wentworth list , [Lady Russell]97-lady russell and [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith . To those , however , [he]112-captain wentworth was very well disposed to attach [himself]112-captain wentworth . [Lady Russell]97-lady russell , in spite of all [her]97-lady russell former transgressions , [he]112-captain wentworth could now value from [his]112-captain wentworth heart . While [he]112-captain wentworth was not obliged to say that [he]112-captain wentworth believed [her]97-lady russell to have been right in originally dividing [them]1683-their , [he]112-captain wentworth was ready to say almost everything else in [her]97-lady russell favour , and as for [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith , [she]97-lady russell had claims of various kinds to recommend [her]97-lady russell quickly and permanently . [Her]97-lady russell recent good offices by [Anne]89-anne had been enough in [themselves]1683-their , and [their]1683-their marriage , instead of depriving [her]89-anne of [one friend]1684-one friend , secured [her]89-anne two . [She]97-lady russell was [[their]1683-their earliest visitor in [their]1683-their settled life]1685-their earliest visitor in their settled life ; and [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth , by putting [her]97-lady russell in the way of recovering [[[her]97-lady russell husband]347-her husband ’s property in [the West Indies]1433-the west indies]1687-her husband ’s property in the west indies , by writing for [her]97-lady russell , acting for [her]97-lady russell , and seeing [her]97-lady russell through all the petty difficulties of the case with the activity and exertion of [a fearless man]1689-a fearless man and [a determined friend]1690-a determined friend , fully requited the services which [she]97-lady russell had rendered , or ever meant to render , to [[his]347-her husband wife]1699-his wife . [Mrs Smith]181-mrs smith ’s enjoyments were not spoiled by this improvement of income , with some improvement of health , and the acquisition of [such friends]1692-such friends to be often with , for [her]181-mrs smith cheerfulness and mental alacrity did not fail [her]181-mrs smith ; and while these prime supplies of good remained , [she]181-mrs smith might have bid defiance even to greater accessions of worldly prosperity . [She]181-mrs smith might have been absolutely rich and perfectly healthy , and yet be happy . [Her]181-mrs smith spring of felicity was in the glow of [her]181-mrs smith spirits , as [[her]181-mrs smith friend]2014-her friend [Anne]89-anne ’s was in the warmth of [her]181-mrs smith heart . [Anne]89-anne was tenderness itself , and [she]181-mrs smith had the full worth of it in [Captain Wentworth]112-captain wentworth ’s affection . [His]347-her husband profession was all that could ever make [[her]181-mrs smith friends]1712-her friends wish that tenderness less , the dread of a future war all that could dim [her]181-mrs smith sunshine . [She]181-mrs smith gloried in being [[a sailor]276-a sailor ’s wife]1696-a sailor ’s wife , but [she]181-mrs smith must pay the tax of quick alarm for belonging to that profession which is , if possible , more distinguished in its domestic virtues than in its national importance . Finis * * * END OF THE PROJECT GUTENBERG EBOOK PERSUASION * * *
